name: Marsha S. Auster
title: leaky batteries
review: Not only did a few batteries leak they ruined one of my Gideon Flameless LED candles. I am so disappointed. I thought that with the Amazon name I would have a quality product. I purchase many products from the Amazon website.I would like a refund and a replacement for the ruined Gideion Flameless LED candle. I purchased three candles and the 6 inch candle is ruined.

name: B. Bourque
title: These batteries leak and will destroy electronic devices.
review: I usually love Amazon products, but hate these batteries. A pack of 36 AAA were purchased in 2015 and used in a number of items, ranging from clocks, multi-meters, IR temperature gauges, etc. Every single one of these devices that I have placed the Amazon batteries in, and left them for a couple years, has leaked causing serious damage to the product. Duracell and Energizer batteries have never leaked on me. Spend more money and get a quality battery that will not leak. Amazon should not be selling such a poor product that has caused many times the batteries original purchase price to my electronic devices.

name: D. Ross
title: Leaked and ruined a vehicle alarm remote control!
review: Unfortunately these batteries are not a quality product. I purchased a carton of them with expiration dates of 2027 yet they go dead quickly and LEAK! The only reason I tried this brand is due to many Duracell failures over the past couple of years including longevity and leakage. It seems to be a constant battle these days finding a decent battery at any price point and I'll assure you that THESE are NOT a decent battery. So now what? Well, I attempt to locate each piece of equipment into which these leakers were installed and replace them with a different brand. Not to mention I'll need to toss the remaining "good" (and I use that term loosely) batteries.

name: Westin S
title: Battery case ruptured!
review: Well I would have thought these batteries were great up until I opened my kids RC spider and found one of the batteries had ruptured. Don't think I've ever seen the case of a battery come apart like this. Ordered AC Delcos this time around. Some other reviewer posted performance data indicating they were the best bang for your buck. Had no problems prior to this one so I can't say it's a systemic issue but it is worthy of note.

name: T. Smiley
title: Something's Wrong!
review: Bought a new Amazon Firestick remote control (sweet puppy consumed the previous one). Had it for a couple of weeks and received an alert that the battery life was low and so I bought these Amazon batteries as a replacement. (I love Amazon, right!?) Received the batteries and changed them in the remote. Four days later the alert pops up on the TV that battery life was low again. Busy and consumed with teaching summer school and raising children, I thought maybe I just "thought" about replacing them before but didn't really do it. So I did do it (again) and sure enough, within 4-5 days the same alert appears. Replaced the batteries again in the remote. Last night, the same alert appears. ... Unbelievable! What is wrong with these batteries? At this rate of having to replace these batteries, I can't afford to watch free TV. I'll never buy these batteries again.

name: Michelle
title: Do not buy! Barely last or even works.
review: I bought these batteries for my closet automatic LED light strips that turn on for 30 seconds. I only go Into my closet 4 x a day but I would replace the batteries once a month. Then my Duracell batteries in my Thermostat died after five years. I replaced the Thermostst with Amazon batteries, would not turn on. I went through half the pack and finally one pair of Amazon batteries worked! Next day? Thermostat indicated low batteries and the screen barely can be read. Replaced the batteries in my thermostat with Enigizer batteries, no issues!

name: jan bush
title: Don't waste your money
review: I purchased these batteries to go in some led puck lights. Each light takes 3 batteries. I purchased them about 2 weeks ago and installed the lights. This morning the lights were already out, and I had to replace the batteries again. These lights are not in constant use, I'd say only used approximately 4 or 5 hours in the 2 weeks I've had them. The batteries are CRAP, and prove the adage, you get what you pay for.

name: D. Campisi
title: Considering the price as well as performance, I can't find a better deal on batteries
review: I had been buying Duracell batteries (AA, AAA, C, D) from Sam's Wholesale club because the bulk prices were better than small battery packages, but I switched to AmazonBasics. The reason is the price. Of course, that brings up the question of performance. Which is better? I have 3 kids and a zillion electronic toys. We replace batteries often around here, and frankly there are so many electronic toys, controllers, and remotes, that I have a hard time keeping up with performance of specific batteries. But I came to a realization after comparing prices between the 48 pack of AmazonBasics, and the 48-pack of Duracell at Sam's. For the batteries I was buying, the Duracells would have to last 66% longer to justify the price difference. Now I can't be sure which lasted longer, but I know for sure the Duracells I used to use were NOT lasting 66% longer than the AmazonBasics. They may have been better, but not THAT MUCH better. I'll stick with the AmazonBasics.

name: LMW
title: Buyer beware! Not safe!!
review: I added 4 of the batteries to my charger (also purchased from Amazon) and heard a popping noise in the middle of the night. Discovered the AAA batteries were popping or bursting or something. I‚Äôve used this charger before with other Amazon batteries, but never the orange colored ones. Not sure what‚Äôs different with the orange batteries but I will never purchase these again. Hoping my charger will still work.

name: Damon S.
title: Complete Garbage!  You get what you pay for...
review: These batteries are complete garbage. I have all sorts of dead batteries and some have exploded in my electronics and gadgets. It's that or they die very quickly. Which means there must be other dead cells in batteries that are in the chain. What people don't realize is, batteries work in a series. So when one battery dies, it works as a pass through after that which puts a greater strain on the rest of the batteries in the chain which can cause them to heat, swell or explode. You get what you pay for. I will not be buying anymore of these second class batteries. Energizer and Duracell cost what they do for a reason.

name: PCMR
title: If you like paying for 36, but only getting 24 batteries then THIS is the product for you
review: Box was open and only 24 batteries were in it. Not going to return as it‚Äôs not worth my time, but someone should know.

name: O. Albretsen
title: Work just fine and GREAT price!
review: Reading reviews here from people complaining about these batteries is pretty comical. The funniest thing was the amazing number of people crying and giving low score reviews because their batteries won't "charge up right."Wow, people today don't even understand the CONCEPT of disposable batteries, lol! For me, these are working just great. I bought a 20 pack for $7, which is about what 6 Duracells normally cost, so, value-wise, they'd have to be REALLY bad to make them a poor purchase. I've used about 8 of them in various electronic devices for a couple months now, and have had no leaking or weak power issues anywhere, so 20 solid AAA batteries for just $7 is a GREAT DEAL!I can't accurately speak about longevity after just a couple months, but everything else about this purchase is very satisfying.Update: it has now been 9 months since I bought these batteries, and have yet to encounter any negative issues (such as leaking or low power). I only use them in things that won't use much charge, such as remote controls. Thus far, I haven't had any of them run out of power.

name: Bec_O
title: LEAK LEAK LEAK
review: LEAKS GALORE! If one of your favorite things in life is to have your batteries leak in expensive toys and ruin the electrical components of said toys, these batteries are for you. These leaks occurred in toys that are used almost daily, so the batteries weren‚Äôt just sitting around unused. We even had a few batteries have the end cap come off of the - end. Fanfreakingtastic. This happened with both AA and AAA batteries and multiple batteries experienced the leaking. Saving a few bucks on Amazon branded batteries isn‚Äôt worth it compared to the value of the toys that were ruined.

name: Jamie
title: Battery life is very short.
review: I bought these batteries specifically for these lights that I turn on using the remote in photos privided for about 3 hours each evening. I have 5 lights. I put the amazon batteries in 3 and a name brand batteries in the remaining 2 lights. The amazon batteries are already dead and had to be replaced, whereas the name brand batteries are running strong. Very disappointed in the quality of the amazon basic aaa batteries.

name: Schpeen
title: Great Value, and Good batteries.
review: I was a bit skeptical to buy a non brand name battery but we go through so many batteries in my house I decided to give these a try. I have several friends and family that have purchased these and add good luck so I went ahead and bought them. Pretty impressed for the amount you get for the price, and they are performing just as good as name brand batteries I have gotten for years. I will now continue to get these for all sizes. Save your money, and get these.

name: Patrick Montoya
title: Great price
review: Last long

name: HY
title: Awful. Only 25 pct (indicator says so) using new batteries.
review: These are ridiculously overrated. I decided to give Amazon batteries another try after a bad experience the first time but I thought the price was right again. Shame on me. I ordered 48 batteries. I use them for automatic candles. I do not use them all at once and so when I tried to use a brand new package for a timer, the battery indicator kept flashing and it showed at about 25%. I opened another package of four out of this box, tried another brand new two batteries and the same thing happened. These might be great if you use them right away but if you hold onto them for a couple of months and try to use them later they are worthless. Beware and just go with Energizer or Duracell. This is a Complete total waste of money. Shame on Amazon. Of course it is too late for me to get any sort of refund so I have about 24 batteries that are only at 25%.

name: Colin Cameron
title: Packing by Amazon was Terrible
review: I like Amazon basics batteries but these came in way to big of a box with no paper or air pouches or anything to keep them from flying around inside and the actual box of batteries broke open to packs of batteries all over the shipping box.

name: D Beans
title: The Bunny Battery vs the Amazon AAA Battery
review: I like the prices of the Amazon brand batteries and decided to test them against the Energizer brand battery. I have two identical ThermoPro TP65A Indoor Outdoor Thermometer base units connected to three outdoor remote sensor units. I replaced the two AAA batteries in each unit at the same time, one with Energizer brand and the other with Amazon brand (gray) batteries. The units are in my kitchen on the side of the refrigerator, I see them every day. After 70 days I noticed the display on both units was not working. The unit with Energizer batteries faintly displayed only the lower indoor reading, and the unit with the Amazon batteries had a blank display. I tested the batteries with a ZTS Pulse Load Multi-Battery Tester. The Energizer batteries registered 20% power remaining, the Amazon batteries 10%. Neither battery had enough power remaining to power the display. Both displays quit working within 24 hours of each other. At half the price I consider the Amazon brand batteries a great value.

name: cocokru
title: Amazon AAA batteries
review: They seem to work okay except a few fell apart. Out of 10 used ina toy 1 (left in pic) started unraveling, 1 lost some of its color (middle) and the other 8 are fine (example to the right). I‚Äôve had batteries corrode before but never fall apart or change color so not sure if it‚Äôs okay or not but it sure makes me skeptical and I probably wouldn‚Äôt purchase again.

name: Bee
title: Solid little batteries.
review: It could be my imagination, but I feel like I go through less batteries with these than the brand name. I have noise canceling headphones I wear multiple times daily (working and walking to work), so I go through a lot of AAA batteries. However, since I switched to these I don't seem to! Or they just give me so many so cheaply I don't notice as much. Either way. Good buy!

name: watches the sky
title: Horrible life span!!
review: I suppose the most honest thing about them is in their name...BASIC!! I use them in my blood pressure monitor. I take my BP twice a day and it only takes about 10 seconds. The batteries only last about 6 weeks. I've also used them in my air conditioner remote which I might use once or twice a day, just to turn it on or off. Again, after about 5 - 6 weeks, they stop working. They are also used in my Alexa/Echo remote which is used more often, yet, they last about 3 months in it. This is the first Amazon labeled/made product that I have bought that was not rated a 5. Don't buy these if you are looking for a long lasting battery.

name: wood
title: Most are dead or have little charge
review: I bought these in October 2017 and now in January 2018 I put them in a device and it didn't work at all. These were brand new out of the pack and there is zero charge in the battery. Of course it's now too late to return them. I would not buy these again. The come in shrink wrapped packs of four batteries. I opened four different packs and they are all dead.

name: Don Dudley
title: Basic Battery, Basically Good
review: We have a lot of things in our house, that for some reason, require triple A batteries. We have clocks, remotes, thermometers, keyboards, and more that need these. We got poor performance from rechargeable batteries in a lot of these devices so I elected to go the old fashioned way. The Amazon Basics brand has always seemed to do well and their AAA batteries are the same. They last a decent amount of time. Case in point, my son's bluetooth keyboard only got about a month out of the rechargeable batteries. So far he has not even seen a hint of needing to replace these and it has been almost two months (about 1.75 months as of this review). I will probably always look to buy these in the future. Far cheaper than even four batteries at the local grocery store.

name: Tony S. Dutton
title: These batteries do not recharge with either my duracell or ...
review: These batteries do not recharge with either my duracell or other charger I've tried. I should say they do not charge the first time. Ended up tossing the whole bunch away. Either I'm doing something wrong or a whole lot of reviewers of this product are a lot luckier than me.OOps! My bad. I just now tried three more new batteries right out of the box and before trying to charge them, I put them directly into the flashlight. It worked perfectly, nice and bright. Evidently, I was trying to charge already fully charged batteries and kept getting the blinking red light on the charger. I went back to the trash can and pulled out about ten batteries I thought were defective. Live and learn. I take back all the bad I've said about these batteries. Yeah, my bad.

name: Alloftheabove
title: Haven‚Äôt had one fail yet
review: I‚Äôve used a lot of different brands of batteries and these have by far the most value when buying batteries regularly. I use them often for camera and audio equipment. I know some people are fans of rechargeable batteries but I‚Äôve found even the more expensive ones to start to lose their capacity after a couple dozen charges. The price of these batteries is such that I‚Äôm ok buying brand new ones for each new shoot. I‚Äôll take them out after the shoot and put them aside for remotes, flashlights and other items I‚Äôm ok with the battery dying and just heading up to the stash of half charged batteries for more. I do think some brands last longer than these but they are also way more expensive.

name: Benjamin Hendricks
title: Very Fast Drain
review: I often buy Amazon Basic products, and until I tried their batteries I've never had a complaint. But these batteries drain faster than any but the absolute cheapest I've ever used. So no bargain there. You get what you pay for with this, unlike most other Amazon branded items.

name: Anita F.
title: Can't beat the price & they last just as long as the more expensive brands.
review: I love to decorate for EVERY Holiday and EVERY Season.The majority of my Decorations either use batteries or need a battery operated candle.As one can imagine, I use ALOT of batteries. Buying the OVER PRICED Name Brand batteries was getting quite costly. I decided to try a store's generic brand. I was surprised that they were almost 1/2 the price yet worked just as long as the Name Brands.I do a lot of shopping on Amazon so I figured I'd give their generic brand a try too. You can NOT beat their price! I saved even more than I did buying the generic from the brick & mortar stores.I just started using them today.I used 24 today alone to light all of my Decorations. I've had them burning for 6hrs now. I have my Decorations set to come on for 6hours each night and then come back on again at the same time the next night. So, I will have them running every night for 6hours. So let's see how well these batteries hold up. I feel like they'll do the job comparible to the Name Brand batteries.UPDATE: Very pleased with the value and quality. These batteries last longer than expected and are dependable. I am a customer for life. P.S. Thank you for saving me money

name: Giovanni Nocturna
title: A really short-lived battery
review: I bought these AAA batteries mostly for use in high intensity flashlights, initially they work as well as other, more expensive batteries - but die a very premature death. While top end batteries last several hours, the AB ones started to dim after 15 - 20 minutes, and in some situations that can be very dangerous. I ended up just throwing out the rest of the package out because it's just not worth the risk of having a failure at the wrong time. 'The sting of poor quality lingers long after the pleasure of low price'

name: Susanna White
title: Batteries die very quickly
review: Purchased these for a few flawless LED candles that we had around the house for Christmas decor. After seeing the price, I was very excited to get a battery that according to other reviews would be great compared to the price of name brands batteries. A few of my candles took 3 batteries and some took 2, but within a week of installing these they started to die. Now, these candles were on a timer to turn on each day for six hours. That means the life of these batteries wasn't enough to for three of them to power an led candle for more than 42 hours before they started failing. Not worth the money I paid for this product.

name: Mullanphy Lane
title: this time I was sold a bill of goods
review: I purchased a package of AmazonBasics 4-Count AAA High-Performance Alkaline Batteries, 10-Year Shelf Life, Easy to Open Value Pack... because the price was less than brand name batteries. I figured one battery is pretty much the same as another. I was wrong.When the batteries arrived I put two of them in my Sony digital audio recorder because the brand name batteries in had died after nearly a year's use. The two Amazon batteries were completely drained in less than 30 days, during which the recorder was not used at all. The claim is that they have a 3 year shelf life, but they leave out the fact that, once put into use, they last less than a month.I've purchased Amazon Basics products in the past and those products were satisfactory, but this time I was sold a bill of goods.

name: aly.me
title: SO good!
review: Came in a cardboard box that holds all the batteries perfectly that is reusable so you can close it easily with all the batteries in it, not like an awkward plastic packaging like most batteries. And when you open that box, they are grouped and plastic wrapped in 4‚Äôs which is awesome!! Super easy to use, and close up when done, I‚Äôm a fan! Using them in lots of little LED desk lights for crafting, remote controls for fire sticks, and now some Christmas lights and I don‚Äôt know if they last the same as other name brands but I feel like they last longer?! I‚Äôve had them in this LED light that I swear would normally have been dead weeks ago! So I will buy these amazon basics batteries from now on!

name: Kathy and Vince
title: Junk
review: Wife, unbeknownst to me, ordered these. Simply put, they suck!! They come ‚Äúovercharged‚Äù , and they die a quick death, with occasional leakage!!!! Poor batteries!!What a shame! Amazon could‚Äôve cornered the battery market too! I thought only a few manufacturers made all the batteries and just labeled them differently. Main takeaway here is : buy established name batteries . Look for 4.5 and up rating. Amazon should have a 4-5 rating scale. A product rated 4 stars can be junk. But 4.7,4.8..... now you‚Äôre talking!!! ( as long as there are no fake reviews)

name: Reese Dianato
title: Disappointed after being pleased for several orders.
review: I bought these before in AAA and AA and they were awesome! Then the last 2 orders I got were terrible. I had hoped that I had just received a bad batch and it was a fluke. Then I got my 2nd and now last order. I don't know how it's possible, but they were worse. I only use these in the little candles that are on a timer and come on for a few hours every night. They are lasting 10-14 days in these. If they are in the ones that cycle through colors, it's about 10 days, if they stay one color it's 14. In remote controls I'm getting about 3 months. Compared to ones purchased at dollar store markets, I was getting longer use from the dollar ones by about double, and using the Rayovac batteries I'm getting about 3 times as long. Don't know what happened to this brand, as I stated, when I first purchased these, they were as good as the higher priced batteries, but 2 times in a row of terrible lasting power isn't a fluke, it's a pattern and money is too tight with this economy right now to be wasting money. If I thought it would be worth it, I'd ask for my money back. But I threw away the batteries since they were dead. Value for money? They're cheap batteries, and you get short life, so I guess that's "getting what you pay for". But I removed them from my subscription list because I'd rather spend a few more dollars and have something I know is going to work.

name: Cowboy
title: These are like the Holiday Inn Express of batteries.
review: These are decent batteries at a fair price. They do not have the best longevity of all the different AAA batteries that I've tried, but they get the job done and affordable enough that you can still replace them more often and still come out ahead. So let me give you a fair assessment, these are about 4 star batteries in the context of rating them on quality within the price range. These are like the Holiday Inn Express of batteries and not in the same league as a five diamond resort. They are great for remote controls, kids toys, small electronics, etc. I wouldn't use them on any medical or life safety equipment. Just keep in mind that you are ordering a value battery and you get what you pay for.

name: Shafqatullah Syed
title: Nice deal but leaked.
review: I am not giving this a five star rating because every batch had a battery or a few that leaked. It did not hit me at first but as I kept buying them I noticed it happens only with the Amazon batteries. I kept buying them because of the great price per item. I am glad they did not leak in an expensive electronic device. I think I am going with the costier solution for important items and these for my kids cheap toys.

name: L. Carothers
title: Long time user of all batteries,  Amazon is just as good!
review: I have been using Amazon's batteries on and off since they started offering them. They have a great lifespan. The important aspect of a battery for me is that I live in a hurricane possible area. Every couple of years it's time to check the battery supply for all the emergency items. Amazon batteries keep the same lifespan of the name brand batteries.In addition to the hurricane items, the daily use for remotes, everyday flashlights, and various other things, no complaints. Amazon batteries are just as good. IMO.I am a bit of a bargain shopper, so I do get the name brand when they are on a deal of the day, or have a vendor who marks them down. I am confident that I have the knowledge to give a fair assessment of the Amazon batteries.

name: Mike
title: Not worth more then 9.99
review: I have never used or seen such crap batteries. If the price stays at 9.99 for 100 batteries then that would be ok for the quality vs price to go the distance. If your looking for a quality battery at a good price, this will still get the job done, just not as long as say a rayovac or some other off brand battery. If you have electronics that eat batteries do t use these. If you have something that‚Äôs dependent on batteries these are not it. Kids toys or something of that nature then these batteries are ok.

name: Becky
title: I have bought these twice-my first purchase, I received ...
review: I have bought these twice-my first purchase, I received the batteries in the silver packaging, had no issues, long battery life, etc. The second order I received the batteries in the gray packaging as pictured. I bought the second back in April, and last week I discovered that every unused battery that I hadn't used up and thrown out was leaking. I threw out 5 batteries one day, and found 3 more that were in use in remotes that needed to be thrown out as well because they had leaked, and had to throw out a remote as well since it had corroded inside.I'm not going to be buying again. I could forgive one leaking battery, but almost half the package? I'll either buy another brand for a bit more money and quality, or go to a local dollar store for the same quality and less money

name: Donna Loves Reviews
title: Works just as well as the name brand and lasts longer!
review: We use a lot of batteries in our household so I decided to give the Amazon batteries brand a try and we are all very pleased with how well they work. Before purchasing the Amazon brand we were all using the name brand batteries and it really got pricy with how often they needed to be replaced for all of our electronics. Luckily the brand we always used was out of stock and we needed batteries asap. After looking for an alternative to purchase I came across the Amazon batteries and read all of the reviews. I figured what do I have to lose by trying these even if they don't work out I can always use the as a spare in between purchases of the name brand.These batteries work very well and seem to last much longer than the previous batteries we had used. We use these for keyboards, mouses, remote controls, toys and so much more and they last a long time, which is very impressive. I use a bluetooth keyboard that connects to several devices so I can text and type on my phone and iPad daily and this keyboard lasts weeks before the batteries need to be replaced. That is much longer than the previous batteries. The batteries come in a brown box with the batteries wrapped in plastic. We are all very happy with this brand and will continue to purchase these batters. This is a product that I would recommend to others for sure.

name: Texas Five
title: I was very disappointed and will not be buying these again
review: These were purchased for a banquet to illuminate lights in our centerpiece vases. I thought these would have had enough juice to get through the evening but more than half of the vases were failing an hour before the event conclusion. I was very disappointed and will not be buying these again. It's unfortunate that they are listed as "performance" batteries vs. some other descriptive name. I should have read the critical reviews more carefully and noted that these don't have as much power per cell as Rayovac or others. Strangely, we used very cheap no-name batteries last year for the same event that lasted the entire evening and then some. I couldn't remember where they came from so I had to look for substitutes. I thought I was making a good purchase with a trusted brand. Unfortunately, that assumption wasn't accurate.

name: Lisaico
title: Amazon's Quality Control is Slipping!
review: I've purchased these batteries before and they are good quality and fairly inexpensive. But Amazon's quality control has got to step up! The battery box was opened from both ends and its contents spilled within the shipping box. No big deal, right. Except when I put all the batteries back in the box there's still space inside. So I decide to count the batteries...and find that an entire pack of 4 was missing! Which means that the busted pack of batteries was shipped to me without even checking to see if everything was there.

name: Tenchi
title: Inexpensive and gets the job done
review: I've purchased these batteries at least 3 times before. It's inexpensive and convenient to have when everything these days requires AAA batteries. Thankfully, I haven't dealt with any leaky batteries. I'll update this review if I do.The main reason I'm docking off two stars is because they don't really last that long. These batteries tend to die in less 2 months, even when the battery powered product is not in continuous use.

name: Ashley Runski
title: Simply Do Not Believe All The One Star Reviews
review: I use 10 to 15 AA and AAA Amazon batteries each and every month to power a range of professional electrical tools and meters that I must use for my work as a licensed electrician. I have never, repeat, never had the slightest problem with any of the Amazon batteries. I have never had so much as one leak acid or fail to properly fit. As an electrician, the first thing I do before putting any battery in a tool or meter is test its voltage. So far I have never had an Amazon that did not register either very strong or excellent before first use. Think this may be yet another case of folks who can't figure out how to use even the simplest thing giving up in frustration and giving whatever they don't understand a single star. Seems to happen all too often.

name: Theresa
title: Don‚Äôt believe the hype, they work fine
review: I bought these batteries a while ago and I am now buying a second pack. My child used most of them in his nerf guns without my permission ü§¨ however... they are STILL holding up! Those nerf guns EAT batteries like super fast! So that was the real test for me.They didn‚Äôt come all nasty and exploded like you see in some reviews here, they were clean, in a cute little cardboard box and shrink wrapped nicely in groups of 4 each. I do remember them being in a large Amazon box for some reason, it was a little weird but what ever, that how they wanna send them over, that‚Äôs ok with me, it didn‚Äôt bother them at all.I will do another review when I get the second round in. I‚Äôm sure they will be fine too. I am pretty surprised to see all these bad reviews! These batteries are disposable, all these people are trying to recharge them and having issues... that‚Äôs the problem they are having. For a decent discount batterie, I am very satisfied.

name: R Teale
title: Came for the Hurlin'... Stayed for the Performance!
review: I originally bought these Amazon Basics AAA Batteries for hurling at my church choir on early Sunday services (before Pastor Mike shows up, obvs). I sit off to the side and well, this is supposed to be a review of the batteries.I ended up needing a AAA battery to power up my Paw Patrol Walkman so I could crank up some Smash Mouth instead of having to listen to Pastor Mike babble on about Jesus for what feels like an eternity! Like seriously, I have other stuff to do on Sunday, too, dude!Anyway, I threw in a fresh Amazon Basics AAA battery, pressed Rubbles' nose and "All Star" never sounded so good! The beauty of meticulously crafted music took me away. It flew me up to the clouds and I hung around with the archangel Gabriel, and we rocked out!Since then I have been using these Amazon Basics AAA Batteries for everything that requires AAA batteries. I mean, I already bought them!Much love,Heather

name: Joe
title: not all batteries are created equal
review: First, I am a big Amazon shopper. Even before Covid, and most the Amazon product are great...but NOT these batteries. Some arrived dead out of the package, not many but a few. The others last literally 50% as long as Duracell or alternatives. I put them in these under the cabinet LED lights in my kitchen. These are low impact LEDS just to add accent lighting. They are only one when you approach them and for 5 minutes. These batteries literally lasted about a month (Each takes 8 batteries) ‚Ä¶ not good. I reloaded them and put 2 of them with Duracell regular batteries not the long lasting kind. The new Amazon batteries (second batch) died BEFORE the Duracell in the device right next to each other. No difference in demand but performance was literally 50%.These are not good batteries.

name: Karelia Stetz-Waters
title: Dead On Arrival Batteries
review: I love Amazon Basics products, and I hope Amazon will see this review and make things right. I kept having trouble with battery powered devices around my house. After a lot of misguided troubleshooting (including requesting a replacement product from another company...I feel bad about that) I realized the problem was that about half my Amazon Basics batteries had no charge.When I went to message the seller, I found it was a lot harder to message Amazon than to message other sellers. When I looked for the Amazon Basics return/warranty policy, it was a long, impenetrable single-spaced document (as opposed to the easy click-to-return on my other purchases).This made me suspicious of Amazon Basics products, and I probably won't any Amazon Basics again...unless the nice folks at Amazon read this and send me a pack of replacement batteries.

name: Gregory D. Rosenberg
title: Great value for the price.
review: I have been very happy with the AmazonBasics batteries in general. I use AAA, AA, 9v, C, and D batteries. I am hoping that AmazonBasics will start offering high-energy lithium batteries. It would also be good to have a readable expiration date on the batteries. I change 98 batteries twice a year in April and September. The high energy lithium typically have a temperate range of -40F to +140F. Which means they effectively have zero water content and therefore wont freeze in crack in our often brutal Chicago winters.

name: Melissa Mills
title: Crappy batteries for sure!
review: I bought the batteries specifically for my puck light set and I placed them under the kitchen cabinets. Well I had only used them maybe 3 times for 30 minutes each time on a timer with the remote. They had only been installed for about a month. I tried using them a couple days ago and each puck light would not come on! I thought, maybe it's the puck lights because surely these batteries should last longer than 30 days and I had used the lights maybe 3 times already for 30 minutes like I said. So, I changed the batteries in all 4 lights. Now they are all working again. So, the Amazon batteries are pretty crappy and a waste of my money. The new batteries I just installed about a week ago are already starting to get dimmer in the puck lights so they look like they are dying quickly as well again. I will NEVER purchase Amazon batteries again!!?

name: J. Basile
title: Why you should and why you shouldn't!
review: Amazon strikes again! I cannot explain the love I have for amazon.com. I recommend it to everyone that I meet and I do almost every single one of my purchases through this company.Now to make things even better Amazon has batteries.Why you should:These batteries arrived quickly, they arrived fresh in terms of longevity and have so far worked very well for our purposes. You get an enormous quantity for such a reasonable price that even if some of the batteries were bad on arrival (which I have not found to be the case) I still think it is so worth it.Why you shouldn't:If you hate good deals then stay clear of this product!batteries are amazing and they help you do amazing things. These batteries in particular are absolutely fantastic and worth every penny of your hard-earned money!

name: LoriAnnR
title: Zero longevity
review: I'm stunned at the positive rating these batteries have. They are TERRIBLE! I'm constantly replacing these In my battery operated LED candles. My candles are lit for a few hours daily and I've replaced the batteries 4-5 times already (within 3-weeks). Longevity is aweful...complete waste of money. If there was a way to return them, I would but considering that I only have about 1/2 left, I don't believe that would be possible. I won't be purchasing these again.

name: Danny E Sieg
title: "Best Packs of Batteries I ever Bought!"
review: I've been purchasing various sizes of Batteries since the 1960's and the day's of transistor radios and flashlights. Batteries have always been a constant source to drain my pocket or wallet of cash. I did hesitate a bit at first, after all, being endocrined by that the cute, little "Energizer Bunny" banging that cymbal as he kept going and going and going... you know the drill. Then the opposition "Duracell" brought claims that quarantined longer lasting staying power or your money back. Pretty tough computing no matter what. Yet, Amazon, has a reputation and warranty for products bearing the "Amazon" lable, which is proven, tested and witnessed by me, Danny E. Sieg. The AAA Batteries have been used me for last 3 to 4 years and work as well or better than the other products mentioned. I still have AA Energizer's left from a 10 pack and still purchased two sleeves of AA¬†Amazon batteries, on seperate orders, because I have found them to be better.

name: D.Woodward
title: As good as most
review: These batteries are used frequently because of a motion toy one of the cats wants on. They don't last for long periods but when compared to more known brands--they last about the same amount of time. My complaint is that they are wrapped in groups of 4 and have to be opened by scissors and take a while to get the wrap peeled off .I am not anxious to stand there and try to unpeel the wrap.Most all the batteries out there are even harder to get unwrapped except for the ones you can get in a box already unwrapped--and in the AAA size-I have not yet found those.

name: Randy Edwards
title: Low Voltage = DOA
review: I purchased 36 of the AAA Amazon batteries about 6 months prior. I put 6 new ones in a device (electric pepper mill) and thouight that the device was broken. I tried again 3 months later....checked the batteries in the never used device and they were 1.25 v in all 6 batteries. I thought that there might be a voltage leak in the device, so I put in 6 new batteries (brand new, still wrapped in their cellophane wrappers). The device still would not work. I was ready to thow the mill out, but I thought to check the new batteries that I just installed and they too were all 1.25 v. That voltage (1.25 v) is considered to be a dead battery for AAA alkalines.Amazon owes me and others some sort of restitution. Also, I wouid like to know if they have done anything to change the sourcing of their so-called "economy " AAA alkaline batteries.Amazon, get back to me and tell me!!!!!!!!

name: Kris
title: THEY DON'T WORK WHEN THEY ARE COLD
review: Really wanted to like these batteries, great value and they do work well...INDOORS.Put them in a flashlight which I keep in my Yukon, It's cold here in Portland Oregon ( Nov. 2018 ). Went to use my flashlight the other night and it would not illuminate. Brought the flashlight inside and changed the batteries and it worked fine. The next morning, just for my own piece of mind, I put the previous batteries back in the flashlight and seeing as they had warmed up to room temperature they too worked fine. Put the flashlight back in the Yukon and waited until the temperatures dropped after nightfall and again, no illumination. These batteries are basically worthless for anything other than indoor applications. By the way, Energizer Alkaline batteries work just fine in cold temperatures so I don't want to hear the "should have bought lithium batteries" comments.

name: Muledography
title: Batteries are Garbage!  They don't last!
review: I was so excited to find the low cost of these batteries from Amazon - was very impressed that the per battery price was lower than even Costco Kirkland batteries (which I have been buying for years).... But now that I have been using them, I can see the quality is horrible and the reason they are cheap is because they don't last! :( I have used my Mac with wireless keyboard and mouse for the last 9 years... during that time, I usually have to replace the batteries every few months (4-6 months) under normal usage, maybe 2-3 months if using more than normal. However in both of these accessories since installing the Amazon basics batteries, I have had to replace batteries already twice now in about 6 weeks. This is crazy. Have gone through 4 batteries on each of the accessories (8 total) in the time that I would have gone by just fine with HALF the amount of batteries. Won't buy again!

name: Golferguy
title: FAIL!!!
review: This is a one star review based on my experience with these new AAA batteries. I had been using Amazon AAA batteries for years in an outdoor application for a timer that operates an automatic door opener. These batteries purchased late December 2019 have failed to last more than a few weeks in the same application that they used to last for 1/2 year. They appear somewhat different than the older batteries that they have replaced and I suspect they are sourced from a different manufacturing plant or have modified the chemistry so they no long last in cold applications. If these were to be used for any type of security system or for emergency use outdoors, there function could be seriously impaired. This I believe is my first 1 star review for any Amazon product, these batteries should be discontinued!!!

name: jcook
title: Dangerous corrosion and very little life.
review: I put these in my 16 electric Christmas candles. None of them lasted the 3x per week, 4hrs at a time use over two months. Worse, of the 45 batteries used, at least 10 corroded. Each of the candles was damaged (that I spent 3 years finding the exact right ones). One corroded so badly that the small spring pushed the end of the battery into the battery. Baffling how this could be an Amazon-branded product.

name: H. J. Paradis
title: Not what they used to be
review: Up until two Years ago I would only use Energizers and Duracell's in my remote controls. The ones I purchased in 2017 were comparable to their higher priced counterparts but the ones purchased towards the end of last Year were horrible in that I had 2 blow up. One in a FireTV remote and another in a Sony Sound Bar remote blowing the battery compartment covers off and sending the remotes flying off the end table, after I cleaned the battery compartments thoroughly I discarded the remainder of the 36 batteries. The few others I used before disposing them did not last very long compared to the earlier batch I received.

name: Ilya Shaikouski
title: Dead in no time.
review: Used only Duracell and Energizer in the past. Was all happy and would forget where they are in the house between change times.Tried groccery store brand cheap ones - got 3 days in a fireTV remote. Laughed a lot but instead of getting good brands again - decided to give a shot to another cheaper option with amazon brand. Ended up with a very close result! Almost same as Wegmans...Do you guys try yourself what you selling? Amazon branded batteries last 4 days in amazon fire tv remote? Really? My fitbit lasts twice longer working much more than that on a tiny accumulator.Stay away from this product.

name: KC
title: Value for $ cannot be beat!
review: Hands-down the best-priced batteries anywhere I've ever seen! I've been buying these for years to use with my family and friends and I cannot imagine buying them anywhere else. They come in frustration-free packaging, they last as long, if not longer, than branded products, and they because of the larger volume, we never seem to run out üòÇI would highly recommend these batteries, along with the AA and 9-Volt batteries as well!

name: Sherzod
title: I'm dismayed!!!
review: I bought 3 AAA batteries for my Gillette shaving handle. Well, it is disappointing to say but this item is absolutely useless. It didn't even last longer than 2 seconds. What I think is If the product doesn't' serve its main purpose you can't gauge/evaluate its other characteristics (look, design and etc.). It has to work so that people could say something about it. Basically, it is just sad that they sell these batteries under Amazon brand.

name: Brittany Carroll
title: DANGEROUS! AND A Waste of money
review: DO NOT BUY THESE!!! i put 2 in my clicker for me and my kids room. The clicker got so hot it burned my hand!!! It smelled like burning plastic and chemicals. Don't buy these. Im still horrified...what if my 5 y/I daughter had gotten there before me ....i tried 2 more. Same deal heated up alnost immediately . tried opening 2nd package. Same deal. Over and over. really unacceptable. üëé

name: Amazon Customer
title: They are dangerous to your toys and equipment
review: This image is of a battery purchased January 2020, expiration date 2029, and installed into a toy car late June 2020. Battery removed late December 2020. Toy car damaged by battery.This oozing of electrolyte problem is something from the 1960's, not the 2020's. I have a Radio Shack timer purchased in 1978 with the original 1978 batteries that finally died a month ago: and they never leaked like this.It's one thing to leave alkaline batteries in something for 10 to 15 years and see some leakage, but months? Totally unacceptable.

name: Tre' c
title: I‚Äôm over it!
review: Like a dummy I keep these on auto order giving them the benefit of doubt. I noticed I was replacing these batteries after about a week or so of use. I kept thinking maybe I got bad batteries but this is the last time I‚Äôm giving these batteries and consideration. I‚Äôm updating my auto ship and I‚Äôll leave you with the old saying... you get what you pay for! Buy the better battery (I won‚Äôt name them here but you know what I mean)

name: Lauren
title: Not as good as they used to be
review: I used to love these batteries. I have been using them for years. I'm constantly changing them in our remotes. I bought AA and AAA at the same time. Both are having the same problem. Something else had to of changed besides just the packaging. Expiration dates just fine. Whatever it is, bring the old ones back.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Missing batteries
review: I've bought these batteries a couple of times before, no, they are not super batteries or anything but they've always worked just fine for what I use them for. Unfortunately this time when they arrived, the box was already opened and 8 batteries were missing, the box was inside of a larger box which was sealed, so I can only assume that they went missing before they were sent our for delivery. I know it seems like a small thing, but when you pay for something, you generally expect to receive all of it.

name: Sam
title: Leaking acid
review: I found two of these batteries stored in the original packaging leaked acid. I am glad I did not have them in a product. They do not seem to have the capacity of another brand x battery as I have replaced them three times in one of two remotes with the same usage, while the brand x battery kept on working. Nothing scientific, just observation. Any battery that leaks is not worth the risk of a cheaper price.

name: Crusher
title: They suck they don‚Äôt last stick with the Costcos Kirkland brand on sale
review: These batteries suck are used to buy the ones at Costco‚Äòs but it was too hard to tell which was positive and negative I don‚Äôt like Duracell because they leak I tried the Rayovac ones online they‚Äôre OK they‚Äôre not the best they always did suck are use rechargeable‚Äòs now for the most part, and I went back to the Costco‚Äòs brand as Duracell makes them. And they have good sales on them is when I buy them the Kirkland brand but these Amazon basics suck they don‚Äôt last..

name: Branden
title: Careful they explode!
review: I got a battery powered pepper grinder from a gift exchange Xmas 2018. I had purchased some amazon batteries and I installed them. I just noticed that one of the batteries had exploded and leaked all over. The device does not work and there was acid leakage inside the container. I‚Äôve never had a battery explode like this one did:

name: Hall Family
title: NO GOOD!!!
review: Do not purchase these batteries! They are useless, at least don't buy them in bulk because they don't last. We always buy batteries in bulk usually from Costco but these were much cheaper and there was a reason, they run out even when not using them. Our disabled child has a lot of toys and equipment that are battery operated that is why we but in bulk. I guess you get what you pay for. Don't buy these!

name: Phillycutthroat
title: Amazon Owes Me A Refund For Poor Quality.
review: These Amazon batteries are utterly horrendous.They do not last and they leak like crazy. I'm so glad I found them leaking before my family got acid on their fingers. Danger, do not buy. One star because they made me choose.

name: Mackenzie
title: Half worked, half did not
review: Seeing the reviews I was expecting these to work up to par with energizer batteries or Duracell: these did not.I got these to use along with an LED bandana I had purchased. I ordered two bandanas & when we put the batteries in one of the bandanas barely worked. I was very upset thinking the bandana was faulty & played with the batteries I had put in it. Nothing changed. Eventually ended up putting in another two of the batteries in the pack & it worked perfectly. It seems not all the batteries in my pack were good. Upsetting experience but the batteries that did work seemed to work for a decent amount of time; again these were nothing like energizer or Duracell so do not expect that quality.

name: Joe The Expert
title: Can‚Äôt beat the price
review: After reading some of the negative reviews in here, I hesitate a lot to order. After all from my experience with amazon products I know they are properly not going to beat the high quality products on the market.This being said, I couldn‚Äôt beat the price. The quality brand I am familiar with was priced at 2x amazon basic brand. So, I figured to take a risk and get this one. The batteries don‚Äôt look like high end batteries but they definitely looking decent. Nothing look damaged, I assume the photo of damaged batteries by other users could be result of either shipping or storage.The batteries works as expected. I can‚Äôt speak for its longevity yet since I have had it for like a week. Will update my review on that after few months.

name: The Tenneys
title: Don't Last As Long as Other Brands
review: There's a lot of bad hype out there regarding Amazon brand batteries, specific to them exploding or leaking. I've never had that issue, but I do find that these batteries don't seem to last as long as other brands. I'll forgo saving a few dollars on my next battery re-up and will get some Duracell or Energizer's.. maybe even some AC Delcos, have actually heard good things about them, but can't verify. Just can say that these are fine batteries that don't last as long as the name brands.

name: Serenity...
title: Stocking cabin for winter....
review: For some reason, these AAA batteries are not usually on my list for the winter. This year I did remember as the remote for my TV went 'dead'. So, luckily this jogged my memory.Have quite a few items that use this size battery so am glad I purchased these before the winter arrived.Personally I have never seen much difference between expensive batteries and those that are lower in price. And, that is probably because I only use them for radios...on occasion, remote controls and flashlights.Will update if these don't perform as expected.Highly recommended.

name: Trailer Boy
title: 10-Year Shelf Life The batteries SO NOT!!!?!!
review: So I Purchased the 36 box of AAA amazon battery's.. and AA Amazon battery's. The web stated a 10 Year self life. I did not use these "freshly sealed battery's" for a year. I also purchased AA battery's....Well I used the AA battery right away-didnt really seem to have much issues at first- about 4 months down the road-the battery that I used was dead!?!! This was a "door remote" that gets pushed once a day !?!! That seem really short based on other battery's used in the past...but un scientific! So i figured well "they are cheap and I have several of them -no big deal". Time goes by and I find myself changing out the AA battery's more and more!?!! I NEVER even touch the AAA Amazon battery's... after A year or so -I use up all of the AA battery's!! Not happy with the life span - I order NON AMAZON brand battery's for replacements. Today I go to use The AAA Amazon battery's for a wireless mouse-All of them in the 36 Pack are door knob dead!?!!!""10-Year Shelf LifeThe batteries use a patented triple layer structure in the cathode cad by adding a layer between the nickel and iron inside the battery. The result is an increased shelf life due to low leakage.""Amazon is going to replace them-I had NEVER Ever had New sealed battery be dead -EVER?!! I know I had them over a year before used- But this is Amazing!?!I was on the fence about Just refunding the money to me- Or having them replaced....I decided to "try again" and have them replaced!?! Maybe just got a bad Lot??

name: Hyytekk
title: No doubt manufactured by the household name brands, just rebranded for Amazon, with a better price.
review: We all go through a ton of batteries for everything from the mechanism that unlocks my doors to flash lights to remotes. And it seems they go bad at the worst possible times when replacing them must wait for a trip to the store so in the mean time your device is inoperative. I love to have a huge reserve supply, but the major brands can be pricey. Amazon obviously, doesn't manufacture their own, but buys in bulk and rebrands them, so essentially, you're getting those major brands anyway, with a different badge. I haven't done any formal testing, but they seem to have a sufficient service life and at a cheaper cost so I can keep a generous supply on hand. So far, highly recommended and a good value.

name: Replicant
title: Good batteries for the price
review: AmazonBasics has really become a solid brand for so many household staples. These batteries are dependable and affordable, and if you can get them when the price dips down, it would be crazy not to grab some.I've seen some reviews that complained of leakage, but it sounds like some of those people left batteries in their devices for years. When you leave something sitting mostly unused for years, of course there is a risk of leakage. The risk is even greater if you've mixed batteries and created a power imbalance between old and new. I havent had any problems with AmazonBasics batteries leaking in everyday items such as my Amazon Fire Stick remote---but then I change them out regularly. Be sensible, and have reasonable expectations for a little pack of AAA batteries!

name: Slmh
title: Do not last very long
review: I have bought Amazon Basics batteries in the past, but these are just not lasting long at all! We are using them for all of our remotes for TV's, etc and is seems like every week or so we need new ones. When I bought a big box of Amazon Basic AA, they seemed to last forever. I'm very dissappointed.

name: Stephen
title: Great alternative to those expensive name brands
review: Like most Amazon branded products, these batteries are a great alternative to expensive name brands that you'll find at the checkout line in the supermarket. These batteries last a good amount of time, and you'll definitely see how purchasing the Amazon brand makes a quick economic benefit.When the battery is inside your product behind a cover, no one will no you aren't using Duracell! Definitely recommend stocking up on some batteries from Amazon and keeping them handy for a rainy day.

name: ****Maxander****
title: Not Dependable AAAb attery
review: I've heard so much about these Amazon basics battery and lot of people seem to raves about it. I've always used Energizer or Duracell batteries my whole life. Figured, I will try them out and today I finally got the Amazon basics AAA batteries and put in some my kid's toys and flashlights. I noticed the flashlight isn't that bright and the toys sound and movement is that strong as the previous batteries so I used my battery tester to test how much power does it have. And I was pretty surprised, shocked and disappointed that how can this brand new battery is only a 1/4 green. It barely have any power left and It's brand new and its should all the way green(see pictures). I bought an 8 pack and I tested them all and they were all the same.Very Very disappointed with Amazon Basic battery. If you need good quality dependable battery I wouldn't recommend this battery.

name: Nick T.
title: Great batteries!
review: Love the batteries. We subscribe to receive these every six months but they last longer then that in most devices such as tv remotes or under counter lights. We just have a very spoiled 4 year old that gets every toy he wants (my fault). So it‚Äôs pretty great to always have batteries on hand and not have to go out and buy some really expensive high end brand or some really cheap brand that last two days. These really did hold up longer than I expected very impressed.

name: Joe
title: Should be Amazon Amazing Batteries not Amazon Basic. Great prices and quality.
review: If you haven‚Äôt tried Amazon Basics batteries what are you waiting for? There is nothing basic about them by the way. They should change the name to Amazon Amazing Batteries. They are priced much better than either of the big name brands. In my experience they outperform both low abs end version of those two big names as well. But we aren‚Äôt paying for advertising and when you buy these bulk packs you save on both accounts. Try them you got nothing to loose. If you aren‚Äôt satisfied you can return them. It‚Äôs Amazon after all. I keep a box of AA, AAA, and D size so I‚Äôve always got them. Come hurricane season I refresh my layers and flashlights then place them in every room around the house. Everyone has their own color do. I arguing. Plus we know remote run down overnight especially if it gets wedged between the couch cushion or someone sets a book on part of it. Both things will keep the keyboard and it drains battery power. So I‚Äôm prepared should that happen, it has twice one of each example. So avoid the late night run for batteries for that gift or your kids game or baby‚Äôs favorite bedtime toy. Just buy in bulk and you‚Äôre covered. If you went around the house and counted you‚Äôd be surprised how batteries are in use right now, the number ALL the remotes is quite up there. Oh yeah with changing batteries you should change ALL at once to increase power and battery life. always be sure to dispose of used batteries properly. Hope this review was helpful.

name: K.
title: short term life, good price
review: These batteries are a great deal when you buy in bulk. They are super convenient for devices especially like remotes and household products.I use these fairly often, four at a time for a magnified, light up mirror and they last miserably short for a high performance battery. I get maybe a few hours overall max using the mirror before I need to replace them. The time they last has made me think that i‚Äôd rather switch to a rechargeable battery set than keep buying these.Only recommend for small devices like remotes snd computer mouses. These batteries don‚Äôt seem to do well on things that need a lot of power.

name: Nasha
title: Warning don't get wet!!
review: Warning!!! Besides the fact these are pretty cheap and don't last super long for the price point, don't use these with water! I replaced the Energizer batteries in my facial scrubber that has never had issues and within two uses I noticed brown sludge in the cup I kept it in thinking I'm an idiot and left soda in a cup or something. Wash it out and next day more.brown sludge. Batteries were leaking rusty brown sludge and fully exploded. I had to throw my perfectly fine device away. Scary I could've not seen it and put battery acid or whatever all over my face

name: aka_kristin
title: LIFE CHANGING BATTERIES
review: These batteries changed my life. Seriously. You have no idea. Thanks to these batteries my life has become 100% less stressful. My clocks are always on time and I'm no longer late to work all the time which means my boss has finally stopped writing me up for showing up late. Such a relief. And, don't get me started on my remote controls. You don't know stress until you realize that the newest episode of Supernatural started 5 minutes ago and generic batteries in your remote have died and YOU CAN'T CHANGE THE CHANNEL!!!! THANKS TO THESE BATTERIES I WILL NEVER MISS AN EPISODE OF SUPERNATURAL AGAIN!! Purchase these batteries!!! Trust me, you will thank me later.

name: Fernando
title: Great Value and Quality
review: These are the batteries that originally came in my remote for my fire stick, I use it almost daily and the batteries lasted over a year. I feel that these batteries are great quality and a great value.

name: NeverNeverLand
title: KNOWN AS THE AMAZON LEOPARD.... KEEPS GOING....
review: It's the AMAZON LEOPARD.... THEY KEEP GOING AND GPING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING....AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING AND GOING

name: Renie
title: Good batteries, and great packaging, nice for keeping batteries in.
review: I have yet to try these out, but want to comment on the great, common-sense packaging, which I can use to safely keep the batteries in, as I use them over time. First off, they come in an appropriately sized, sturdy box that can be reclosed ( not a blister pack as some others do). In addtion, every 4 batteries are encased in a plastic sleeve, so that as batteries are used out of the box, the remaining batteries do not fall over, which can lead to the terminals touching one another, (not a good thing, to my understanding (potential heat generation)).I'll comment further if the performance seems lacking, but if the packaging is an indication of the performance, they will be well worth the reasonable cost. UPDATE: Changed rating to 5 star, they seem to last as long as any other battery I've used.

name: Tennis lovr
title: These batts are Phatüòè
review: I know they say that these r just as good as say bunny brand but not 4 me- I would say Ray-o-Vac level- like a vw vs audi- Toyota vs Lexus- Nissan vs Infiniti par-Not quite on longevity as really that‚Äôs the only comparo I say- all r bout same on output but.....I say buy these as $ is stoopid- Whatta deal when u look elsewhere- 10 packs are the same price dang near!Use these lots in family nerf wars so I can attest to these-we love n hate batteries don‚Äôt we!? What would we do w/o em!?!?Will buy again n again n again sadly‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Missy
title: Arrived dead
review: These Amazon high performance batteries arrived ‚Äúdead‚Äù. I put them into a new flashlight I purchased from Amazon at the same time and it would not work. I thought the flashlight was broken until I bought Duracell batteries and the flashlight worked like a charm. So I basically just wasted $11 on the large pack of ‚Äúhigh performance‚Äù batteries that were useless.

name: Sean
title: Get the job done
review: I'm fairly happy with the batteries overall. As far as the price goes for a 36 count of batteries I couldn't be happier. They are also lasting longer than batteries I have used in the past, which may not say much because I would normally get batteries from the dollar store ha. However, I haven't had problems with these, since I purchased them, and I currently have pairs of the batteries in my TV remote, mouse, and calculator. My calculator normally burns through batteries rather fast, so I don't think I'm reviewing these batteries too soon. If I do run into problems, I will change this review.

name: dsk
title: 17% Dead Batteries
review: I had high hopes for these batteries. But, 6 of them were dead, straight out of the box. That's almost 17% failure. I won't buy them again.

name: Courtdude
title: Missing Batteries
review: I have been purchasing Amazon brand batteries for a few years now and I love the power for the price. This is the first problem that I have received but I felt it was worth mentioning. When the package arrive I noticed that it had been taped a 2nd time, as if someone had previously opened the package and returned it. The problem is that the box was 8 batteries short. Instead of the 36 batteries i ordered I received 28. i am hoping Amazon can make this right.

name: Lucky Clucker
title: Weird sizes!
review: These batteries are slightly different in size--not just from regular batteries, but from each other! And they SUCK. When they do fit, they don't last long--like maybe 3 weeks for stuff that barely gets used. These are terrible and I bought 3 different sizes (or lots of different sizes, based on what I got in this box, alone). I can't send them back because I just started realizing what garbage they are. I haven't even opened the other 2 boxes yet. Just spend the extra money for a battery that actually works. This teaches me for being cheap.

name: SALMONSLAYER
title: Great Batteries, Great Value
review: Great Batteries, Great Value. These batteries work just as well as the major brands. I get about the same run time as Duracell or Costco's Kirkland batteries. Buy the 100 pack and they are around 50% cheaper than anywhere else for quality batteries. I've used them for a few years now and really can't imagine switching unless amazon changes them for the worse.

name: JB
title: They don't last
review: These batteries burn up super quick. I started ordering Amazon brand batteries a year ago and I've never had to buy so many. This will be the last pack of this brand.

name: Michael
title: One of the best batteries out there! Hands down.
review: I have a ton of electronics and needless to say, having to replace batteries is in every day, ongoing issue. At the same time, I have tried out plenty of brands, sometimes going with the the high priced brand names, and at others settling with cheap generics. I cannot say that I've ever been overly happy with any of the high-priced well-known brands such as Coppertone Duracell's or the Energizer Ultimate's, but I will say that I have been thoroughly unimpressed with batteries that are too cheaply made and priced for that matter. Lastly, I've never been a fan whatsoever of any of the rechargeables. So in a nutshell, batteries and I are just not the best of friends ‚Äî period. When I came across these "Basic's" a few years back, I was expecting just another poorly made product that I would no doubt have to replace every 2 to 3 days. But I thought, "the least there's a ton of them, so can it be to wrong of a purchase." All I can say was that I was blown away by how long they lasted in virtually everything I put them in, and I ranked them just as high in quality as other brands that are three times as expensive. Before long, I had replaced every battery in my house ‚Äî regardless of size, with AmazonBasics. Now we've been so impressed with them that I decided to add them to my monthly Subscribe and Save orders. As I write this, I'm glancing at the seven different boxes of extras that I have yet to use sitting on my shelf. It's nice to have an excess quantity of a product such as batteries of which can really cause an issue for most (at least for me) whenever they go dead and yet there are none to replace them when needed. Just don't be fooled by the price or the brand name for that matter. These are just as good as the competitors if not better. Funny thing, my next-door neighbor with whom I barely know knocked on my door the other day asking if I had two AA batteries for which he could use. When I returned with 12 of them, he was shocked and at first refused to take them. With seven boxes to spare, or even if I had one box for that matter, it certainly wasn't an issue. Had I have done this with any other store-bought battery? Of course not. Not unless I wanted to freely give up $15 worth of batteries to someone I barely knew. I guess sometimes and people are happy, they try and let others share in their wealth.

name: KGB
title: Cheaper Is Not Better
review: The AAA batteries do not have longevity. At least, not the box of batteries I received. School started Aug 24, 2020. This is the third time we are replacing batteries in the keyboard and mouse. (We have five students, and the one that has Amazon Basics batteries is the one having the most problems.) I will never buy Amazon Basics batteries again. I'd rather pay more with greater assurance of a quality product. I was wrong to think batteries are just batteries, it's just different packaging. They got me this time, but never again.

name: kenneth
title: 10 year shelf life is a lie
review: batteries i recieved had an exparation date of 2027, this order was fufilled by amazon so there batteries have been in their warehouse for years aparently, I tend to use them up quickly so i dont care about the exparatioin date and they always provide the power and value i expect for the price but i am continualy dissapointed when i recieve amazon betteries because the exparation dates are nowhere near 10 years out, must are set to expire within 3 or 4 years of purchase in my experience. when i purchase a box of duracells with the 10 year shelf life claim they are always reasonably new manufectured with exparation dates far off in the future, maybe ive just had bad luck but amazon continues to ship me batteries that are afew years from exparation every time i order them, like i said i use them up quickly so its not to much of an issue to me but if your purchasing to keep on the shelf for a long time amazon batteries def arent for you.

name: bjrolland
title: only cells I buy
review: I've been buying AAA and AA cells from Amazon for a few years now. I have yet to have one of them corrode in a device. I've lost devices to other brands, including Energizer and Duracell.I know they're all made in China now but for some reason the Amazon cells don't wreck my gear and the others have on several occasions. Are the Amazon cells made to higher specs? I don't know. I only know that they work well for a long time and don't ooze their guts and ruin my stuff. The price is right. Highly recommended.

name: Peter A. Hogg
title: Batteries Leaked and Destroyed The Charger
review: Check and see how these batterier distroyed my charger. Just threw a bunch away as they won't replace them or the charger.

name: Denise Rhodes
title: Great price for the quantity
review: Great price for the quantity. My large family goes through a lot of batteries. Personally, I didn't see much difference between these batteries and name brand. Even rechargeable batteries loose their muster sooner or later. Not to mention many members kept throwing out the rechargeables. So, I switched to the Amazon Basic batteries years ago, and haven't switched back. I am not wasting a lot of money for less, and I don't have to stress about kids not keeping up with rechargeable. Then to save even more money, one can add the Amazon basic batteries to their subscribe and save.

name: Wooden Makeup
title: Great batteries!
review: I ended batteries when my mouse and remotes started losing power. So i went with these based on price. They are really good batteries and I like them a lot. I really like that they are wrapped every 5 batteries so you don't have open batteries sitting in a drawer. I did this with a huge thing of larger batteries in the same junk drawer and they all had dried battery acid all over the tips. I am not sure why but I guess they are all ruined from being exposed. So i am glad when I saw that they are shipped protected in sets. No problems, have had them for a month and like them a lot.

name: Tony H.
title: Good number of batteries for a good price
review: These are seemingly good batteries as they advertise a long shelf life and everyone knows how disappointing when you go get a battery only to find out they are expired or the voltage has begun to decrease over time. I have checked the voltage on a number of them when I needed one and found they were all up to par. About the only thing I dislike is as each battery is wrapped separately with a very good covering, they are difficult to remove without a knife or screwdriver. But again I feel good about the purchase and will buy more.

name: Lisa
title: My Go-To Batteries
review: For the past several years, when I purchase batteries, the Amazon batteries have been the best deal. I have purchased them in 9 Volt, AA, and AAA and had zero issues. Once I throw batteries into something, I tend to not think about it, so the batteries have seemed to last as long as I expect them to last. The packs come with so many that I need a battery organizer to keep up with them, lol. Will continue to buy the packs of Amazon Batteries unless I run into a quality issue down the road. Recommended!

name: Joseph J. Truncale
title: Great AAA batteries for a bargain price from Amazon.
review: I recently ran out of AAA batteries and decided to purchase this bargain priced pack (Amazon Basics 20-county AAA high-performance alkaline batteries, 10 year shelf life, easy to open value pack) from Amazon. I was happy with the very quick service and as soon as I received them I replaced the AAA batteries in my flashlights and television channel changers.I am very happy with my purchase and the price was fantastic for these 20 AAA batteries.Rating: 5 Stars. Joseph J. Truncale (Author: The Mighty Pen: Your self-defense friend)

name: Jes
title: Cheaper in Bulk
review: Haven't had chance to test these, but if they last even a couple months that's better than some batteries I've paid more for. First time buying household batteries online, and they are so much cheaper in bulk. I don't need 36 AAA, but I will now likely never need to buy AAA batteries again! Only needed 8, but the price difference was like $3 to go from 8 to 36, so why not? Hopefully they have decent longevity, otherwise I will be needing all 36... however, even if I do, for the price I'm ok with it.

name: Sweet Kitty
title: FAIL! Shame on you, Amazon!
review: I just stocked up on some AAA batteries and bought Amazon's Basic brand AAAs. I installed them yesterday and they didn't work. I had to use another brand I had. I am stunned that Amazon would sell me dead batteries. Shame on Amazon. Shame on you! You sold me a defective product, now I'm out the money I spent to buy these.

name: Pete J
title: Short life
review: I bought a 36 pack to use in a few flameless candles. Went through the whole box already in only two months. Very short life, I expected more from Amazon.

name: tiasreads
title: Rare Disappointment From Amazon Basics
review: I've been consistently impressed by the Amazon Basics products I've tried in the past, but their batteries are the exception. Besides the AAA's, I've also tried the D and C size. I've had some that came out of the package dead, even when the package was new. My remote controls (especially my Roku remotes) burn through these batteries in a heartbeat, far more quickly than Energizers or my preferred brand, Member's Mark from Sam's Club. It was convenient to just order them with Prime shipping, but I'll be stocking up at Sam's in the future.

name: Cboyer
title: New Packaging is Terrible.
review: I like these batteries. They seem to last as long as the big name brands, but at a better price. However, Amazon changed the packaging and the new design is terrible. I received an order today and half of the 4 packs slipped out of the box and were loose in my package. In addition to that the plastic came off two of the 4 packs so there were 8 batteries completely loose in the package with the other items I ordered. The old packaging for these batteries also served as a nice way to store them until needed. The new packaging isn‚Äôt sturdy enough to be used this way.

name: Debaware
title: Change your Amazon remote batteries less often!
review: This a great Amazon product for value & money. I take care of my disabled father. My father has always had a weird affinity for flashlights. Ive found dozens and dozens of flashlights over the years and many if them take AAA batteries. But the reason you want these (and me too) is for your Amazon remote control. Keep a pack close by so when you get that frustrating little message you'll have plenty of Amazon batteries available for your Amazon remote. You'll change them less often with these.

name: Brian
title: Back for the buck
review: Depending on what device I need batteries for, I would either go with cheap batteries at the local 99 cents store or with the expensive Energizer or Duracell brand.I wanted to give the Amazon brand batteries for once and pulled the trigger on triple A battery pack.I needed these for the remote control, mouse for my laptop, and mustache trimmer and so far these batteries have lasted with good power and doesn't appear to drain fast as it would with knock-off or cheap batteries.

name: Rami
title: Feels flimsy, but does the job
review: These really feel flimsy, made out of plastic, and seem like they would not last a long time. Well, they have lasted me a few months, using them once or twice a week. I bough them so that I could use them occasionally in place of my LG Tones, which are much more expensive, when I go running and doing other physical actives (basically to protect the Tones which I like a lot and give them a longer life). If you keep in mind the price you pay for these, then you would be satisfied with their performance overall.

name: Carol
title: Worst batteries ever purchased.
review: The batteries have an extremely limited power life. The two in my wireless mouse lasted for about 6 weeks.
