I use my computer an average of 2-3 hours a day, and the mouse is turned off when it is not in use. In my Roku remote, they lasted for approximately 3 weeks. Do not buy these batteries!

name: Karin Wasserman
title: Amazon AAA 1.5 volt batteries
review: I ordered a product that required AAA batteries. So I bought 30 batteries for the same price as a small package of Duracell only 12 count for the same price and got over twice as many by going with the Amazon brand. That is a considerable savings. A lot more bang for the buck. Time will tell how long lasting they will be. I am happy with my purchase.

name: Matt
title: No power
review: Good price.... but (update 12/21/2016)Update - horrible batteries. Have gone through 8 out of 48 batteries and none have worked. Contacted Amazon, they state they will refund my money and apologized. Great customer service,but horrible product.Be aware of the refund/return policy with Amazon. Batteries are something I don't test when i get them, I assume they will work when I need them. Have never had a problem before now. When to put 2 AA's in an LED flashlight..... nothing. Tried 2 more.... nothing. Tried 2 more....nothing 2 more (guess what?)... nothing again. Tried it my TV remote too. Same results. Not something I would trust to stock up with for a power outage.While the product gets 1 star (that's too generous) I do give Amazon and their Customer Service 5 Stars.

name: John
title: Very annoying packaging
review: There‚Äôs nothing wrong with these batteries. They work fine. They‚Äôre cheap. They come with my monthly Amazon shipments.Perfect, right?No, unfortunately not. I have no idea why Amazon feels the need to overpackage these batteries so much. They come in sets of three, in cellophane wrappers that are impossible to tear with your hands. So you have to cut each set of three with a knife and if you bought any larger quantity of them (which you usually do using Subscribe and Save) it takes a long time to go through them all. Not to mention the unnecessary waste of all those pointless wrappers which are packaged inside a little corrugated cardboard box anyway, then put into another Amazon box with whatever else you ordered.I‚Äôve bought these in AA and AAA several times, but I‚Äôm done. I‚Äôll spend a little more to get name brand batteries in packaging that doesn‚Äôt pss me off so much.

name: Debbie
title: As good or better than expensive brands
review: These batteries seem to last as long, if not LONGER than name brand batteries. This is my second time buying a box, and I'm still very impressed!!

name: Kevin Kelsey
title: Well, they are batteries.  Just not good ones.
review: I use these for my wireless mouse on my laptop. Not heavy use at all. But I am replacing these batteries at least once a week. I have to carry extra batteries with me, and I've never done that before. I used to go MONTHS with name brand batteries, so it's a dramatic difference. I'll use these up but I won't buy them again.That being said, this is the worst Amazon Basics product that I have bought. Everything else has been outstanding, so I'm really surprised at how bad these are.I have the AAs as well, and those don't seem to have the same problem. Maybe these are just part of a bad batch?

name: Elizabeth Jo Stephenson
title: Lasts Longer Than Most Name Brands
review: I use these in ALL the Remotes in my House and have been for the last few years. They cost less than some others I've tried and they last a lot longer. I really noticed the difference when my PC Mouse died, I'd used a name brand battery and they only lasted 6 months! I always date Batteries, Chargers, Cables, etc. to tract longevity and the Amazon batteries in my Mouse now are going on 9 months of everyday use, gaming included! My search for Batteries is over!

name: SSung
title: This battery is good as other brand names!!!
review: My brother and I decided to try the amazon batteries because the price was better and the reviews were pretty decent. Now that I tried several times and bought several times, I can actually say these are just as good as the other name brands. My brother and I did the testing and these batteries lasted just as long as the other ones. So, I know these last and works marvelously. I enjoy buying the value packs because I don't have to worry about running out. I'm giving these batteries two thumbs up!!!!!

name: Amazon Customer
title: Don't last long
review: Not lasting as long as they used to. Both C and AA amazon batteries are dieing within weeks of being installed. I use the AA for game controllers and it will only last a few weeks. (Brand new controllers)Also a touchless sink that takes C batteries will go only a month. Should last a year. I am switching back to higher quality batteries in hopes I don't have to keep running around my house replacing batteries in everything on a regular basis.Sick of Amazon brand.

name: Vienna
title: It was okay
review: I tried different brands of AAA batteries. This brand have half of the power versus other brand. I used the same machine with this brand of batteries and then I used another brand name in the past. This is the result that I got. This brand last only two weeks versus the other one last about four weeks.

name: David L.
title: What do I know?
review: Thought I did a review for Amazon batteries already but whatever. They seem to be good enough batteries for the price. I really don't know and can't say for sure though. I have not done my own scientific comparisons with all kinds of side by side matching to see what powers what best and when. All I know is we always need batteries here at home and since I'm making an Amazon order for something or another already, might as well just throw some more batteries in with the order too. Helps if it's a small order to begin with and you just need to buy a little something extra to get free shipping or something. I have bought them in the past and will probably buy more in the future.

name: Katie
title: Great deal- don't pass these up! Can never have too many AAA's around.
review: Great deal- don't waste any more money buying batteries at the store! You can't beat the price and they work and lask as well as "brand name" batterys. It it amazing how much cheaper these are- and you get twice as many. I got these in AA, AAA, C and D. The main reason I even bought them was when I was looking for flashlight batteries- size D for my trusty maglight (yes they are heavy but I love them for it, they are perfect for a car and the weight keeps it steady if you have to put it down) and size C for a different flashlight. Of course I needed an odd number and couldn't believe how expensive they were in the store. I checked Amazon- had no clue amazon had their own batteries and noticed that in all of the sizes- the price was less then the smallest pack of that size in the store and had twice as many batteries. Did I need this many AAA batteries at the time- nope but let me tell you I'm so glad I got extra- less than a week after buying them I had already nearly used every one. I went around the house and replaced every remote and device I could find and they work great! With AA and AAA size I'd recommend buying a bigger pack- yes it does seem like a lot of batteries at first but trust me you'll be glad you got extra- it's one of those items every house needs and easily gets overlooked.

name: Pete
title: Good price but don‚Äôt last that long.
review: For the price they seem ok but for a few extra dollars the name brands last twice as long in the same devices.I basically am just using these now for my remote controls and thermostat cause they don‚Äôt use much power and the batteries will last longer.Any item that requires a lot more juice I use name brands otherwise these will drain to quick and they won‚Äôt be cost effective.2 of these in a wall clock died after less than 2 weeks.

name: R. Kumar
title: Very poor quality
review: These batteries are crappy to say the least. They drain in almost no time. I have tried multiple packs of them, initially believing that my devices had been left on or something. Later on I realized that it was the batteries that were the issue. All they are good for is to pollute landfills.

name: Max
title: Great job to amazon
review: I absolutely love these batteries, and not for the reason they are better or worse then other batteries. They are batteries and they work. I love them because of how awesome the packaging is. I have a 4aaa dispenser and these come in a 4 pack wrapped in plastic. Normally I have this big clunky plastic tub to contend with. But this I have a neat little box( about the size of a dvd but a little different) that is easy to open and close and a awesome 4 pack can be removed and my dispenser can easily be filled. The box of 32 easily fits in my bag or on a book shelf. Great job to amazon

name: Trevor
title: they appear to be batteries
review: I wont know if they actually last very long or hold up without using them, but i'll make sure to come back in a month or so with an update on value.When they first arrived, the package only had a 12 pack of batteries and a 8 pack of batteries in side, i was worried i misread the item description and didnt buy the right amount, amazon very quickly resolved this issue for me and i dont feel so crazy

name: R. Miller
title: Shelf life disappointing......
review: Purchased (36 pack) in December 2018, ALL (remaining 28) DEAD OUTTA BOX BY SEPTEMBER 2019. Had used 4-8 before today, in remotes w/no problems that I recall....Checked my past purchases, & had bought (36 pack) 5 times prior... never had problems before. Don‚Äôt know if as a bad ‚Äúbatch‚Äù or whatever was the problem. Had previously purchased Sony batteries on Groupon, before my last 5 times (of 36 packs- so quite some time) , & never had problems w/Sony batteries ( a decent battery economically)... so bottom line being, will go back to Groupon for Sony batteries next time... this is MY 1st BAD DEAL ON AMAZON, that‚Äôs saying something‚Äî I love the company, just not so much their Name brand product .... IN THIS CASE.... .. bummer...

name: Ty.
title: Always there when you need them!
review: Let me start by saying, I haven't sat down and performed controlled tests on the longevity of these batteries. That being said, they seem to last just as long as anything else out there. They're a good deal for how many you get, and they always arrive incredibly fast. That means that when I grab the last couple of batteries from my current stash, I can hurry and buy more and know they'll be here quick. Sure beats trying to remember that I need some next time I go to the store. For convenience of getting them plus the fact they seem to last long enough for my needs, easy choice to pick these up.

name: ScottD9
title: Amazon Basic Batteries Far Exceeded My Expectations.
review: Amazon Basic batteries far exceeded my expectations. I have purchased the large multi-pack batteries in stores before and they are a waste of money. I was not expecting much better when I ordered the Amazon Basics, but I was pleasantly surprised. I originally bought the AA batteries to use in my digital camera and they exceeded the performance of the Duracell and Eveready batteries I normally buy. I quickly bought the AAA batteries and they are great as well. No need to waste money on the big battery companies again. I will definitley stick to Amazon Basics.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Box was empty. No batteries inside!
review: I received what appeared to be a sealed box. When I opened it there was nothing inside but a pamphlet describing what was supposed to be in the box. The order of AAA batteries was not in it. I noticed an end flap was broken which is obviously how the batteries were either removed or fell out.I need a replacement ASAP. Thank you

name: AB
title: Not worth the penney
review: I have had a lot of batteries the pasts, And use rechargeable batteries for years. But I'm sad to say Amazon AA's AAA's batteries are the worst I've ever had. Not only do they leak and rule in your expensive hardware. But the longevity is ridiculously small. Do yourself a favor avoid Amazon batteries at all costs pay the extra money for good batteries when it comes to rechargeables. The old saying holds true here, you get what you pay for, Or maybe less when it comes Amazon batteries.

name: mky44
title: Long Lasting and as a good as Name Brand Products
review: If you're looking for cheap but durable batteries look no further. I personally like amazon products. I know I can count on them as much as a named brand, but for a 1/4 of the price. I got these on Prime day for a great price and the last a OK amount of time. I used them on my xbox controller, but i think it soaked up more power than I thought so the batteries died with in a month or so. Its not like I keep track, but noticing the controller shutting off was what lead me on to the life of the batteries. I have enough to last me a year or so. Again, good buy. If you're looking to save money from the expensive name brands, go with a Amazon brand product its becoming more common and competitive as a name brand product.

name: Rosemary
title: Terrible quality
review: These may be less expensive, but the lifecycle cost is much higher than better brands. They used to be great, but now some of these only last for a week or so, whereas Duracell and Energizer last months running the exact same clock. Once in awhile, you get lucky and the batteries last a bit longer, but forget storing them. They lose power on the shelf, where other batteries retain charge. Don‚Äôt waste your time and money with these. It looks like a great deal, but in the end it will cost you more.

name: influence peddler
title: They work fine and last a long time
review: I have used the triple a and double a amazing batteries off and on for a while. I haven‚Äôt had any issues with them being poor performing, corroding, or exploding (I‚Äôve heard batteries do that but I‚Äôve never experienced it). I‚Äôve had the same triple a batteries from amazon in my remote like a year and they‚Äôre still performing well. I recently stocked up on every battery size amazon makes to go into a bug out prep collection. The pricing is pretty fair on the batteries too especially considering there is no discernible quality issue with the batteries.

name: Will and Kat
title: I am now an advocate for these batteries!
review: I posted an entire review about the "C" batteries but I will reiterate here. I was once scared of the generic battery. I was scared that if I did not use the name brand, super expensive battery that I would be doing a disservice to whatever toy or electronic I was putting them in. This is not the case with these batteries. I know that there are batteries out there that are generic and have not worked as well but I am here to vouche for these batteries. I have been using them in everything and bought all the different kinds because of how well they worked and the value. The value for this amount of batteries and the quality of these batteries cannot be beat anywhere else. They have outlasted the expensive kinds in my daughters toys and in the things that I have placed them in around the house. I have not been disappointed and I was floored by the price. I do not mean to prattle on but I cannot say enough about these toys. As it gets closer to Christmas, parents all around are stocking up on batteries, I know I am. I have bought a pack of AAA, AA, and C just for Christmas. I could not believe the savings and you will not be disappointed with the quality. I am now an advocate for Amazon batteries. They do not disappoint!

name: Gungo
title: BEWARE - Oxidation at both ends. Rusted and unusable after only a few months.
review: I've purchased Amazon Basic rechargeable batteries for years - and they are normally great. This batch looks different than the others and within a few months. are completely rusted. They are stored with all other batteries and never got wet - but both ends of the batteries have so much rust that you can not recharge them. In fact, even the pre-charged batteries that were never used are worthless since no charge gets through the rust. I've tried to sandpaper them but nothing seems to work. Since its past the return date - I guess the solution is to just throw them away and not order Amazon Basics in the future.

name: gejome
title: I'm not sure what "Remote Control " evaluation means in the rating inquires >
review: Originally, I ordered this product which seemed to last reasonably well , then on follow up orders, looking for longer "use life", I tried several different brands, (Sony, Eveready,ray-o-vac, duracell), all with disappointing outcomes. Shelf life was greatly reduced, and contrary to advertised promises, most of the batteries started leaking corrosive fluids half way through their usefulness , so I'm going back to Amazon Basics, a product I've never had acid leakage !. The prices are fair, and the trustfulness is assured ! ! !

name: andy_tony14
title: Poor quality from AmazonBasics
review: I've trusted Amazon with a lot of their AmazonBasics products (haven't had an issue with most of them) and I've bought several packs of their batteries. But having had these batteries in multiple products for extended periods of time I've come to the conclusion they are costing me more than name-brand batteries in the long run. I've started to notice that my kid's toys don't last nearly as long as they should before I'm replacing them again - and it's happened enough that I can't blame it on leaving the device in the 'on' position too long. Probably the most noticeable for me is my USB mouse. With Energizer or Duracell, I could easily go 6 months without having to replace the batteries. Now I feel like I'm getting 2, maybe 3 months tops before I'm replacing with more batteries. Once I run out of my current packs of batteries, I won't be getting these again.

name: Eric H
title: Only batteries I will be ordering from now on, don't waste money on dollar store batteries
review: For a long time I whenever I would go to Harbor Frieght I would grab a pack of their cheap batteries and think "even if they suck it's only a couple bucks so who cares". Turns out I have been wasting my money for years on that junk. Even though these are a little more they last 10x longer than Harbor freight or dollar store batteries and you get a lot more for your money.Anyone interested in seeing the exact numbers a guy on Youtube by the name of Project Farm did a pretty thorough test on a bunch of different battery brands and Amazon was actually near the top for value. If you search project farm battery I'm sure it will pop up, it's a pretty cool watch

name: LegoGirl
title: Basically fine!
review: They may be ‚Äúbasic,‚Äù but they're a good value for households who plow through batteries on a regular basis. I appreciate that they are shrink-wrapped into into packets containing 4 batteries each; makes it easier to keep extras in a backpack or glove compartment or drawer (and you can be sure that are 4 batteries are the same age when using them together).

name: JChamberlain
title: These batteries lost power MUCH more quickly than other AAAs
review: We tend to go through too many batteries in our house, and the price seemed right for these. We have also generally had good luck with Amazon Basics products, however these AAA batteries were not even worth the cheaper price offered. Whether in our children's' toys, flashlights, or night lights, these quickly needed replacement, and much more quickly than comparable name brand or generic AAAs. I won't be buying these again.

name: HiThere
title: Great Batteries, Great Price
review: I've been receiving these batteries through Amazon Subscribe and Save for a while. You can't beat the price and I can't tell any difference, performance wise, than the Duracell batteries that I used to buy for double/triple the price. They're well made and I've never had any leakage or damage from them. Definitely recommend these. Hope this was helpful!

name: Chingadero
title: Poor Quality - Dead Out Of The Box
review: Bought a box of these this time last year. Stored them in my desk drawer. Pulled out 3 of them for an LED light I have and they were stone DEAD! The label on them has an expiration date of 2027. I've seen fresh fish with a longer shelf life. Utter garbage.Although they say they have a 10 year shelf life Amazon won't stand behind their own brand. They ripped me off, don't let them rip you off too.

name: H C
title: Good Batteries
review: I was skeptical to get these at first, but it seems they do last as long as other well known brands. But I did not test and compare them. I do love the packaging more than others that use plastic or ones that have fully sealed plastic where you need scissors to open them. Much better in cardboard and earth friendly.

name: chappella
title: Not worth your $
review: Terrible quality. They do not last and we have been only been using for remote and having to change out every one or two days and we only watch television for an hour or two after work. Not worth the effort at even the low cost.

name: MistyB
title: Works like a charm!
review: After reading the reviews on these batteries, I decided to give it a shot! At first I was only using them for my kiddos toys because let‚Äôs face it, they get turned on and forgetfully aren‚Äôt turned off right after use... I was surprised at the longevity of these amazon brand batteries and I actually bought a few more packs!! What a great deal! I definitely recommend!

name: Kort
title: My Go-To Battery
review: I've used tons of brand name batteries over the years from copper top to pink bunny, but lately I keep coming back to these Amazons offering. For the price, it's hard to beat AmazonBasics AAA 1.5 Volt Performance Alkaline Batteries. If you don't need or want rechargeable, it is hard to go wrong here. They last and perform well, and what more could you ask for? I've never had any quality issues with them leaking or not doing what they're supposed to do. If you're looking for a reliable battery, then AmazonBasics Performance Alkalines are up to the task.~ Kort

name: Mom of 3
title: Battery snob and Super Happy with this purchase!!
review: I am a battery snob and I usually never bother with off brands. I have been successful in using other amazon branded products and wanted to give these a try. I am so glad that I decided to try these because I really do not think I will use another battery brand. Great price and work just as long as energizer or Duracell brand batteries. I have had no leaks issues or duds. I am super happy with these batteries and would recommend to a friend. In fact I actually recommended these to my mother and she couldn‚Äôt be happier with them either.

name: Lyn
title: Great price for these alkaline batteries.
review: I don't buy any other batteries for my needs around the house but these. I don't even buy Costco's Kirkland brand because these are just as good as Duracell or Kirkland and last as long and cost sooo much less. Buy quantity 36 and store them on your bench. They will last a very long time and be ready for use whenever you need them. Don't get caught needing batteries and having to go to Walmart and pay $1 per battery, yes, that's what they cost for the same kind of battery.

name: SDHeeter
title: Very short lifespan
review: We used these for under the cabinet LED lights. 4 batteries in each one... Lasted less than 2 hours. For LEDs? The AA batteries did poorly on my xbox controller also, less than 1 day.What are they good for?1) Maybe a tv remote....2) Maybe a garage door opener...3) Definitely filling a landfill quickly!

name: FromFarEast
title: 3+ year user, no issues or complaints. Compared to Duracell and Energizer.
review: Been using AmazoBasic batteries for toys, flashlights, remotes for at least 3 years now. I never had any issues with them. For the value, I can't quite say anything negative about this. AmazonBasic batteries seem to last just as long as Energizer Industrial or Duracell. That said, I have found AmazonBasic batteries to often be much cheaper, which makes it such a great product. I see myself continuing to purchase AmazonBasic batteries for as long as they keep making quality batteries.

name: Tina C
title: Work great
review: I tried the EBL batteries and other batteries because they are cheaper, but they do not last as long as these do. I had these and the EBL in two different snow globes that ran on a timer. The timer was the same on both. These batteries are still going strong while the EBL have stopped working. After this happened I ordered more of these because they are still cheaper then a lot of the big brands, but work better.

name: SAS
title: I never knew I could have this much energy
review: If someone had told me how this product could change my life, I would not have believed them. Before this miracle of the modern age arrived on my doorstop, I and my electronic products were dull, lifeless - LITERALLY couldn't even move. But now!! Apply the product following the instructions and BUZZ WHIRRRR CLAP CLAP CLAP I just can't stop! Even when things start to slow down a little BAM fresh application from my box full of energy and I'm on the go again. Get some for yourself! You won't be sorry!

name: AngWms
title: Kudos!!  Insulin Pump Running Strong!!!
review: I decided to give these a try due to the massive number of AAA batteries I use each month. I am a Type 1 Diabetic on the insulin pump 24/7. The most expensive batteries on the market last a maximum of 4 days. I inserted the Amazon battery in my pump on March 4, 2019. It is still going strong and I have full power 10 days later!!!! I truly stand amazed. I have NEVER had a battery touch this. I only wish I had these batteries 17 years ago.Kudos Amazon for passing the pump test. None ever have. I will be a customer for life!

name: Steppin' Time
title: Great Batteries for the Money!
review: Had to update all the remote and flashlights, they really did last a very long time. The ones on the Remote were dated 2017 and now they've all been marked 01/2021. The Flashlights, it all depends on how often you've had to use the Flashlight, they hold up their charge for a pretty long time, I replaced all 4 of them because the batteries were getting weak. All of them were installed in 2019!

name: A. McK.
title: Just Fine
review: I haven't had mine for very long, so they haven't started leaking or anything weird. Rather hoping they don't start doing that. Honestly, they seem fine, and we get this brand at work all the time. They live a good long shelf life as far as we can tell. Calculators do seem to eat through them pretty fast, but those darn things destroy any and all batteries. Overall, these are perfectly fine.

name: T. Day
title: A very good battery at a very good price.
review: Have you seen what Duracell and Energizer batteries cost in retail stores? What a ripoff. I think most of what you're paying for is the cost of advertising and retail displays.I've used Amazon alkaline batteries around the house for years. And we also use them in test equipment where I work. In my experience, they last just as long as the major brands for a lot less money.

name: A.J.L
title: Value, Value, Value (And Convenience Factor)
review: I have been ordering Amazon Basics batteries for quite some time now and I am sticking to them because of the value. The smaller name brand packs at the store cost much more per battery so I like to buy in bulk. I have seen the battery tests on YouTube and read that there are others that perform better, however, I really don't notice much of a difference and I really enjoy the convenience factor!

name: D John
title: Great Buy - BUT
review: It's Christmas and I have 11 window candles that require 3 batteries each, and those need to be replaced once before they come down. Hence this purchase. It's a great deal on a per-battery basis, BUT they are shrink wrapped in groups of 5, and are fiendishly difficult to get out of the wrap. It took me longer to free up the batteries than it did to install them and place the candles.

name: Capt Pierce
title: Excellent batteries at a great price!
review: I switched to the Amazon brand batteries years ago because I was sick and tired of paying crazy prices for name brand, alkaline batteries. The Amazon brand batteries work just as well and last just as long as the popular name brands but are less expensive. Why anyone would continue to buy the popular name brands and pay more when they can get a high quality, long lasting battery Amazon is beyond me. I highly recommend the Amazon brand alkaline batteries in AAA, AA, C and D cell sizes. Excellent quality!

name: Jack Erwin
title: Good Value ! Great Packaging !
review: There is no noticeable difference between the AmazonBasics AAA Cell battery and the big brand name product.I like the packaging much better. They come in a box with several batteries wrapped in plastic. The others insist on using blister packs. It is hard to open them, then they all roll out. This may be good for advertising in store displays but not so much when you get them home. I like the box.

name: Sehyun Kim
title: Came with batteries loose and missing batteries, but it seems Amazon will replace one set for free
review: I've used these batteries before and I think they're fine, I don't really pay attention to the performance that much. I'm sure they're pretty standard.The only reason I'm docking a star is because I ordered this and my first set somehow got slightly opened, and almost half of the batteries were out of their plastic wrap and just sitting in the package outside of the box.Thankfully, when I tried to submit a return/replacement, they sent over a replacement free of charge, without any need to return my original set of batteries.The replacement set of batteries came today and they were all in the box; however, one set of 4 batteries was missing, so there were only 32 batteries in there.So all I have to say is, be weary of missing or loose batteries when you order this. But at least you have some assurance that they will replace it hassle-free if you do have an issue.

name: Marco
title: Poor longevity in LED flashlights
review: The batteries first appear to have a good price. When initially installed, it seems like you are getting the quality of a name-brand battery at a significant discount. But used in bright LED flashlights, these have well under half the use time as the more expensive name brands. I estimate that useful battery life-per-dollar-spent is roughly the same as a name brand. So why use a name brand instead if the true cost is about the same? It is a pain to have to install bateries in devices 2 or 3 times as often; even if the cost is the same, my time has value as well. I recommend buying any of the name brand batteries in bulk on Amazon or at a big-box store. I do not recommend these.

name: A. Parks
title: Excellent Price
review: I'll admit that I am usually a name-brand kind of guy when it comes to retail products. I know, the psychology of marketing has gotten me; I'm a lost cause. But AAA batteries really aren't very high stakes, and I like the simplistic design/visuals of most Amazon Basics products, so I gave these a go.So far, everything works great. I've only used 1 of the batteries in my 8-pack thus far. If I notice a particularly large dip in performance or longevity I will update with a new review. But for now, they're exactly what I expect.

name: Amazon Shopper
title: These batteries DO NOT last very long
review: The battery life of these basics is awful!!! Literally last maybe a little longer than half of the Duracell batteries I usually buy. Even if these basics are cheaper, how can you justify with half the battery life?!?!? It would have to be less than half the cost of better batteries to justify. And even then, you‚Äôre just being incredibly wasteful!Just buy a better brand and avoid these!

name: BIG D N LV
title: Leaked and ruined my meter
review: I purchased a 100 pack of these AAA batteries on 4-28-17. I previously used AC Delco batteries exclusively, good life, good price, and never leaked. I have a nice meter I use to test capacitors with. I needed it last week and was getting crazy readings so thought maybe a battery change was in order. removed battery cover and 1 of the 3 batteries had a serious leak and it migrated to the circut board and I think my meter is toast, a loss of about $60. I have around 20 amazon batteries left that I will just put in my box of batteries that get recycled. I will not be using these ever again. I have read a lot of reviews and leaking seems to be a common problem. Amazon needs to raise the quality standards for their battery suppliers of get new ones.

name: Robert Thomas
title: Weak inferior 1.5 batteries
review: If your going to sell batteries they should be fully charged. Everyone else manages. I installed two in my fire stick remote on Friday night, come Sat morn the remote wouldn't work. The batteries were at half strength. The fire stick remotes are a poor product anyway they eat up batteries like crazy but I've never had them eat one up overnight so I took the package that holds maybe 10 or 15 without removing it I scratched away the plastic on the negative and positive and put the ohm meter and sure enough they weren't 1.5 they were barely one and maybe 1.1 or 2 this is a state of failing of a battery already. Go out and buy any standard battery out there and it'll be 1.5 plus I'm close to 1.6 and in a strong state. Let's put it this way my remote for the TV has had the same two 1.5 batteries in it for 8 months. The fire stick remote I'm changing them every 3 months so what I'm saying to Amazon you got lousy batteries you got lousy remotes too.

name: Mariner
title: Horrible batteries.
review: These are horrible batteries for tv remote control. I bought 2 sets of these and I have to swap out batteries about ok once a week cause they die quickly. Will not buy again.

name: Janet Haskell
title: Life-Changing! My Go-To Battery Supply
review: I am in my 50‚Äôs and FINALLY learned to keep a decent supply of batteries on hand. All those years of scrambling for batteries, rushing out to buy more, being frustrated when I realize I need batteries but the stores at closed and being mortified by the high cost of a little 4 pack - finally those days are over!I feel like a real adult now. Life-changing!!Seriously, do yourself a favor and be prepared with a decent stockpile of batteries at a respectable price.Cons: Everyone in my family now knows I always have batteries so they no longer bother to buy their own. Instead, they just dig into my stash. Uggg! I may or may not be contributing to enabling my grown children‚Äôs personal growth.I need to start hiding these little gems :)

name: Connie P
title: Decent batteries at a good price
review: I normally buy Duracell or Energizer batteries because they work well and they last. The one time I tried some dollar store (size D) batteries and, brand new, they didn‚Äôt even have enough power in them to properly run my child‚Äôs (Elefun) game! This is the first time I have purchased an off-brand since. These Amazon batteries seem to work well. Even if they don‚Äôt last as long as my usual battery brands, since they are significantly cheaper, I should still be saving money in the long run. If I have problems with the batteries long-term, I will update this review accordingly.

name: Nadia Orand
title: CHEAPLY MADE & FALLING APART & NO QUALITY CONTROL
review: I received the AAA Amazon batteries and when I went to use the batteries, I found a few batteries that were falling apart like shown in the picture, where the insides of the battery were exposed. Because I found the batteries that were falling apart after the one month "return" policy for AMAZON, there was nothing I could do. Below average quality, pay a little more knowing that the batteries you are going to receive are actually working batteries.

name: Lee Duncan
title: Power in a small package!
review: AmazonBasics AAA 1.5 Volt Performance Alkaline Batteries - Pack of 36 pack many hours of long lasting performance in such a small size. All your AAA devices will love these as there batteries given the constant stable power output of these 1.5 volt alkaline batteries. Don't waist your money on name brand batteries or off brand ones either. AmazonBasics AAA Alkaline Batteries out preform and last those for much less in cost. So, add some to your cart now.

name: Jin Oh
title: AmazonBasics batteries are the best value, hands down
review: We have about a million battery-powered toys and gadgets around the house. I spent a few years investing in Eneloop rechargeables (which are great), but you have to make sure they're all discharging the same plus you lose some and end up constantly buying more. Duracells are 8 bucks for a pack of 4 AAs here, 6 bucks per D cell, 10 bucks per 9V, which is ridiculous. Kirkland batteries are cheap but leak, and have destroyed so many electronics over the years. "Heavy duty" cells are as useless as they are cheap. I now have subscriptions for AmazonBasics AAA, AA, C, D, and 9V and life is so much simpler. I never bothered to test them despite packaging or production changes over the years, but so far they work well and don't leak. That's all I want. I don't care whether or not they discharge faster than Duracells because Duracells sure aren't worth 10 times more than these.

name: brownize54
title: You need to replace them every 2 days. Terrible product.
review: These batteries are terrible. I put 3 of them in a timer candle that turns on for 6 hours and then turns off. They lasted two days. I replaced them and the same thing happened again. So I‚Äôve gone through 6 batteries in 4 days. They‚Äôre a waste of money.

name: Kia
title: Little battery big punch
review: We were in some need for some aaa's for our flashlights so we could see the raccoons coming up on us lol and this 36 pack is a lifesaver! Not only do we have enough batteries to last a few months but they last for quite some time. I've only had to change the batteries once so far and I purchased them a little over a month ago so they seem to do all right for themselves

name: teddtlove
title: Do not buy this is from the Amazon Shopping Queen
review: These batteries are horrible. We used them almost exclusively in our Fire remotes. We have three. We were changing batteries like every two weeks in each remote or something like that. Some of the batteries were duds right out of the pack. I would have sent the back but we didn‚Äôt open the right away so the 30 past before we knew it. I love amazon but do not but these

name: Tracie Hotchner
title: AVOID these batteries they leak!
review: I have gotten many AAMzon basics products that are terrific quality and value- but DO NOT buy Amazon's batteries. i store them in individual plastic bags in a dry cool container yet find they leak and leave crystals even after only a few months kept in ideal conditions. I have never ever experienced that with everready, duracell or any other brand. really bad factory defect I guess?

name: RobB
title: Dead in the box, in less than two years
review: I bought a box of 36 these AAA batteries in December 2018. I've got about half remaining, and they're now totally dead. And the ones I've installed in devices have died also. Energizers last 5 years, so buying the cheaper Amazon brand was a very poor choice.

name: delump
title: Price to performance - Unbeatable!
review: Are these the longest life battery out there? No, but they are much better than the cheap ones and aren't much worse than batteries lasting 10% longer. Twice the price for 10% more life - do the math!Bottom line, the price to hours of use just can't be beat! I only buy these.

name: Jessica Dougherty
title: Great life-span on these batteries
review: We seem to go through batteries SO fast with all the toys and electronics that my kids and husband have. I feel like I was always running out and buying more batteries and they seemed SO expensive. We decided to try out the AamazonBasics batteries because they are cheaper than purchasing in the store...and because they are delivered to my front door and I don't have to remember to grab them at the grocery store or make a special trip out to get batteries. So far we've been really impressed with these batteries. I was afraid that they would be like the super cheap ones you can get at the dollar store and not really have much life to them and have to replace them even more frequently. We've been using them in several well-loved (read used all the dang time!) toys as well as some electronic devices and we haven't had any issues with them not having a good life span to them. We will definitely purchase these again when our supply gets low - thanks for an affordable, easy option to the seemingly never-ending need for batteries!

name: Lyle B.
title: Tests show these are the best buy for the money.
review: I recently reviewed a test on YouTube were they tested most of the major brands of batteries. This was not a test completed by a testing company, but rather an intelligent fellow that tested a number of products. When comparing the Amazon batteries side by side with well known batteries, the Amazon batteries were the best batteries for the money. This was not a testing laboratory but his methods appeared to be sound and real world.

name: Sarah
title: Dangerously bad product
review: These were not good. I did easily get a refund, but wish they would've just worked. Some batteries had battery acid on them which got on me opening them, so had to throw those away immediately. Then another got so hot when I used it that I couldn't even remove it from the product it was in. These are actually dangerously bad.

name: V. Anderson
title: Battery life is right for the price, warning and postive
review: High output, not really. Not sure who makes them. They last better than Energizer Industrial batteries but not as well as regular Energizer batteries.So far no problems with leaks, but battery life is right for the price.

name: Al Glover
title: the most important thing to know is they work
review: As a photographer, guitar player and computer nerd (I'm at that awkward stage between geek and geezer), I have far too many devices that need triple a (AAA) batteries. Beyond these being reasonably priced and working, what else is there to say? hmmmmm . . . ok, I like that one end is differently colored than the other and that the + and - symbols are large enough to read . . . the soft pastel grey is good for the eyes when changing batteries in bright sunlight . . . so far, they fit every device I have that takes AAA batteries . . .

name: Ben
title: Waste of money.
review: Don't buy these!! I purchased a pack of 36 AAA batteries because I have 5 battery run candles of various sizes that I like to have on sometimes. And I mean just 'some times'. Each take 3 batteries. I didn't start using them right away but I realized that almost the next time I turned on a candle the batteries would be dead without them hardly being used, just sitting in the candle. So I started to make a note, on the candle, of the date that I replaced with new batteries....to actually see how long they would last. I don't usually send in reviews but this time I have to say....don't waste your money on these batteries! At Christmas, I turned on the candle thats in the picture. Dead. According to the date I'd put on the bottom, I'd put in new batteries(straight from the sealed package) on 11/13/19. The other 3 dead batteries taped together I kept from another candle were dated 'installed 9/11/19 dead on 11/11/19'. The others are dead from previous candles. And these candles were hardly used. Before I realized how useless these batteries are, I had ordered another package of AA size......which are now just sitting in a box. What's the point of installing them in something when they have no life! Yes, the price is tempting.....but not worth it!

name: Double D
title: Did not last like energizers
review: I ordered these Sept 28, 2020 and I would definitely not buy again, unless I just happened to get a bad batch. I always test the batteries for full capacity before replacing old ones, and these were sub par... plus they do not last as long as energizer.They would probably be ok for an led light application but not for something that demands a heavy drain.

name: Samuel
title: DON‚ÄôT FORGET THE BATTERIES
review: These are good batteries. Probably as good if not slightly better. Definitely good considering the price of batteries these days. The batteries come in nice sturdy boxes and wrapped in packs of four, perfect count for most items. I never purchase an item on Amazon without adding batteries, it is very nice to have the option during purchases. Happy Amazoning

name: Syde
title: You get what you paid for..
review: I bought these for a pair of kid‚Äôs walkie talkies which required three AAA batteries. My 10 year old knows well to turn the walkies off when unused but after one day of, the batteries are dead. You will go through this pack of batteries quickly because they don‚Äôt hold their charge long enough. I‚Äôm glad I tried them but I won‚Äôt be reordering these tbh.

name: Beatriz
title: Long life and great packaging.
review: Excellent value for your money, considering the longevity, and the amount of batteries you get. With other brands, I would have to replace the batteries on my roku remote every couple months, and with these, its already been a couple months and they are still going strong.I also appreciate the neat packaging they come in. It makes it easy for storing them and accessing them later.

name: Christopher B.
title: Slim profile makes for easier storage
review: So first things first I really like how these batteries were shipped to me. Instead of grouping all of the batteries into a cube they stacked them in a single file. What I mean by that is that the batteries were stacked like a CD and was slim which allowed me store the batteries in my DVD console area. These batteries are supposed to have a long shelf life time will tell if they have less than expected battery capacity later on I will make an update to this review. So far haven't had any issues with them.

name: HumanIcicle
title: Best value, long lasting batteries
review: I've been buying the AmazonBasics batteries of all sizes for awhile now and I'm very pleased with the performance of these batteries. I've used them for just about anything you can use batteries with and they last just as long as the big brands at half of the cost.They work great in my Xbox controllers, TV remotes, grill igniter, toys, smoke alarms, everything and the best thing is that they come in packaging that isn't a hassle to open. Simple cardboard packaging, no plastic shell to cut through and easy to store.

name: Linda
title: AA‚Äôs packaging came apart completely in Shipping
review: Batteries were shipped in small box. When I opened the box, the packaging had come apart & the batteries had been rolling all over inside the box, which was much bigger than the batteries package. I don‚Äôt know how it will affect the batteries in the long run. I have had a much better experience before with batteries when they were covered with small bubble pack, taped, & then put inside the box - no problem then.

name: lscs102
title: Just right
review: I don't like to buy batteries in large quantities because I've had so many 'explode' before I could use them. Eight was just the right amount, and these were the only ones I found in packages of that amount. My flashlight burns very brightly again! I have not had them long enough to judge how long they last, but I have confidence that they will do a good job!

name: allthekngshorses
title: Don't waste your money!
review: Wish I had done this before the return policy expired. We are replacing batteries in our remote EVERY WEEK, if not sooner. My husband gets a few uses in his infra-red measuring tape before (which he uses many times each day) and gets about 30-40 photos on his small digital camera before he needs to put new ones in!These really are the worst batteries we have ever used! Gonna stick with brand names-NOT AMAZON-from now on!

name: GUTS!!
title: DO NOT BUY AMAZON BRANDED BATTERIES. I REPEAT. DO. NOT. BUY.
review: I'm telling you. I don't care if "they" have 47,000 5 star reviews. Don't buy them! they stink. stank. stunk!The worst. We've had AAA, AA, and C. half the time they don't work. I've had a few leak acid (stored properly) and it's always a gamble. you truly do get what you pay for in this case. stay as far away from the bezos brand batteries as you can. pay a few extra for the brand name. you'll thank me later.

name: Garrett H.
title: Great product for the price! I'm impressed.
review: The battery life isn't as long as one would hope but they certainly do the trick for a few weeks. I purchased these because the prices at the store are ridiculous, so I decided to give these a try. I wouldn't compare them to the high end batteries because the price alone will give you a decent indication as to how long they will last. I would buy again when needed. I could see these as being great for kids toys as they aren't used as long as a remote might be.

name: hybroanglid
title: Good batteries, great price!
review: These batteries seem to run just as long and as hard as the name brand batteries, but they cost quite a bit less. I love being able to buy so many at once so that I know I have them when I need them (like throughout the holidays). They were packed well, too. I don't think I'll waste my money on other batteries again.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Not worth it!
review: I bought these Amazon AAA batteries to use in a variety of Xmas decorations which I'd put up a week before Tgiving. Initially, these Amazon batteries were working well and lasting a decent amount of time (about a week for each decoration) but I've had to replace them all in every dec THREE TIMES in the past two weeks. That is ridiculous. I ordered some Amazon D size batteries a couple of days ago; doubt they'll do much better. Have energizer and Rayovac batteries in other decorations and have only replaced them all ONE TIME since the week I b4 Tgiving when I put everything up! Energizer and Rayovac are the best batteries, PERIOD. Amazon, get your damn game on with your battery products!!

name: Scott J. Fletcher
title: JUNK - These batteries are garbage
review: Do not buy these batteries. I have purchased AA and AAA and they are all weak and do not last. They do not power anything. They are dead right out of the package. DO NOT waste your money. These should be zero stars.

name: JD Lewis
title: Reasonably good battery but some inconsistency
review: These are definitely good value for the money, however I have noticed issues: 1. I have had one battery in the lot "dead" and a couple have not lasted as long as I was expecting compared to the other brand names. Hence it loses a star at least. Otherwise most seem to be very good and because they are so much cheaper and I use them for candles, I'll likely order again.

name: Christine Aust
title: Caution: do not work on all items
review: These do not work in some items. We bought this to put in all of our Christmas animated toys and they would not work in any of them. We went out and bought some typical energizer batteries and they all worked just fine. At first we thought everything was broken but it turned out the connection on these batteries just is not as good or there‚Äôs something about the style that does not work in some things. They did work in our remote and our clock but again did not work and many other items. I would be hesitant to buy Especially since you cannot return them. We are out a good chunk of money since we bought such a big pack which is really disappointing.

name: Ngrab
title: Only come with a 1/4 charged left in them brand new
review: I have had theses batteries for almost 3 weeks and had to change out my simple Roku remote twice now, the remote has no tv controls or voice options that would drain it. These batteries last about a week an half in a bottom line Roku remote. The Rayovac ones I was replacing with Amazon's AAA batteries last almost a year in the remote or more. My Mom bought these same batteries for a thermometer and each and every battery brand new put into the thermometer only shown to have a 1/4 charge of life left in it on the battery meter in thermometer. Changed them out to dollar store batteries and the life left in them was fully charged. So FYI Amazon brand Batteries come with only a 1/4 charge of bettery life in them. That's data from 144AAA Amazon batteries

name: KinTrinity
title: Amazon batteries blew in a Amazon fire remote (2nd gen) destroying it.
review: I ordered the Amazon batteries to use in an Amazon fire remote (2nd gen) and in less than 24 hours the remote did not work. I pull the case to see if batteries are installed ok and battery dust is all over the remote and cover. Tried a different brand of battery in it and remote is gone. So now I have to buy a $29 remote because I used $0.61 worth on the manufacturers batteries. bought 36 for $10.99. They are all getting disposed of properly.

name: Danny
title: Used or "empty"
review: They came loose in the box. I used office tape to tape them but only realized they were drained already. I used them and only after a while I came to question the quality when PC mouse was dead after only a week. I tried them all on my coffee electric frother and none will start the mini mixer. Maybe I got a returned item, HOWEVER WILL STAY AWAY. I wanted to return them when I saw they are loose in the box, but the price didn't worth the effort at that time. Next time I will return any open / unsealed item.

name: Loud Mic ‚ÄúMike‚Äù
title: Not worth the cheap price
review: I received these batteries on July 22, 2019. Today is September 4, 2019. I know I didn‚Äôt install these batteries in my wall clock the day i got them, but for the sake of argument let‚Äôs say I did. Yesterday when i got home from work, the battery in the clock was dead. That is 21 days, or 3 weeks. This battery replaced one that had been in the same clock for well over a year.

name: Sarah Ellis
title: You get what you pay for
review: Got sick of constantly running out of AAA batteries for my remote and fire stick so came here to buy in bulk. Was excited to find a large pack at this price. In the end it doesn't do much to save you money as these batteries die much faster than the name brand ones. They might be ok for something you don't use often, but for heavily used items I would spend the money on the name brand batteries, or prepare to be changing batteries ALOT

name: Christine
title: Battery Disappointment
review: I am very disappointed in these batteries.I normally buy batteries made in China because I have so many flameless candles throughout my house because they are cheaper.But this time I decided to try Amazon AAA and AA and have to say that I will not purchase this brand again because the cheaper Chinese batteries last longer.

name: Rainer S.
title: Bad battery‚Äôs don‚Äôt work for me.
review: I put them in a Dish remote, and in 5 days they were dead. I feel ripped off from Amazon. And I‚Äôm a good customer.

name: Kyle B.
title: Good batteries
review: I usually buy the name brand batteries over the generics because they seem to last longer, but I decided to give AmazonBasics a shot. I was pretty impressed with how long these batteries last. My Roku remote eats batteries like a fat kid eats cake, and these last just as long or longer than the name brand (Duracell or Energizer).

name: Freebird
title: Fantastic for the price
review: Ever since Amazon started selling batteries, I have given up on the copper top and bunny brand. They last almost as long as the other brands, however for the price, you could essentially buy 3 packs for Amazon Basics for the price of 1 pack of brand name batteries. Very pleased with them and will continue to order them. Highly recommended!

name: Madhuri
title: Horrible batteries
review: I purchased 20 pack in June. Used first 3 for my newborn's toy. It stopped working in 10 days. I replaced batteries nd it worked for a couple of hours. Next 3 couldn't make it work. I assumed the toy was bad. Ordered a replacement and even that wouldn't work. I didnt consider that batteries could be bad, how could I? They were purchased 3 months ago and were stored properly. And how often do you see new batteries don't work? I see that never. At least with Duracell I never saw that. Finally it struck me. I replaced those batteries with my TV remote AAA batteries (of Duracell brand) and the toy started working. I called customer service and they refunded me for it but such hassle and bad experience!!!! I am amazed why would Amazon let their name get such a hit for batteries!!

name: SeanM
title: Last A Long Time
review: I have a set of 7 LED candles at at 3 batteries per candle this was a great deal, these batteries last longer than other name brand batteries that cost much more and they cost much less. Don't buy batteries just because of the name buy the one that work and don't break the bank, these are the only batteries I'll buy from now on.

name: Kara
title: Works just as well as Energizer and Duracell!
review: So inexpensive for the quatity of batteries in the package! Before testing out the quality of the batteries, that price point made me already perfectly happy even if these turned out to be below average in performance. But what a wonderful surprise! They perform just as well as both Energizer and Duracell! Customer for life 100%

name: Yusef farrell
title: Great price for durable batteries
review: I was really hesitant about purchasing these after seeing the reviews about exploding batteries or them only lasting for a couple days. I did not experience this at all! These are going to last me awhile. I‚Äôve used them on my fire stick remote and I‚Äôm still using the original first two pairs from the box who it 1-2 months later. This is a STEAL can‚Äôt beat the price.

name: Nic
title: Great batteries and a great price!
review: My kids are battery hogs and it seems like everything they use requires triple A's, which of course I never seem to have enough of when I need them. This pack of 20 AAA batteries is a fantastic deal for the price. Compared to Kirkland and other major brands, these seem to be pretty comparable as far as battery life goes. These are powering my remote controls, wireless mouse and keyboard, multiple flashlights and electric toothbrushes. I have had no issues with any of these dying fast as of yet. I also really appreciated the box these came in. Makes storage very easy... no more searching around my junk drawer looking for loose batteries! I also bought these on a sale and with subscribe and save.... the price couldn't be beat! I plan to update this review if anything changes. So far though, I am extremely satisfied with the performance of these batteries.

name: Don
title: Batteries
review: They are cheaper and they work. I don't know if they work as long as higher priced batteries - didn't test that. Lots of batteries go toward my wife's lighted/musical gadgets at different holidays and these are best for that. In a year when she pulls them out again the batteries are dead whether cheap or higher priced batteries.

name: Fern
title: Performed well.
review: These batteries lasted 2 months exactly(4/9/0-6/9/20) in my fire stick remote. I used Harbor Freight and they lasted from 6/9/20 to 7/24/20. Keep in mind that I paid $4 for 24 Harbor Freight and $7 for 20 Amazon. Sometimes you can get Harbor Freight for free with a cupon. Overall Im happy with my purchase. I hope these helps. I will try Duracell next and see.

name: J. Grosse
title: customer support!
review: After over a month of ownership of this product. I have found some batteries that just don't work. Finally I tested them all and 8 out of the whole box don't even work. I tried to find some support or and store owner to email and discuss this but after the return window is gone it seems all other support is gone too. Very dissappointed. Used to be able to find some support through Amazon but now it seems it's so buried I can't find it.

name: Take care of the earth it's our home üè°
title: Good jobGreat value for the money not like it so far
review: Nothing I didn‚Äôt like that came packed well very well as impressed they didn‚Äôt go to my horse barn it‚Äôs a miracle I bet it to many different things I‚Äôve shipped out they seem to work fine no leakage so far I hope the price doesn‚Äôt go up again otherwise I go back to wholesalers thank you Prime guarantee thank you sellerGood job

name: Lily
title: Don't last as long and leak
review: I bought these because usually Amazon products are better than cheaper brands, however these stink. They sat in a toy barely used, died, and leaked in it. The cheap manufacturer batteries the toy came with lasted 2 years, and didn't leak at all. I would liken these to dollar store brands. I will not buy again. Very disappointed.

name: PawPawRon
title: Seem To Be Lasting As Long As Duracell In Our Portable Radio
review: We have not had the batteries that long to give a long term review but they do seem to be providing good and long service for a portable radio we are currently using them in. Overall, I believe they are a great value and will most likely continue purchasing the AmazonBasics brand for the other size batteries we use in our electronics.

name: adam dolin
title: I‚Äôve always wondered really how much difference there is.
review: I‚Äôve always wondered how much nonsense goes into pricing AAA and AA batteries, and if there is really that much of a noticeable difference in length of use. After going through two huge packs of both with my small family of 3, in less than a week. I now know the answer. I won‚Äôt lie, we use our batteries. But one Duracell lasts infinitely longer than this whole package did.

name: Floyd "Al" DeShazo
title: Amazon basic AAA Alkaline batteries
review: When in ordered there batteries I was not sure what to expect. I must say I was pleasantly surprised. I tested each and everyone one for voltage which was 1.61V and made in Indonesia. The last batteries I purchased were Energizer's Industrial grade which also carried the same 1.61 volts. The expiration date on these Amazon basics AAA's is 2027 so I expect them to have a good shelf life I believe these batteries will perform every bit as well as the energizers I last purchased. I took advantage of the snail mail delivery I received a $5 Amazon credit which made this deal even better. From the reviews I've read I would highly recommend purchasing these batteries over any name brand for General use purposes as I'm not sure how they would stand up too I drain situations. But I will get back to you on that one with my next purchase.

name: Mark Muchow
title: They are cheap!
review: I have had to replace the batteries in my outdoor temperature about every 3 months, used to last a year with Duracell batteries. Will not buy again! You get what you pay for!

name: TxDee779361
title: Junk
review: I went thru approx 24 in less than a month on my BP monitor. Thought monitor defaulty. Nope. Tried on a couple other gadgets. Remotes, motion sensor lights, etc. Failed within days!

name: MBM
title: Amazon AAA batteries
review: The most important thing for me is that these batteries don't leak over time in the products, even under a variety of temperatures. I had batteries leaking and ruining electronics before, because the acid or whatever chemicals they used corroded the internals unknown to me. These also seem to last quite a while surprisingly at this price point. So I started using Amazon batteries in everything in all sizes.

name: Jeep Girl
title: There IS a reason they cost less
review: These are no better then Rayovac batteries. We had high hopes based on the reviews. Lesson learned.....can‚Äôt always believe the reviews. Maybe some people have had good luck with Amazon batteries. We‚Äôve tried several different sizes. They don‚Äôt last as long as the Duracell‚Äôs, they leak. I guess you get what you pay for. If you buy these batteries, I hope they work for you. I‚Äôm going back to Duracell.

name: wiredweird
title: So far, so good
review: They're new to me, so I can't weigh in on any of the long-term stuff (like longevity and leakage). But, this is a world where alkaline batteries are commodities, and this looks like a quite adequate commodity. If experience warrants a down-grade from my 5-star review, you'll see it here first.-- wiredweird

name: UNyque B
title: Have Extras
review: So I think my purpose was to have durable batteries. These died within a week in my remote control and my temperature reader. I have a battery tester so when I tried most were low or just plain dead. I did get a few good ones. I normally do not write negative post but with the weather the way it is, be stocked up.

name: Jen
title: Die after 3 days
review: I ordered a pack and they were defective and they sent replacement. Replacement is also defective. Never had this problem with their batteries. I put them in my led lights and they worked for about 3 days Wasted my money.

name: Let Me Help
title: Great value for the money
review: I have bought these on my business account, for work, prior to this purchase and was so pleased. I couldn‚Äôt believe the value for the money! So, with kids and a husband who all go through batteries like hot cakes, I just knew I needed to order these for our home use too. Even if they don‚Äôt last as long as other brands (I haven‚Äôt literally tracked how they compare.. I‚Äôm just saying hypothetically) you get sooo many more for such a great price! Totally worth it!

name: Yamin
title: Good value for money.
review: I bought these batteries for my son‚Äôs toys.I tried dollar store batteries first but they did not last for more than 4 hours.I did not want to spend money on buying duracell batteries ,So I bought these to see.I will say these are good but not as good as duracell.These battery lasted twice compared to dollar store batteries so definetly worth the price.

name: Douglas W
title: Good batteries
review: I've ordered several brands of rechargeable batteries off of Amazon with mixed results. Some of the brands I've ordered seem to maintain a charge while in use for longer than these batteries and some brands are garbage. The Amazon branded batteries have been consistent. They are always good. Some brands may be a little better but they will cost you more money so based on consistency and value these batteries deserve 5 stars.

name: Greg W
title: May get a bunch of batteries that are half drained.
review: Not sure what Amazon decided to do on these batteries but half of them are not strong enough to power a little handheld fan that only needs 1 AAA battery. I had to check multiple batteries to find one that had enough power to power my pocket fan. Works great for remotes since they don‚Äôt require that much power. Won‚Äôt be ordering Amazon Batteries anymore.

name: Troy A
title: Solid battery for a cheap price
review: Bought a pack of these cause they were cheaper than what I found at walmart. I thought what they hay, I'll give the generic amazon brand batteries a try.The batteries arrived in a cardboard box (like the batteries are held in the box itself), and are plastic wrapped in sets of 4. I slid the box into the battery drawer and it's been nice having the pack there.The plastic wrap is easy enough for an adult to get off, but I think my toddler would be challenged for a while to get batteries loose (I consider this a plus).The batteries are holding up fairly well, no duds that we've found so far. I've put them in various toys & devices around the home, and they seem to hold up as well as other name brands.Once I'm down to my last pack of 4, I'll be reordering more. I also ordered these in AAA, and I'll probably order them in the crazy toddler toy sizes if they make them.

name: Charlcie Cagle
title: Why I Love Amazon Basics!
review: I'm always the person who literally never has batteries of any size and I love that Amazon does this! They ship fast with prime and they are affordable, even in large quantities. They last as long as any of the more expensive name brands from what I can tell, too. My favorite part is it's affordable enough to allow me to keep various sizes stocked so that I don't have to try and remember to pick some up when I go to the store (which, let's face it, I DON'T ever remember) or have to make a special trip when a smoke detector or remote goes out (which again, I usually don't I j listen to to annoying beeping or get up to change channels). It's a small thing but I appreciate how it's simplified by busy life some!

name: Barbara Turbin
title: They just don't last as long as the competitors.
review: They work, absolutely! And they look really cute and come packaged well. But, they just don't last very long.For example, I have two small strands of fairy lights that are battery dependent (pictured with AA battery for size comparison). Each strand needs 3 AA batteries. They have a timer allowing for 8 hours of use every day. When the ikeabrand batteries died (after being in use for 1 year), I replaced the batteries with these amazon basics batteries. The amazon basic batteries only lasted one month. That's an 11 month difference for the same amount of usage. Maybe I just got a bad batch. *shrugs* I am, and will always be, an amazon basics purchaser, but I'll go back to other battery brands once these run out.

name: A. Haag
title: Great value, long lasting
review: These are long lasting (as far as I can tell! They haven‚Äôt died in my remote control or wireless keyboard and mouse, yet and I bought these several months ago)

name: mkysay
title: So far so good
review: I bought these after reading the reviews. They came nicely packaged. No issues so far with the things we have been using them for (toys, remotes). Will update if we have any issues.

name: Sheri0604
title: Great batteries
review: LOVE AMAZON BATTERIES! I keep stocked up on them for the kids toys. MUCH better then paying a ton of money for name brand batteries when these r just as good

name: Robinson
title: Don't waste your money, dollar store has better quality batteries.
review: For being an Amazon product I assumed it would be good quality, and bang for the buck. I was wrong, these batteries have poor power, and don't last but a quick minute.The batteries at our local Dollar Tree are 3X more powerful and long lasting.TV remotes are going through these batteries every 2-3 weeks.Definitely not worth the money, you're better off just going to your local dollar store.

name: Stephen
title: People need to read what the product is
review: I'm not sure why people are putting these batteries in a battery charger. Then when they malfunction they complain and then give them a poor review. These ARE NOT RECHARGABLE BATTERIES. These are normal batteries. If you would put expensive batteries in a charger that is this type the same thing will happen. Pay attention people. They work well. I use them in low drain devices such as my remotes and thermometers.

name: DML
title: Very short life
review: I used these batteries to power my Sentry safe locking mechanism. I went through 12 batteries in eight weeks. They ran out of power and leaked. The Duracells that I'm using now have been in the safe for two months, and they are working perfectly. The problem is not the safe...

name: Shannon
title: Dangerous
review: I just had a really scary experience with these batteries. I bought a new remote and put a pair of these batteries in the remote and 10 minutes later i grabbed the remote and it was hot to the touch. When i took the batteries out they hurt my hand. After i put another brand of batteries in my remote everything was ok. I wonder how bad it could of been if i didn't notice this.

name: zachus
title: Not impressed but have their purpose
review: I'm a huge Amazon fan and I know the appeal here for most and me as well is the price but at the end of the day, you get what you pay for and these do not last anything near the better more expensive batteries out that. If it's easy to change batteries then this is the way to go but if you have something it's difficult or a pain or you just don't want to the hassle I would suggest spending more and getting the upper brands, and by that I mean the more expensive, most expensive of the batteries out there, they really do last longer. It's a shame because you know they have the ability to make batteries last longer, all companies, and yet they don't just so we'll come back and buy more

name: Bob G of Troy
title: Decent quality with the Amazon name
review: Low price means you can change the batteries without worrying about wasting money if they still have some life left in them. Doing ALL the remotes at one time avoids hassles with all the channel surfing and TV services we now are using regularly. A low powered remote screws up your program selections on the various services.

name: CalJan
title: They Work
review: The price is right. I just got them and haven't seen how long they list. Judging from other reviews, I'll see whether I should add or subtract stars._______Now that I've had them and used them for awhile I will say that they start out weaker. The motion sensor doesn't detect any movement until you are quite close to them, and the light is dimmer.

name: GENE
title: SUPER GOOD PRICE BUT
review: MORE IMPORTANTLY THEY REALLY LAST AS A RETIRED ELECTRONIC TECH I WANTED TO SEE HOW GOOD THESE WERE AND DID A 24 HOUR DISCHARGE BENCH TEST AGAINST DURACELL AND RAYOVAC AND THEY ALL WERE WITHIN 5 PERCENT OF EACH OTHER IN CAPACITY NO. ONE WAS DURACEL AND THREE WAS RAYOVAC BUT BECAUSE OF PRICE TO CAPACITY RATING ( WALMART PRICE) NUMBER ONE WAS AMAZON

name: 16copper
title: Just OK
review: I've used these batteries for awhile now and they were a decent value for the money. The last bulk pack I bought were all nearly dead when they arrived.

name: AHumphrey73
title: good price
review: they are just batteries, not much to write about them, it was a good price compared to stores, I recenbtly purchased a variety pack at Sams Club and I was super disappointed since the pack had 4 of the aaa (most commonly used) and 4 aa, the rest? 9v and sizes C and D, a fiasco. I was pleased with the Amazon pack,

name: eMike
title: Your true AAA battery solution!
review: Well, I just received these AAA Amazon Basic batteries, and although I immediately threw away and replaced the ‚Äústill good‚Äù other batteries in one of my critical medical devices (a heavy user TENS Unit), only time will tell. BUT ... if my experience with the Amazon Basics AA batteries is any indication, I expect them to meet/exceed expectations! And the price? Packaging? Prompt delivery? All outstanding!

name: Tina Mapes
title: Batteries are not good!
review: I was extremely disappointed as these Amazon batteries didn‚Äôt last even close to how long my Duracell and energizer batteries last. I bought them to use in an angel that lights up. Don‚Äôt waste your money or your time taken to order and now I have to return. I see that many people did give five stars, so, the only thing I can think of is, perhaps, I received a bad batch. I don‚Äôt know, but I am going back to my door style and or energizer batteries.

name: T
title: Hardly a good value
review: Five dollars for eight batteries that seem little better than the name-brand four-packs sold at dollar stores. Why did I get them? Because I was clearly searching for ‚Äúaaaa‚Äù batteries, not aaa, but these came prominately up in their search engine, combined with the confusion of pop-up advertising Amazon now interrupts my shopping cart with. Yes, still my fault overall, but a purchase should be easier instead of becoming a quest to filter out unwanted pitches.

name: Zhowze
title: Buy them you want regret it!
review: Amazon batteries never have I had a battery last as long as these have and they are the cheapest 100 batteries between $20-$25 you can‚Äôt buy leading brands for anywhere near that price and I‚Äôve tested them in several different items remotes, toy cars, and flash lights etc. they out do and last up to twice as long as other brands thank you amazon for yet another amazing product!

name: Jor El
title: Great Value. Just as good as Duracel!
review: I am a big sucker for name brands. But somethings are just really the same in quality. And this is that product. These Amazon batteries have been tested in my remotes, weather displays, clocks, flashlights, and all over my house. They are dependable and long lasting as Energizer or Duracel batteries. Kudos to Amazon ! Five Stars. Will buy more. Thank you for offering savings on all sizes of batteries.

name: Norman King
title: Batteries, mmm... batteries?
review: They are batteries, a good price, they are batteries, lots of them, they are batteries, beyond that not much else to say for them, did I mention they were batteries?

name: QS
title: Great value on bulk batteries
review: These batteries are priced very well! Been using Amazon batteries for awhile now haven't had any issues with leaking batteries. They may not last as long as some of the competitors but for the price you pay for these i'm not too worried. Overall very please with performance/price combination for these.

name: David Brown
title: More than enough power!
review: We use a lot of portable electronics and we tried with so many of the inexpensive batteries to no avail. Each one would run out of life way before the expected end, and we'd end up buying more and not really saving any money in doing so. Lesson learned; you pay for what you get and these are certainly long-lasting batteries and we have yet to drain one yet!

name: Case
title: Super happy with these!
review: Omg! I was skeptical because of the price on these being so good but the reviews pushed me to purchase!They work fine. I haven‚Äôt noticed failure in them like with other ‚Äòcheap‚Äô batteries. These are priced cheap but great quality. Good Job Amazon!As long as these batteries stay at the price I got them for I will never buy another brand!

name: FLPA14
title: Worst AAA batteries ever.
review: AAA batteries: Used on my bed remote controls which usually work for more than a year. In fact I previous batteries lasted over two years (Another brand). However, these Batteries only worked for less than three months. I tried to replace with 4 new batteries, but they did not work. Tried 4 more and 4 more with same results so took 4 Duracell batteries from the other bed remote and they work. These aren‚Äôt returnable apparently so I am stuck with them. And I also bought AA batteries at same time. Hope they work. Never will order either of these batteries. They are not returnable and no number to call. First and last Amazon Prime disappointment. Renewal coming up. I will have to do some serious thinking before I decide to renew. Purchased less than 2 months ago.

name: Kindle Customer
title: buy these batteries
review: I buy only Amazon batteries. Seems that in the past twenty years, everything has changed to batteries. You can buy them at the dollar stores, but they only last about 73 seconds. You can buy them at the grocery if you skip a meal or two. You can do okay if you stock up when they're on sale at chain drugstores.
