Amazon's batteries, all sizes, are always fresh, just as good as any alkaline brand-name, and you really would be hard pressed to find a better price.

name: J. Smith
title: NOT easy to use packaging
review: I discovered you can buy batteries in easy to use cardboard boxes rather than store display bubble packs that take forever (and tools) to extract the batteries. These are NOT the easy access batteries!!Although they came in a cardboard box, the batteries are bundled in groups that are wrapped in shrinkwrap. I had to spend a lot of time fighting the batteries out of the shrinkwrap. Almost the same amount of time as the store bubble packs.The chinese batteries are probably ok but not easy to get to. However, you can buy other batteries that come in easy to open cardboard boxes.

name: Michelle Dexter Logan
title: Rip off price for 4 AAA get Amazon's 16 pk AAA
review: I typically go with the 16pk of Amazon AAA batteries because of the amount of Firestick remote controls in our house. Cost of the 4 pk was what I could afford this month. I'd definitely go with the 16pk rather than the 4 pk if possible.

name: K. Taylor
title: Work really well for me.
review: I use these in remotes and a LED flashlight. For my particular use, I think they work just great. There might be some longer lasting batteries out there if you read various reviews, but for the price, I think they last just the right amount of time. In my flashlight, it requires 3 batteries and I can have the light on for about 15-20 minutes at a time as I check cars while working a night security position. I can get a few weeks without needing to change them no problem.

name: Floyd Campbell
title: Strong Battery
review: Ordered these batteries on 10-16-18 and they have an expiration date of 02-2018. ALMOST TEN YEARS!Compared them in identical 3 cell new flashlights with the leading national brand.Turned both flashlights on and waited til they burned down.The Amazon brand burned three hours longer than the leading national brand.The Amazon brand was actually brighter most of the burning time than the leading national brand.I AM CONVINCED that 100 of these Amazon batteries are worth the $20 we paid for them.

name: C. G.
title: AmazonBasics Batteries are life!
review: I've been impressed with the performance and quality of AmazonBasics battery. Though the price point is pretty low, don't let that fool you - they are every bit as long-lasting and durable as the brand-named batteries on the market. In my opinion, there's no reason to spend more on a battery because of it being a name that you're familiar because I can tell you that my experience has been amazing. And honestly, I can't tell the difference between AmazonBasics batteries and other batteries that I've bought in the past that has cost me much, much more money!

name: H. Turner
title: Shoddy shipping cost me 1/3 of my shipment
review: Because of shoddy shipping container (without even one tiny piece of tape on the ends) I received my order in this condition with only 23 out of 36 batteries enclosed. Please never use this type of packaging again on my orders. Batteries are heavy and if given slack, can easily batter through the flimsy ends on this packaging. Apparently there was no usability testing on this packaging.

name: Berggie
title: Practical packaging against humidity if you ain't get it no wet intentionally.
review: Love it!!!! It's in paper box packaging not the plastic one. I can close it and keep it safe from getting rusty. I bought Duracell before and it was in the package we always see in Wal-Mart. Half way through it, all batteries got rusty and things, given my state is super humid. This packaging for those batteries should be a fix to my old problems.

name: Kimberly Johns
title: Perfect Triple A batteries.
review: Love how they're packaged so neatly, so they can be stored neatly and not just thrown in a drawer. Were having a Halloween party and everything that needs batteries is triple a. This was the best deal for bulk batteries. So far weve used them in controllers and lights and weve had no problems!

name: Barbara Vaughan
title: Bad batch
review: Usually theses are fine, but this batch was not. I should have returned them, but I was hoping it was just a few bad ones and then it was too late.

name: Scott Wasserman
title: Great batteries for a great price, and packaged very nicely!
review: The value for these AAA batteries is amazing. In the past, I have always purchased my batteries from Costco but this is an even better deal. I love how it comes packaged in the cardboard box, allowing me to easily organize all of my Amazon batteries by just stacking the cardboard boxes on top of each other. The batteries have worked as I would expect them to.

name: Juan911411
title: Bets value for your money.
review: I've tried Bjs and Walmart and you cannot get this amount of batteries for the same price. They work great on toys just as great as Duracell.

name: VeeSee
title: These batteries are already dead when you buy them.
review: I purchased these batteries to power my labeler I just purchased in the same order. I put the 4 brand new batteries into the labeler. The screen on the labeler immediately flashed " low battery! I thought it was a fluke and printed 4 labels. The next day I tried to print 1 label. The labeler turned off and would not print the previewed label shown on the screen. I changed the batteries, using 4 more "new" AAA batteries. Once again the labeler screen flashed "low battery" with the new, never-used before batteries. So I printed 1 label. I would not recommend buying these batteries.

name: Sara
title: Don‚Äôt recommend
review: I purchased in December and it is now September and realizing that these batteries leaked and killed my remote control.... so we all know that‚Äôs major! üòíI went to use the last few batteries (before I knew it ruined the remote control) & they didn‚Äôt work at all. I tried 6 and none worked on two different items. Will not buy again nor do I recommend.

name: Dean A Dobbs
title: I use to be a manager at a battery store, and these will be what I continue to buy.
review: I worked at a battery and light bulb store as an associate and then manager, and while I am no electrical engineer, I would say that I know more than the average person when it comes to batteries. If you are looking for the longest lasting battery, go with lithium. But for alkaline and cheap, these will be my go to for AA/AAA. Great for things like remotes, more specifically I love these in my Fire TV remote. I highly recommend rechargeable AA NiMH over alkaline for the purpose of Xbox One controllers, but these do make a good back-up in a pinch!

name: Maya
title: Don't last very long
review: I have been trying to find batteries that will work well in a lantern. I have tried generic store brand, theseAmazonBasics, Duracell, Energizer lithium etc. So far these work about as long as the generic store brand.The longest working are the Energizer lithium, but none last very long. I think the lantern should have useda different size battery. I am sure these will work fine for some things, just not what I needed them for.

name: Luis Tobar
title: Good price
review: I use these batteries for my aviation headset and they last the same as energizer batteries. However, these are way cheaper. Very good price and quality.

name: SeaPea
title: Do not buy for devices that draw a lot of power!!!
review: These WILL leak when used in devices that draw a lot of power.. ie., flash lights, kids toys and illuminated remotes. Considering that these items are the main reason people purchase bulk batteries, go with the better batteries in smaller packs for your purchase. Trust me. These aren't worth it.

name: Dino Smith
title: JUNK product. DO NOT BUY!
review: I used this AA version of the product for a pair of wireless mic with 2 AA batteries per mic. It only lasted for less than a week (max usage per day is less than 1 hour); It put two AA batteries to a flashlight yesterday. I used the flashlight a few times to the washroom. Now it runs out of juice! The brand is a bad brand for batteries.

name: Christianna
title: Sometimes you need to pay the price for the name brand.
review: I bought these becasue it was Christmas and I bough a lot of crap for my boys that inevitability would need batteries and I wanted to be prepared... the cost respectable for the amount of batteries I received however the battery life was disappointing. I mean my son doesn‚Äôt use his tv remote that much for batteries to last less than 2 weeks. I also used them in my PC mouse... that experiment lasted maybe 1 week and that‚Äôs with me turning the wireless mouse off when it wasn‚Äôt in use. I won‚Äôt be a return customer.

name: JN
title: It took me 3 years to go through 36 batteries. That's pretty good, in my opinion!
review: These batteries are as good as you can get. I've had no trouble out of any I've had, and it took me 3 years to use up all that I ordered in 2017. So I would say they are first rate. I'll update this after I've used some of the new package, but I anticipate they'll meet my expectations.

name: Beverly K. Hogan
title: Batteries do not last very long
review: When I have used this battery, I have found I have to change them way more often than Duracell or Energizer (actually Ray-O-Vac possibly even lasts longer)

name: Palma Janelle Nardozza
title: Excellent Choice!
review: I bought these to use with some stick-on touch lights, which use a lot of battery power, and function best as emergency lights. I‚Äôve had the first set of batteries inside of those lights for several months and they are still going strong, even with use. I will definitely buy this brand of batteries again.

name: James P.
title: Excellent performance, no leakage, long storage life and half the price of brand names!
review: I've used these as a replacement for the nearly double in price of Duracell batteries. These last just as long as the Duracell batteries - a minute or two does not make a difference as my devices are on 24/7 - especially when these batteries are half the price! I have not had any leak, whether they were in their package or in any devices. The expiration dates on every shipment I've had so far have averaged 9 years with some 10 years from when I received them. This means they are fresh (recently made) and haven't been sitting around on a warehouse shelf for long. I like the green circular "negative" (-) indicator with the check mark (tick) on the side. Makes for quick installation in poor light. Excellent value and excellent performance!

name: Joy
title: Won‚Äôt buy again.
review: I‚Äôve purchased these for years and my last order of them died very fast. I had them in led string lights and they were on a timer- about two hours per day. They were dead within a week as opposed to buying them last year and they lasted three.

name: Matthew
title: Batteries work well
review: I used 9 right away for 3 tactical flashlights and compared them to a fourth flashlight with Duracell. The Duracells were unused but had been sitting around for a while so that may have played a role but the flashlights were brighter with these batteries.I might come back and change the review if the batteries wear out very fast but they definitely work well. And I like that they are broken down into 4 packs so I don't have to open all of them to use a few.

name: Web (.
title: Don't buy these Amazon batteries - all 36 were defective!!
review: I bought these AAA Amazon batteries due to good price, I figured Amazon would have decent stuff. EVERY ONE of these batteries was defective. I put them in remotes, in my Amazon fire stick remotes, flashlights, other electronics, and every time I did, they would last only 1-2 days and then go DEAD. If it was just one device, I'd say it was the device, but EVERY BATTERY in ANY device failed almost immediately! Normally Amazon is great, BUT THESE ARE DEFECTIVE... DON'T BUY THEM.

name: Denver's Mom
title: Used for Years. Good Buy. No Issues.
review: We've used these Amazon Basics batteries of various sizes for years now. We've used them in lots of things: remotes, Christmas lights, flashlights, clocks, etc. They've always all performed well with no issues. I like the way they come packaged in a box. It makes them not only easy to open but also easy to store them neatly and the sizes don't get mixed up. I definitely recommend them.

name: Ron T
title: Good deal for the money
review: What I needed were AAA and AA Alkaline batteries to restock our wall-mount batteryholder, prior to the seasonal change for remotes, flashlights, and so on. These are fairlygood for the price and only had 1 weak battery in each pack. Again, for the price,not bad!! I'll buy them again.

name: Roy Rod
title: Excellent value!
review: Arrived super fast through prime and we're very well packaged. $0.27 per battery in this 36-pack is a great value even if these batteries are not at the top of the pile in regards to charge. Much better than Dollar General and other similar budget batteries you can find out there.

name: Luz O.
title: Solar rechargable batteries dont work
review: My solar √±ights for outside my yard which i set it to make a row of lights for the night walkway well my new lights 2 out of 6 came with bad batteries thats why i purchased new batteries from amazon. Well only 2 of your natteries worked and did charged. The others have not worked.

name: Carol
title: It would be 5 star except the packaging
review: The packaging is the only problem. It comes plastic sealed in sets of 4 and you will have to cut with a knife between each one to get them out. Amazon needs to either package them more 'frustration free' or folks need to get used to having to cut them out of the little 4packs.

name: Teenie Nickel
title: Good batteries for my family needs
review: I am impressed with the quality of these batteries. They last as long as expected in comparison to other brands. I am constantly needing good batteries for my children‚Äôs electronic toys and my husband‚Äôs various gadgets, so it is great that these come in a pack of twenty. This is a thrifty way to get quality batteries, especially when I go through so many in just a short amount of time. They are packaged in a small, cardboard box, which can be opened and closed. This is great for storage and accessibility. I would recommend these batteries for sure. They are exactly what I was looking for. I will most likely be purchasing these again very soon.

name: Bruce Hasanali
title: -Great price -Good battery life -Efficiently packaged and easy to store CON's
review: PRO's:-Great price-Good battery life-Efficiently packaged and easy to storeCON's:-NoneOpinionated Ramblings:Batteries are a fairly straight forward item - you want them to last long, store well and cost as little as possible without compromising the first two points. Amazon knows the basics that everyone needs, and they can source these AAA batteries from someone who can build them best, price it as low as they fairly can, and get it shipped to me in two business days. Instead of paying a big markup to a "brand", Amazon cuts them out of the middle for me, and shares those savings. This is an efficient battery at a great price, and that is exactly what I'm looking for in a battery.

name: Don O
title: So far not bad for the price
review: Again, it is obvious that I purchased these batteries for the price. Many devices still use the AAA batteries and so far the batteries seem to be lasting reasonably long before replacement is required. I should be finding out about the shelf life pretty soon since several have been on the shelf for a while.

name: Tiance
title: Not bad & worth to buy
review: Although I only need 2 batteries, I buy 8 packs. The 4 packs batteries in the bookstore near me gonna cost me $4.99. On Amazon, you only need to spend $6 to get 8 packs. Don't hesitate to buy it if you need it.

name: annette828
title: Works
review: These actually work.I wanted something comparative to Energizer. And I was skeptical these might end up like cheap dollar store batteries. But I put it into my toddler‚Äôs battery-operated, electric toothbrush and it worked well!I have yet to test how long exactly this will last me.

name: Croughn
title: Terrible
review: These batteries suck and are no better then the dollar store, if you don‚Äôt wanna be changing batteries every month then don‚Äôt buy these

name: J. Silberman
title: Good Value for lots of uses.
review: Bought for remote controls and mini flash lights and everything else that needs AAA batteries. The price for the quantity is a no brainer. I can't remember the last time I didn't get a really good long run time for anything I've used the Amazon batteries.Hope that helps.

name: Teresa E Davis
title: Low Longevity
review: These batteries have only been lasting three days in my FireTV remote. We tried a name brand to see if maybe it was a remote issue and the remote is lasting fine with the name brand battery. We tested one of the brand new batteries out of the pack with our battery tester and it reads as LOW right out of the pack. Maybe we got a bad batch? I thought a 36 pack would last forever but now not so much.

name: Sk8brd
title: Remote control primary use
review: I typically use these for all the remotes in the house. I find sometimes that the longevity is not as expected on some of the remotes but this may be due to the overuse of scrolling through random series and movies on all the wonderful apps out there in cut the cord land due to pure boredom. Overall good value for money.

name: noni session
title: These batteries are AWFUL and DIE RAPIDLY
review: Isnt the point of batteries to maintain a charge???the issue is these batteries do not keep a charge they run down rapidly. They do not have a steady charge. I got these for my flashlight. after the install the flashlight flickered, was quite dim when the shake the flashlight that seems to affect the battery charge or connection...what ever it is it is completely awful! for the most part the shaking cause the light to dim out and flicker.I know amazon is trying this new "Amazon Pantry" its a nice concept but thus far (i have tried a few different products they currently stock) and I just think the quality of the products they are choosing to stock are awful [across the board]

name: Amazon Customer
title: This turtle could never keep up with the Energizer Bunny!
review: I used these for multiple items but lifespan of these batteries for these LED motion sensor lights (pictured) is what proved they were subpart batteries. They are mounted at the top and bottom of my basement stairs and may turn on 2-4 times a day for 30 seconds at a time. I've had to replace the batteries 4 times in 3 months whereas regular energizers would last 3+ months. I wish Id returned them.

name: Tacen
title: Great value
review: They last way longer than two or four store bought batteries so I am set for a good long time with just this one purchase. When I finally use them all I will only buy from here. They are well worth the cost and compared to what I was paying for two or four I am saving money here.

name: Russell Tate
title: Good and cheap
review: No pricey anti-shoplift packaging. No advertising cost. These are less expensive than name brands and, IMHO, just as good.

name: Looloo
title: Did not last 3.5-4 months with limited use.
review: I bought these 4 months ago. I put 4 into a flashlight. Granted, it's a high beam/low beam flashlight. I used the flashlight maybe 8 - 10 times. They were toast tonight when I tried to use them walking my dog at night. I put the other 4 in and they are bright as they should be. I'm very unhappy with the value of these batteries. If 4 of them only last 3-4 months with limited use...this is not good. I won't be buying these again.

name: Andrea
title: üëçüèª
review: We‚Äôve been buying amazon brand batteries for years. Work well and last as long as name brand for a fraction of the price.

name: CW
title: Very happy
review: First time I've used these and they are much better than the ones I used to get from the dollar stores and last longer as well. Much cheaper and more for your money. I was going thru batteries like crazy just for a remote but not now. They even last longer than the Duracell that came with this remote. I couldn't believe that either but they do.

name: Bhanu
title: Avoid buying these
review: Most batteries did not last more than 2 hours of normal usage on walkie talkie radio. 2 of then worked just 7 days in a TV remote. I am not comparing them to Duracell but batteries are supposed to last much longer. These are not reliable... Do not recommend specially for emergency situations.--- update after 3 moths ---Batteries I did not use leaked damaging everything around it. If possible would take back 1 star it initially.

name: KB
title: Good batteries
review: Well. Not a lot to say about AAA Alkaline Batteries. lol These work as good as any other brand I've bought, including name brands. Have only used 6 of the 36 pack so far, and the 6 are fine, so I assume the rest are fine as well. Came well packaged and timely with Prime. I would certainly recommend them (assuming the other 30 work). Good product so far. :)

name: Little Gerald
title: Decent battery, poor packaging
review: We used the Amazon basic for a few years. Mostly we are very satisfied. They do sometime seem to not last as long as previous orders. My problem was playing 36 pick up when I open the box and many of the AAA batteries were loose and rolling around in the box and then the floor. Perhaps little tape would have helped? Very frustrating to have them all out of the box and trying to go though the trouble of counting them and picking them off the floor.

name: Tundraguy
title: Not what they used to be - stay away
review: When Amazon Basics alkaline batteries first came out, they were economical and performed just as well as brandname batteries. Sadly, this has changed the past few years. These batteries die VERY quickly and do not seem to have much of a charge anymore. Any savings for the consumer is GONE. Another sacrifice to the 'more profit' gods no doubt.

name: Amanda Eboli
title: They didn't work.
review: I tried all 8, none of them worked. I ended up having to go to the store so my 3 year old would be able to play with his new toy.

name: J
title: Batteries of Madagascar
review: Missing in action. 20 batteries ordered, only 16 in the package. I like to imagine the other 4 batteries are on an adventure like the Penguins of Madagascar. Follow me boys, we‚Äôre going in hot!

name: Mack
title: Great Value and Quick Delivery!
review: Streamlined packaging and value make these a great purchase‚Äîperfect for Christmas gadgets requiring lots of batteries!

name: Cakes by Geri
title: Love them!
review: I don't even know where to start...i have an autistic daughter who loves push button, flashy toy, so we run through batteries like crazy. i've have the rechargeable, (which are kind of a PITA), so those are long term. But just a qucick change out, this is perfect! You get a lot of batteries to have on hand, in a box, not PITA plastic bubble,and they are actually GOOD batteries, not like the cheap dollar store ones you think they might be. These are my new go-to's !! WTG Amazon!!

name: Gilbert Rossignol
title: Great Value
review: Buy a pack, put em in the junk drawer and always have fresh batteries ready to go. These batteries work great in my remote controls and in kids toys. Not having batteries on hand is a pain with so much going wireless these days and these won't break the bank to keep some on hand.

name: Jacqueline B
title: Quite disappointed
review: I got these mainly for my Fire stick remote, and in 3 months, I have replaced the batteries 6 times. On a remote! I cannot imagine these batteries being useful on a more energy-heavy device. Unless I got a bad batch, I do not recommend nor do I plan to purchase again.

name: Brian M.
title: Good value
review: Lots of batteries for a low price. I couldn't detect any difference in battery life vs vs the big battery brands in my child's toys. They are definitely not the half-filled batteries you can find in the average dollar store though that's what the price would suggest. At .29 per AAA its difficult to find better unless you can catch one of the buy one get one free deals retailers sometimes do on batteries.

name: Pauline Ho
title: Doesn‚Äôt last at all
review: I purchase these batteries but they don‚Äôt last at all. My blood pressure cuff normal goes through months before I need to change them but with these battery I have to change them consistently. Would not recommend.

name: Alyssa
title: A great bang for your buck!
review: These are not the longest lasting batteries, but for the price, you can't beat it. We mainly use them for kids toys. We can't ever keep enough batteries in the house so buying them in bulk, not at retail store prices is a major plus! Just remember to shut the toys off and they last quite a while. Only batteries we will buy from now on.

name: ksqueen
title: they keep going and going
review: when you buy these you can have a good feeling that you wont ran out and you will have batters for at least 3 to 4 months course it depends what you are using them for. I have a flash light that i use them for, and i can tell you that the the light is very bright.

name: Brandon Whipple
title: Lacking
review: I was looking for rechargeable batteries and these can hp in the search. My fault asi should of read the description fully. With that said, these batteries to not last long, I‚Äôm having to replace every two weeks in the string LED lights I have hanging in my kiddos room. Other brands last last closer to 4-6 weeks. In my opinion, not worth it...

name: MariLyn
title: Old batteries do not charge anything
review: None of the 2 packages of batteries worked. Old batteries or just not charged enough. Send replacement of FRESH not old battteries

name: Katie E
title: Stick to Energizer
review: At first glance these seem like an insanely valuable purchase, but they die SUPER fast and I‚Äôm curious I they‚Äôre not responsible for the failure of one of my devices. As a DJ and tech enthusiast I go through a ton of batteries. Not impressed. I‚Äôll stick to Energizer.

name: AxL
title: Must have and a great price for the amount you get
review: Great price for the amount of batteries you receive they are neatly packed. One of the batteries had some of the casing peeling off however but the others was fine. I will update about the durability of how long they last soon. Its a must have to keep in your house and a great price the the amount you get.

name: pdxdragonfly
title: AVOID! Never had so many fails and short life batteries!
review: I decided to give Amazon's brand a try.... BIG MISTAKE! I have never had more batteries be dead out of the package as this, and the others have such a short life, similar to what other reviewers said... I will never buy these again!

name: Mimi
title: Not sure about them yet...
review: These are budget batteries so I really don‚Äôt expect much from them but since they have a 10-year shelf life we shall see. If they do as advertised, I‚Äôll be buying more. Since they were Prime, they came in two days and the package wasn‚Äôt destroyed or anything. Hence the 4 stars.

name: Teresa Rose
title: Product fits the price
review: I have these on my automatic order. With all our electronics it never seems like we have enough. These are a great value for the length of use. I used to get inexpensive batteries from a local tool store. However, these last twice as long for only pennies more.

name: Sarah Kirchoff
title: Leaked... Would not recommend!
review: All 4 of the batteries I placed in my graphing calculator leaked! The calculator was stored for a few months, but this should not have happened.A word to the wise: unlike Amazon devices (Kindle, Fire, etc) "AmazonBasics" brand is not actually made by Amazon. It's all outsourced to third party companies and Amazon has nothing to do with the engineering or testing. Some AmazonBasics things may be decent quality, but this is not one of them!Amazon, please find a new battery supplier, whoever made these is garbage!

name: Liana
title: Gives enough power to start a device, and then nothing more.
review: First, I threw away 2 rounds of 4 Amazon AAA batteries thinking I was crazy or I had a couple faulty in the bunch. These batteries let me weigh myself on my scale 2 times before dying, and died in about a minth, maybe less, on my remote.Now, I put the AAs that I ordered in bulk along with previously mentioned AAA, assuming they would be halfway decent at worst, in a PacMan game and it I let gives it enough power to turn them on, then turns off when I try to start the game. None of them work. I'm so disappointed.

name: JT
title: Low capacity
review: These batteries are cheap (which is nice for things like remotes and such) but for any kind of device that uses more power these will die within 10 minutes. I used (2) of them in series for a laser pointer for pets and it not only started way dimmer than energizer or other named brands, it was completely off within 6 minutes.TL;DR if you want these for a remote or something very small get them! If you want them for toys or anything else that may need a little more power get something else.

name: Kindle Customer
title: Save your money folks.
review: These are the worst batteries I have ever used!! The date on them is 07/2027, so they aren't outdated. I put them in my computer mouse, they lasted 2 weeks, I replaced them...and they lasted less than 2 days!! Would never buy them, even if they are cheaper, initially. The Energizers, etc. may cost a little more up front, but last for months and months, making them more efficient cost wise!!

name: DoZer
title: Not Worth The Savings
review: These batteries die significantly faster than the name brand batteries. Even using these Amazon batteries in an Amazon remote control. It is a significant difference and not worth the lower price. I will be sticking with the name brands from now on.

name: joseph
title: Battery Life Sucks
review: As a fan of Amazon branded or labeled as "amazon choice," I am VERY disappointed with these batteries... My children have walkie-talkies requiring 4 batteries and my sons stopped working with new batteries after the first use.... They quit so soon that I felt the walkie must be broken, but low and behold it came back to life with 4 new batteries. I have ordered a variety of amazon batteries in the past (be it AA or AAA or 9 volt) and I must say, I have run into the same problem before but gave Amazon the benefit of the doubt expecting them to sell a quality product. If you need a quick fix, proceed to buy but don't expect a subpar longevity.

name: JOHN C GRONBERG
title: Don‚Äôt Last
review: These batteries dont last at all for me and they are hardly used. I just purchased them in August was away for 4,weeks and went to turn on my candles yesterday and the batteries are dead in two candles. That is six batteries. I had same problem with double Aas in Florida and I take them out of remotes when I leave. Just unacceptable. I will go back to buying my batteries at Costco. These can‚Äôt be returned because I was away and return window is closed. Don‚Äôt understand these wonderful ratings.

name: Boopoopbdoop
title: Amazon brand is great!
review: Great value and so convenient. If I go to the store and need something like this where I rarely buy it I almost ALWAYS forget. But with Amazon the second I think of it I order it and don't have to worry about forgetting it. And its on my doorstep within a few days. Love Amazon and Amazon brand items as well.

name: Holly
title: Great product
review: Bought these AAA & AA for my hubby since he has to use a headlight and handheld flashlights for his work, they last as long as the more expensive batteries. I get both sets of batteries on the subscribe and save once a month and save more money doing it this way . Great value and great batteries.

name: Bret
title: DEAD. DOES NOT LAST. DONT BUY.
review: I just canceled my subscription to AA and AAA, which I‚Äôve been receiving for more than a year now. WASTE OF MONEY. I am so tired of putting brand new batteries in and discovering they are NEAR DEAD. First I thought I got a bad batch but it‚Äôs EVERY batch.

name: Bill Kochersperger
title: Not worth the money. Dollar general batteries last longer
review: Not real impressed. Bought these for simple candles on times and last less than a week and had to throw 8 out so far for being dead. Definitely got a bad batch or something. Doubt I'll buy these again

name: Kat
title: Great price for the quantity you get
review: I have 2 kids and they go through so many batteries for their toys. I tried using rechargeable ones but that just doesn‚Äôt work as great because it takes forever to recharge and kids can‚Äôt wait that long. These were great value for the quantity you get. They are decent and last quite awhile.

name: Rebecca
title: Don‚Äôt last very long
review: These batteries do not last very long. As an example: I use them in my electric toothbrush. I get a replacement head in the mail every 3 months. Other brands of batteries will last the entire 3 months in the toothbrush. These batteries last maybe 3-4 weeks in the toothbrush.

name: Akilla21
title: Not long lasting
review: I purchased these batteries to feed some small round motion detection around in my home. The batteries does not seem to last long, either the devices require a strong mAh, or the motion is going off more frequently, and in turn the batteries do not last long. I get about 2 weeks then they need replacing.

name: SpartyAnimal
title: Value for the money
review: These are nice because they have great longevity for the price. Batteries can be a little expensive, but these are quite affordable. I've bought these many times now for Xbox controllers, VR controllers and anything else I need AA or AAA batteries for.

name: Josh O
title: They aren't the best, but they're the best for the money
review: I haven't found a better bang for the buck battery than these, and we go through quite a few of them here.

name: Devin R.
title: Great batteries! Long lasting & they handle a lot of drain!
review: Bought these for my baby's christmas toys! Let me tell you, I have a toddler that runs the toys around the clock and the batteries are *STILL going strong! Its insane to me! LOL! Great batteries and ill be purchasing more when I need to replace these.

name: Ashley Traurig
title: Good for price. But don't last long
review: so I thought it was a great idea to buy Amazon batteries because they are so much cheaper. They do work... But they do not last near as long as the name brands. They are nice for low battery usage items button things like my baby's bouncer they we can quickly. Still good for the value. But you basically go through twice as many. So it's probably about the same as buying the more expensive ones.

name: Matt K.
title: Quit overthinking it... they‚Äôre batteries FFS
review: A budget-friendly pack of batteries that work like any other brand. So far so good.

name: BobPT
title: Best bang for the buck
review: I find that these Amazon batteries last not quite as long as the two other major battery brands but dang near close. I get the AA, AAA, and 9-volt batteries and they are a fraction of the cost of the other 2 major brands. More mAh per penny spent.

name: Gable Young
title: None of the batteries worked
review: I honestly don't know why there are so many great reviews. None of the batteries in my pack worked or only worked for a day or two. I won't be ordering these again.

name: 3pups+1kitten+1hub
title: Dont let the price fool you! These are great batteries!
review: These are great batteries!! I bought them for my flashlight and also some low-drain devices in my home. The flashlight is now much brighter with these batteries than store-bought ones The box was packed snug as a bug too. No loose batteries rolling around (like a walmart order i made once) Update... Im a now repeat customer

name: Kindle Customer
title: AAA not AAAA
review: Received this at 7:45 pm, and whomever delivered for Amazon threw it against my security door, and it bounced of to the front lawn. That's why I didn't give it 5 stars. When ordering make sure you order the ones you need, I previously order AAA and received the AAAA, it appears it would be easy to mix them up. This seems to be a bargain, I would recommend this product highly.

name: George B. Johnston Jr.
title: Generally good battery but may not fit some cassettes.
review: The batteries are slightly larger in diameter than most AAA batteries. The fit TV remotes, bike lights, and the Maglite Solitaire, but are too large to fit the Attwood¬Æ - Portable Gray Light Kit 14190-7. When I inserted the cassette with difficult it peeled parts of the label off the battery.

name: Pat M
title: Better, maybe best
review: Recently decided to use rechargeable AA's to cut down on waste. Tried another brand first, they worked well on the first charge but some of them failed when it was time to recharge them. So back to the search. So far, these are better, they lasted as long or longer on the first charge and have all been recharged as needed. Now we keep using them to be sure of their longevity.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Great deal on batteries
review: Great price for batteries, work as good as name brand. Can really see no difference between the two. I will be buying again

name: John Van Schoor
title: Questionable Life Span
review: These batteries seem to fail all too soon. I suspect they have not been tested by Amazon and are a bad buy. Very disappointing.

name: Chris A
title: Works great when they work.......
review: Update 6/16/17: Purchased product again and they are working in the devices that they did not work in prior. Also, I believe the batteries are lasting longer than the batteries I purchased prior (maybe fresher... ?)When they work, they work great. I have a number of 'devices' that for whatever reason, they do not power up with these batteries. I can replace with a non AmazonBasics battery and it starts working. I do not see any difference in length, circumference,etc so not sure what is going on. With that said, they work great in this devices where there is not a compatibility problem.

name: Manny
title: You can't go wrong with these
review: These batteries are definitely the best bang for your buck, great longevity! Look up project farm on YouTube where he tests many different batteries where these same amazon batteries beat a lot of the competitors and were right behind energizer.

name: Marc
title: Good batteries
review: I was hesitant about these at first because I've purchased a few other items from Amazon Basics and hadn't had the best experience. My opinion of the brand is: it works. These aren't the highest quality or frankly the best batteries. They work well and that's about it. The batteries are nice, they work, and they last. Not the best, but far from the worst. I do recommend these.

name: online shopper
title: Similar to  Name Brand batteries
review: Batteries are a good value for the price. I have purchased Amazon brand batteries twice now. They last just as long as the name brand batteries sold in stores. I like the fact that Amazon has an ample supply/stock and I am able to purchase in bulk quanities.

name: DAAL
title: Not major brand quality, but not expected to be.
review: Thus far no issues with the batteries. Keep in mind these are not your major brand batteries, so don't have expectations of that. However for the price point I can't complain really. They do the jobs I have asked of them and have ordered more.

name: Connor K.
title: Quality
review: These batteries are comparable with the name brand guys! I really like their design and how they come packaged in 4s which make storage easy as you don't have random batteries rolling around the place. They come nicely packed to prevent damage.

name: Phil O.
title: These are okay
review: I think these are okay for certain products and work better in certain conditions more than others. I used them in under the cabinet lights and they did not last at all. I suspect in remotes and lower usage applications, they may last longer.

name: J. A. Mine
title: Very good value for the price paid!
review: These batteries do not have the longevity of some name brand Alkaline AAA's, but they are good enough for my purposes. The Amazon brand AAA's do last longer than the Amazon AA's in my opinion. And they haven't leaked so far. This is my second box of 20.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Amazon brand batteries are horrible. Received all dead batteries and didn‚Äôt het my money back.
review: Amazon basics batteries - I bought a 20 pack AAA, A large pack of AA and a pack of 8 9v batters. They say they have a shelf life of ten years. I bought then all in May 2019.I want to change all 6 of fire alarm batters some take 2-AA some take 9v.Every last battery was dead! TotAl waste of money. I had to back and buy new batteries. Amazon says they won‚Äôt take the return. This is poor customer service. You don‚Äôt use batteries right away all the time. I don‚Äôt plan to ever buy Amazon brand again.

name: Annesg
title: back to name brand
review: Been buying these batteries for several years now. The average life span was 3 to 4 months, primarily in flameless candlesin my windows. Suddenly they don't last as long. Two of the last 8 batteries Ive used in a radio and was burned when batteries combusted when I was putting them in. Not worth the risk of fire or injury. Why did Amazon change something that was fine?

name: Suzy Brown
title: 3 out of 4 leaked first time charging
review: I have been buying Amazon Basics rechargeable for years, no problems. But this batch (grey with yellow tops) were bad. I put a pack of 4 in the charging station and 3 out of four started hissing and leaked battery juice all over my charger. I've never had a problem with previous rechargeable batteries, so it's just this particular supply. Get a different maker!

name: Ramon
title: Very poor longevity
review: These batteries do not last long at all.. I've used them for toys, remote controls, and other electronics. They last AT MOST 2-3 weeks.. I could not believe how frequently we had to change out the batteries on our Firetv remote.. I personally would not buy these again.

name: eris sulce
title: Great Price
review: As a father of two I am loving the amount of batteries I got for the price. I put them ony kids toys and if you have kids you know they leave the toys on and waste batteries, so this is a good buy because you get so many for a good price. The have worked great for our remote control as well.

name: Linda Silver
title: Leaked!!!!
review: These batteries leaked blue battery acid on two new flashlights after being in them for two months! Ruined my flashlights!! Do not buy these batteries. So surprised Amazon put their name on them. Normally I completely trust Amazon‚Äôs choices! And they are not returnable. Just have to discard them safely.

name: Stephen Heckman
title: Great Price poor value
review: Unfortunately this product doesn't hold up to description. Between AA, AAA & C cell batteries, I get less time than over the counter dollar store batteries. The price is a good point for what is advertised but the usage falls way below the value. Sorry to say none of these batteries will be purchased again

name: Goeasy62
title: Terrible batteries
review: Do not last long at all, i changed batteries in my remote and had to change less then 2 weeks later, so once i use these up its back to duracell. I even checked them with a meter, 1.5v out of the package and 1.1 volt less then 2 weeks later, remotes stopped working until I put new batteries in.

name: David&dest
title: Sooo convenient!
review: Needed AAA for our TV remote. Was so handy to look and see if amazon had batteries. They came a LOT quicker than they ever would have if I went and got them at the store. Haha. Value seems great for the amount. Have to see how long they last?

name: LovelyAngelLady
title: Good quality batteries, but affordable!
review: I am so happy that I came across these batteries. I usually buy them from the dollar store, but they've been out lately. My son usually needs to replace the batteries in his mouse weekly. It's been two weeks, and these batteries are still going. Will definitely be buying again.

name: Tucson Bob
title: Don't last very long
review: This was my first time purchasing batteries from Amazon. Very disappointed. Primarily purchased to use on a variety of remote controls.Batteries were normal at first, but now they just last two or three days and I have to replace them.Not sure whether I got a bad batch or what but having to change batteries that often is not good.

name: Henry Chang
title: Longevity is trash
review: Do NOT buy these. The battery life is terrible. Would not even last a whole NIGHT in a LED night light/closet light. Last about at most 2 hours until it starts to dim down. End up buying brand name batteries and still on my first set. Has not dimmed down.

name: Jonathan Guerrero
title: Don't function across all devices
review: For some reason they don't work on all of my devices. It could be my Xbox controller or a Headlamp or anything commonly used at home. They just won't power it. They just work for some things lol amazon should check these and improve them.

name: Alex Soper
title: As long as these are available, I will be loyal to the product!
review: Let's face it... we are still in the battery age. They don't seem to be going away anytime soon. With a daughter that seemingly owns every toy in the world that requires batteries, these are the best match for them. The longevity is great. I have been and will continue to purchase all sized batteries of AmazonBasic. Very happy -- positive (charge) review :)

name: Saima Usmani
title: Great value
review: Definitely great value for money. I cannot believe how much I got for so little $. They came very nicely packaged. The batteries were divided in to two packages so it‚Äôs very easy to store them. So far they are lasting a while. Hope they are just as great. I put them in my son‚Äôs walkie talkie which eats up quite a bit of battery and few days later the battery level is still full üôå

name: Kemosabe
title: Need a Battery Charger w/ 110 volt
review: Put 2 in my remote for tv; works good at the start. In two week; so weak, my remote quits working. thought maybe one of batteries was bad. So, I replaced with two more matteries. Same thing happened in two weeks. Will NOT buy these again!!!

name: Bulent Guneyli
title: Questionable battery life
review: I used some of the batteries in my Xbox controller and it is out of battery in less than 2 weeks? I don't even play too much. Just couple of hours a week. Maybe those 2 batteries were bad. I hate to see the whole pack have less than normal battery life.

name: Shannon Sung
title: Last long time
review: I was hesitant to purchase non-brand item at first. But this actually works very well. Price is much cheaper than branded item. So now I only use Amazon brand battery for all my needs. I would definitely purchase again in the future.

name: David
title: It's a very good quality product
review: I got many AAA batteries and I was so happy. Those batteries are of high quality. I haven't use them yet. Those batteries are standard product. I believe the quality is higher than the Dollar tree ones and I'm very happy about the price too. I was so supersized that the descriptions said it can last 10 years. However, no body will used it for 3 years i believe. It's a large quantity of AAA batteries

name: electronic engineer
title: Avoid at all costs this "Best seller"
review: I bought these batteries for my LED flash light that I use only at night. Previous batteries (also from Amazon) were good for 2-3 weeks. This set of batteries is good only for 3-4 days (repeated problem with these batteries from the current 36 set). Replaced the batteries in with Energizer batteries, no issues! DO NOT BUY these batteries. Waste of money!

name: Nightowl86
title: Terrible
review: I don‚Äôt know why I didn‚Äôt read the reviews first, but these are really bad batteries, I bought them to use all over the house and even for small things like my roku remote control they didn‚Äôt even last a day. Two of them when I went to put them on stationary lights they batteries over heated SO FAST I dropped the light on the floor, and it was the batteries not the lights. Money wasted.

name: Paul Skopp
title: Quality of the batteries that Amazon would put their name on.
review: I don‚Äôt know who makes these batteries for Amazon. After using them in flicker candles for only a few hours each they only lasted for a little over two weeks. Other batteries lasted for months.

name: Mama V
title: Just as good as the other 2 brands
review: Love the price for this large package of AAA batteries. I just keep it in the entertainment center drawer for replacing remote batteries. I've found that the FireTV remote in particular is prone to having low batteries fairly often. I haven't noticed any difference in performance between the Amazon Basics brand batteries and the other top 2 brands.

name: Lauri Horn
title: Half were dead.
review: Half were dead. By the time I noticed it was a week after the thirty day return window. Won‚Äôt buy again.

name: Dad
title: Great to have as a just in case
review: Great value and they store well too. I live in Florida so hurricane season is always fun, I stock up with these to use in the case of an emergency. they hold a charge and are ready to power our electronics when necessary. will buy again

name: Laura B.
title: Waste of money, do not buy
review: These batteries die very quickly. They are a waste of money. I wish I could get my money back.

name: Tracy
title: Comparable to name brand!
review: I purchased these along with a package on name brand batteries. So far they have lasted just as long! The price point is great for the value and I will be buying them again!

name: Robert Taylor
title: Not very good batteries
review: Bought these because almost everything I have purchased from Amazon Basics has been a good deal. These batteries are not a good deal. They don't last anywhere near as long as other types such as Kirkl***, Dura***, or Ever****.Take a pass on these.

name: mrsmel269
title: Good value
review: I usually buy batteries at Sam's club for the value. I heard things about Amazon batteries and decided to try them out since I compared prices and they were cheaper for the same amount at Sam's. So far, they are working good for us and I will probably buy more when needed.

name: Beverly Morten
title: Most needed tool
review: for my personal recorder, my remote for TV, my CD Portal Player. I have been paying to much money for batteries at Wal- marts and other places, and most of my hand held devices call for Batteries. Even my Smoke Dectector. Thanks for the nice price. and at the beginning of each year, all the batteries in the house are changed.

name: sobefreak13
title: Comparable to big name brands
review: I've always liked Amazon Basics for batteries. It's more cost effective than the stores and having a 10 year shelf life really makes this an attractive product that i can buy and not be worried about losing power. Highly recommend.

name: Andy Lambert
title: Great customer service
review: Unfortunately my batteries that came installed in the unit lasted 3 days. Supposed to be 10 years. I had to replace them with the batteries I was issued. They quit giving me a charge at all. They died a few days later as well.Could no longer get a reading. It became useless. Luckily, there was a generous option to take. My refund was issued before I even packed the box and I could keep them and still get a refund. No need to ship them back!

name: Alex
title: Value far exceeds the price.
review: Use these in a headlamp on a hard hat doing construction. These last just as long as the more expensive name brands. Not buying anything else anymore.

name: Jeremy B
title: Great value. Long lasting.
review: i Am a big fan of these Amazon Basics batteries. I use them for both home office and small appliance uses as well as for keyboards and mice at work. They last a long time and are a great value. I tend to use them all within a year of purchasing them, so I am not sure how long they would store.

name: mickey shake
title: These Batteries are the worse batteries I have bought.
review: I bought these batteries to use in a flash light. ( it takes 3 batteries ) first I was getting 1 or 2 at a time bad. Now I have starting to find a few of them leaking. At this point in 3 weeks I have had to discard 10 of the 36 I bought. I have other amazon batteries that work just fine. I can only say DO NOT BUY THE ORANGE AMAZON BATTERIES. I'm go to buy more batteries and I will not shy away from buying other amazon batteries as I said I have other batteries with the amazon name on them. With know problem with them at all.

name: booklover
title: Worst Batteried Ever
review: amazonbasics alkaline AA batteries are the worst batteries I have ever purchased. They do not last more than a week or two & the power is nothing compared to a Name Brand batteries. I will Never buy amazon brand batteries again.

name: Angela
title: Just as good as other brands.
review: These are really great all around. Your getting just as good of batteries as other brands at a far more reasonable price. I have a son who loves his video games and leaves his remote controls on constantly. These are great to buy in bulk and they last.

name: bruce
title: Poor quality
review: Purchased these in 2018, expiration date on these batteries is 2028. They've been stored inside my home in conditioned air yet they now only last a few hours powering a wall clock.

name: Craig
title: These Batteries are Junk
review: I thought the price was too good to be true. Turns out it is. I put new batteries in a remote, did not work. I put two more in, that worked, but the TV showed the remote being at half. I put these batteries in my bose headset, the noise cancellation goes in and out after using for only an hour. I checked many batteries on a voltmeter, most were junk.There are many articles that these batteries are sourced from Indonesia, where their standards are sub par, the environmental impact is very huge. I do not think I have ever left a one star rating. I am worried for my electronics, I will discontinue using these batteries and recycle them properly. These batteries are cheap because they are cheap, please avoid.

name: Dale T. Sirkle
title: Used to be good but no longer
review: I have bought Amazon basics AAA batteries in the past and they were good but the box that I have now (dated for 2029) die in a week in an indoor outdoor thermometer, TV remote control etc. I won't buy them anymore. Same problem with Amazon Basics AA batteries in use.

name: Nick
title: Why go anywhere else for batteries?
review: I love these batteries. They last just as long as other popular name brand batteries and they are so much cheaper!And Amazon is pretty on point with their delivery. Mine usually arrive next day. So, unless you are in dire need of some batteries RIGHT NOW you're best bet would be to order them from Amazon.They also come in bulk (like these are in a 36-pack). That way once you've ordered a box you know to order another when you start getting low.Use a lot of batteries? You can subscribe for a recurring order! That's just top notch.

name: George E. Goff & Better Half Michele
title: Best for Amazon Fire Stick
review: My Amazon Fire Stick goes through 2-AAA batteries at quite a clip. These batteries require less changing - once a week over than every other day previously with other brands. However, you pay a lot more for the AmazonBasics brand over other brands. It is a catch 22 - if you don't want to be constantly switching out batteries you should go with these. Also, I find I get much better and longer usage from these batteries if I keep the battery plate off of the Fire Stick.

name: Albert L. Nelms
title: Great Value!
review: The Amazon Basic AAA battery works great. It doesn‚Äôt last as long as more expensive name brand batteries. I recommend using the Amazon batteries in devices which are easily accessible. Save the expensive batteries for hard to reach or hard to change items.

name: Steven
title: ~~GREAT VALUE~~
review: these work great, works just as long as name brand batteries. they do come with a plastic around them just a simple twist of the batteries and the plastic will open up.see pictures posted.I hope you found this review Helpful.

name: Aly
title: Inexpensive and works great
review: These are great alternatives to brand name batteries. Much cheaper and work as good as others.

name: Stargazer
title: Great Value
review: First time user bought after reading reviews certainly worth the money. Now the test will be to see how long they last. Batteries are very expensive and use AAA batteries for many things so hopefully they will last me awhile.

name: Buyer of Things
title: I heard these blow up, but not mine (so far)
review: I recently read that some of these blow up. As long as none of mine explode I will maintain my assertion that this is a 5-star product. If one (or more) DOES explode, well, we're likely looking at a demotion to 4 and maybe even 3 stars.

name: Rubi_G
title: Definitely not the best quality
review: Purchased these for small Wilkie talkies to use in the house for more of an intercom. They are not used a lot. The first day we tried them out Nd went to use it the next day and batteries were dead? We went through this pack within days. Next time it‚Äôs Duracell or energizer for me.

name: Diane Crispino
title: The shelf life does not last long
review: I purchased these in January 2018 and only used 2 of them up until now. When I replaced the batteries in one of my devices they did not work. I then put them in a battery charger and all but one said the batteries were bad. The one that did not come up bad was fully charged. I just went out and bought Duracell; they guarantee theirs for 10 years in storage.

name: Regan
title: Most economical batteries, not the longest longevity though
review: Great price to longevity ratio, but doesn't last as long as the expensive brands.

name: Kate Douglas
title: Excellent product at a reasonable price.
review: I purchased these for a remote control on a tv that is rarely used, but they're not the first Amazon batteries we've purchased and won't be the last. They're an excellent product at a reasonable price.

name: M to the Q
title: Really good product and packaging
review: I am a high schoool math department chairperson, and we use a large number of these AAA batteries in our graphing calculators. These batteries have shown themselves to be equal to or surpass both the name brand batteries and Kirkland, Costco's brand, in performance and longevity, AND they're quite a bit cheaper than those others.We find that the their packaging in four packs in the the box to be most convenient, since we typically use them four at a time. It also helps with their storage by not having nearly 100 batteries "on the loose" once the box is opened. Finally, the plastic wrap on the four packs helps support the battery shelf life better than them being loose.Again, it's a really good product and packaging

name: Anonymous
title: Workable, but not the best for high drain devices
review: They're ok. I'm not sure what scale is used to determine that these batteries are "high performance". They're good but if you have high drain devices, they don't last as long as say, the name brand known by their copper top.

name: Platypus
title: Good value
review: They work. They're cheap. They last long enough for me to go through the whole set in my wireless mouse.

name: Anna Nace
title: Never going back to name brand batteries!
review: Work great! The price is so much better than name brand batteries but the work just as well. I will always buy Amazon brand batteries from now on! They shipped quickly and at a much better price! So pleased. Never going back!

name: T. Smith
title: Leaky
review: Not only do these batteries die very quickly, but if stored for any length of time they will leak in your device or in your storage container.These were being used in flash lights mainly and they would last approximately 1 day at most. Using a different brand battery we are seeing at least 3 days use.

name: Sally P
title: Terrible product
review: Terrible product, these batteries burnout in 2 weeks. I have a string of mini lights on a timer, 4 hours per evening. I have replaced this batteries 3 times in 6 weeks. I do not recommend this product.

name: Thekat0
title: They don't last
review: We purchased these in the beginning of 2019 and they lasted a long time. But then we just ordered more again in July 2020 and I'm almost out. They don't last long at ALL. I'm so disappointed that I now have to buy more of another brand

name: Wilma Litton
title: Poor lifespan....
review: Lifespan of a one day hit.... yeah the batteries are cheap but they deplete fast

name: Murph
title: These batteries are not supposed to be thrown in the trash!!!
review: These batteries are not supposed to be thrown in the trash!!! It shows the symbol on each battery that means don't throw in trash. Yet they're sold in bulk... So obviously they're getting thrown intro regular trash by most customers.

name: Cindy
title: Good product...defective packaging
review: I buy amazon batteries because the price is always the best. However, only 4 stars because...the batteries were in a box and then inside of an amazon envelope. It was a good thing for the envelope, because the box came open during shipping. I‚Äôm a little concerned, but I think the batteries are ok, though.

name: Kim
title: Great Packaging and Value!
review: As a photographer, I can tell you that batteries are some of the most annoyingly packed products ever! But these were great! The packaging was slim and didn't take a lot of space. The batteries are still going (I put them in a camera flash) and they are trucking along!

name: BirdNet9
title: Great batteries
review: batteries are a great value and last as long as others. I use them in all of my electronic and remote controls. I will continue using these for all of my products. Highly recommend, great battery.

name: Cam and Ervy
title: It last a long time!
review: Very affordable ‚Äî I love amazon basics because of the quality but cheap price! It is as good as energizer, definitely a must have! It comes with 36 pack that will last you a long time. You have to have this just in case you need one.

name: Robin
title: Surprisingly long lasting
review: I received these type batteries when I ordered my fire stick from Amazon. I was extremely impressed but wanted to go with a cheaper route. I tried different company's batteries but they did not last as long as I thought they should. I received these a while back and I'm so glad I took the chance.. they are long lasting and I will replace them when needed.

name: Maziar Aboualizadehbehbahani
title: Good price! Great quality!
review: These batteries were perfect for my usage. I needed a total of 4 and a set of 4 as spare. So these perfectly matched to my need for a good price and awesome quality. Instead of buying a very big package from Costco, and still at some reasonable price.

name: Lilah
title: dead on arrival
review: Just opened these to replace the batteries in my Fire TV remote. Did not work at all. Found old Energizer batteries, they worked just fine. I do not recommend these at all.

name: Gia
title: Great batteries, long lasting
review: I only buy amazon batteries because you get the most bang for your buck. I‚Äôve noticed they are always reasonably priced and they last a long time in terms of power. It may seem like a lot of money for an upfront cost, but they really do last a long time and you get more per dollar.

name: Billywonka
title: Great batteries.
review: These things, at this price are a bargain. I've bought other inexpensive batteries and they die or get weak with a few weeks, but these haven't wavered in power for months now. Very pleased. Amazon was super fast with delivery too.

name: Jaye
title: Dead on Arrival
review: Batteries are dead. They worked in nothing I tried. I also ordered ‚ÄòDuracells‚Äô, which came in the same delivery. They worked fine. The Amazon ones arrived in a package that appeared to have been re-taped. Of course I can‚Äôt know this. But I do know they were useless. Shame.

name: T is for Tech
title: Who buys batteries any where else?
review: Really, I don't know that I would ever buy batteries anywhere else but Amazon.High quality, AMAZING value, and they work just as good as other regular brand batteries.I think over the past few years, between my wife and I - we've ordered hundreds of different types of Amazon Basics batteries. Mostly at Christmastime! Great!

name: RTH
title: Very unstable batteries.
review: They have leaked and will barely last 3 months in a key board, which typically last a year or more. DONOT BUY!

name: RJ
title: Low capacity batteries
review: We're all here for the same reason: these batteries are cheaper per unit than all other batteries. Turns out there's a reason for it: They have far less milliamp hours than other batteries. I haven't done a test, but these batteries seem to last half as long as others, if that (Energizer, Duracell). This is not an exaggeration. They have a notifiable and obvious lack of capacity

name: Nikki Calkins
title: Bad batch
review: I usually love Amazon's batteries and gave had no issues in the past but this last order of AAAs are terrible. Maybe last 3 days in our remote. I don't know if there's such a thing as a "bad batch" but if so we got one!

name: Jr
title: Surprisingly good.
review: Was not sure about ordering generic brand batteries no matter the name on them. They work well to my surprise. So far they last the same amount as the other batteries from well known brands. Will be using is all holiday decor for sure.

name: Phil
title: No More Big Box Store Batteries for Us
review: These batteries are good. No more crummy, leaking copper tops for us.

name: Mr. K
title: ALWAYS go with Amazon Batteries
review: Great product quality and the best price, don't go cheaper, these are extemely quality batteries and I'll always suggest them. I blow through AAA''s fast for some reason, but much less fast when using these branded batteries.

name: RJ
title: Short Life!
review: Although these batteries are great value for the money but they don‚Äôt last long at all! They might be great for remote controls and clocks may be, but definitely not for toys or electronics require high power output!

name: Bird Nerd
title: Work great and packaged smart as well.
review: Been using these and they last just as long as any Energizer or Duracell battery in my opinion. I also like how they come in a neat box, but separated into smaller packages of four, so I can keep a back-up pack in my pocket. I used to have to keep one of those opened boxes full of loose batteries on hand for back-up (or go through zip-lock bags to store them in), so this is much more practical.

name: David S. Courington
title: Unfortunate
review: I got these and attempted to use them in our fire remote controls. None of them had enough juice to even work the remote right out of the package. had to go buy Duracell at WalMart... I think it is odd though, these are the batteries that ship in the fire remotes and the first ones lasted about a year before needing to be replaced. These replacements did not work.

name: PDcali57
title: Defective?
review: Seemed a good value for the price. Until adult son heard a buzzing, crackling sound coming from the batteries he had in his headset. I also hear the noise. Since unsure what would happen, disposed of any batteries left

name: James Rasmussen
title: Good value. Unsure of origins or environmental impact
review: Good value. I‚Äôm concerned about the environmental impact from the manufacturing process of these batteries given the energy intensive nature of battery manufacturing process. Amazon is not transparent in this process.

name: Rigg
title: WARNING!
review: JUNK!Bought these for use in a Fire TV Remote control. First 2 lasted 3 hours, 2nd set lasted a day and half......I know they're inexpensive but WTF??If I have to go through and voltage check every Battery I buy, what's the point of buying Amazon branded batteries??Spend the extra and buy Duracell...From Walmart...

name: Larry Jorden Burton
title: Battery life expectations
review: I saved some removed batteries. I'm going to sand the ends and reuse them. I question a potential conductivity issue, ie accessing the full charge of the battery. Are they coated? Still, a "great value", regardless.....* I cleaned the battery ends and greatly extended their life 5/8/20

name: ANZicCO
title: So WEAK!
review: These batteries don't last very long! I have a sensor controlled night light that uses 3 AAA batteries and these were so worn by 2nd night that the bulb was dimmer than it was before I took the old batteries out. and replaced them with these. Do not waste your money...spend a bit more for batteries that actually last!

name: macmoon
title: Good value
review: At $ .24 each the price is reasonable and these aaa batteries seem to last well in LED lights So far, I have not had a leaker in the 2 years that I have used them.

name: Nathaniel Ruby
title: Great value
review: I needed some batteries, as my preferred rechargeables were having trouble holding a charge. These aren't rechargeable, but they were a great price and got here with overnight delivery. Great value thanks to Amazon

name: Lucaschloe
title: Good price, good performance.
review: Very good price comparing with other brand. Good performance. Good choice with families with kids. Most of toys need 3 or more batteries and have to exchange pretty often. We have two kids and tons of toys. So this can be our big saving. I‚Äôm very happy I always have spare batteries in the drawer. I still surprised when I saw the big amount of batteries even I ordered this by myself. Again very good price! And these batteries last long like other brands , I don‚Äôt feel difference.

name: ExploreColorado
title: Can‚Äôt go wrong, great price!
review: You can‚Äôt beat the price!! They‚Äôre not the longest lasting battery but for price you can‚Äôt go wrong. If you need some batteries that are going to last you‚Äôre going to have to bite the bullet and buy some expensive lithium‚Äôs. I use these all the time and am very happy with the quality for the price

name: patty
title: Beware of the life span of theses battiers
review: The batteries seem to have a short life span. I use them in candles an they may last 30 days at 5 hrs a day

name: AlanAndMel
title: Long lasting
review: Was very hesitant to go for a generic Amazon brand battery but it had such good reviews I thought I'd try it. I must say I'm surprised. Been in my mouse and keyboard for a couple of months already and still going strong. Great value for the price.

name: Chris
title: Great batteries at a great value
review: Got these batteries for many different items. They come in 2 easy to store box‚Äôs(inside one shipping box) and are grouped in 5s. They hold a good charge. Price per battery is the best in this setting. Won‚Äôt need batteries for a while .

name: Marz
title: A so-so battery
review: A So-so battery. It's a cross between a $1 battery you would buy in a local store and a Duracell or an Energizer. I got 4 months of use using these in a remote control.I like using Energizer's in my camera's and remote's. They do last a lot longer.Figured I would give it a try for the price. Good if your short on cash. Personally, I would rather spend the extra dollar and buy an Energizer pack. Less changing-out of my batteries.

name: terpsichorean
title: Easy to get out of box, won't scatter everywhere
review: The Internet of Things... more like, "Internet of Batteries!" The more smart gear we get, the more batteries we blow through. When my wifi-enabled scale (!) pooped out after about 9 months on the "factory" batteries, I restocked it with the Amazon Basics. They ship in a compact, no-frills cardboard box... inside a larger Amazon shipping box. The cardboard box is easy to open... no screwing around with scissors and sharp plastic packaging. Then you can close the lid on them when done and not worry about them rolling everywhere. If you have shaky hands or poor eyesight, these are the ones to get.

name: Mohsin
title: Headphones
review: I have a pair of bose noice cancelling headphones that take a AAA battery. My wife has started to use them, and always forgets to turn off the headset. So now I just keep a huge stock. These work great for this.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Purchased because most of children's toys required
review: Am a bit disappointed in these batteries. They certainly didn't last long Christmas day!

name: Amazon Customer
title: Stay away
review: Worst batteries ever! Idk how they are 4 stars at all. Stay away! This was your warning. Let‚Äôs put it this way: they‚Äôre worse than the Dollar Tree batteries. Just go buy those instead. You‚Äôre better off.These batteries will drain and not lost long. I‚Äôve gone through an entire box in 1 year.... I. Comparison, the Dollar Tree batteries would last me ~2 years. How is this possible?

name: Lee W
title: There when you need them
review: They work. Reasonably priced and good to have a batch of them at the ready.

name: Tom Throckmorton
title: Stay away, junk
review: Sorry but these are junk. A little Thomas the Tank Engine toy was the intended use for these batteries, flip the switch and it goes around the track for as long as the batteries last. Well these couldn‚Äôt have lasted but 5 minutes before poor little Thomas was crawling at a snails pace. These batteries caused confusion and delay!

name: Nancy C. Collins
title: Excellent product and awesome price savings!!
review: My husband uses these batteries in his insulin pump. He was buying expensive brand name batteries because he thought they would last longer. I ordered these AmazonBasics for him and it is a great buy. As far as lasting, they last as long, if not longer, than the name brand batteries. I would say to anyone who is thinking of getting these batteries, you will not go wrong with them. Try them and see what you think. This is the battery we will be buying from now on.

name: Havehope
title: Cheap because they're a decade old
review: I thought these were a great value but upon receiving these and other sizes I looked at the information printed on the batteries and they are 10 years old! Yes they work but for how long? They will need to be replaced sooner than newly made ones so the value just went way down, too bad.

name: Cindy Yu
title: Not working at all
review: I got this order on 04/27/2020, replaced on a mini facial spa machine today, it is not working all, nothing wrong with my spa machine, it was working fine before I took out the old batteries, after I input these batteries on, it only shows the number on the spa screen and freeze. I took out some batteries from other monitor, input to the facial spa machine, it works fine.I am not able to return it, due to Covid-19, because I am a senior, do not drive, post office is not in walking distance. My $$ is gone.Will not recommend anyone to buy it, I learned a lesson this time.

name: Sgt. Scott
title: They haven't exploded!
review: I have had no problems with these batteries and I have test them thoroughly because of some of the reviews. I'm sure the stories are true but I can't see a problem with these. They last a long time for non Lithium and don't even get hot under heavy load. No complaints here a constant 1.5v is good for me!

name: Edward
title: Excellent batteries.
review: EdgeWardBest value around.AftertastesAfter looking through many reviews I decided to give these a try I have found the amazon basic batteries to be high in quality and peformance. I use the AA AND AAA SIZE everyday and have never Been let down.i would recommend this to anyone who is tired of paying a high price for a sub standard product Or who pays the low price fo a battery that will fail at the exact wrong time leaving you in the dark.:

name: K McDavid
title: Dissapointed in Whovillee.
review: Not rechargeable .OVERPRICEDDISSAPOINTEDGOING TO BATTERIES PLUS NEXT TIME SO I CAN SEE AND TOUCH PRODUCT.WASTE OF TIME

name: Stephanie
title: Dissatisfied with longevity
review: I have been buying Amazon basic batteries for several years,especially for holiday decor. Had always been happy with durability and cost compared to the brand names.This time they did not perform well at all,obviously the quality has gone down hill.I still had some older AA ones from last year that outlasted the AAA ones I just bought

name: C the Mom Pete
title: You get what you pay for, i guess
review: The 1st batteries that I installed in a new product did not work. Thought maybe it was the product, but switched them out for a different group of 3 and the light worked. Would have been noce for all the batteries to function in the pack......

name: Amazon Customer
title: Zero shelf life.  I bought 76 batteries and I could feel corrosion on all of the batteries.
review: No charge left. I bought two boxes of 36 each and I could feel corrosion on all of the batteries. I wasn't going to risk having to replace my remote when these exploded. I trusted the Amazon brand and thought it was quite the bargain. I have to pay postage. Amazon doesn't like shipping batteries and I can see why. I'm disabled. I don't have any transportation and why I shop by mail in the first place. I can't get my money back if I don't make the 30 day deadline. Arghhhh

name: Matthew and Derreth McDurfee
title: There is no better deal out there
review: Hands down the best deal on quality batteries in bulk. I have a recurring subscription to these batteries and will continue to use them as long as amazon sells them and keeps the price affordable. Thanks Amazon!!!

name: Andy May
title: Poor Value
review: In a head-to-head comparison in identical night lights these batteries last about half as long as Duracell. And they're shrink-wrapped so tight one needs a sharp object just to open the package. Never again.

name: Bookbean
title: The only batteries I'll buy now
review: I started buying Amazon batteries a couple of years ago and have been so pleased with them that I don't buy batteries at the store any more. So easy to just order a pack of 20 of these, which will last me and my family several months. I don't notice any diminishment of performance between them and the "big name" batteries.

name: TJ Hammer
title: Good batteries and a good price.
review: I‚Äôm not a battery expert but I do use a lot of batteries. These batteries work well and I‚Äôm comfortable with the pricing. We tend to buy them in bulk so that we never run out. I would recommend these batteries. For more detailed information check the other reviews. A few get very specific on performance.

name: Betty K.
title: Low lumen.
review: They are VERY low lights. Not happy with these at all. Need another method to attach to cabinets. Mine have a backer board type texture that don‚Äôt allow much to stick to them. So, I resorted to glue‚Äîindustrial strength.

name: Scott Abbott
