title: Longevity is Awesome on These Batteries
review: Can't beat the value for the money. I performed an experiment with these on an LED spider, I've got on my house for Halloween. I put the batteries in, and leave it on, and keep track, of how long the batteries last. A competitor, that we all know and see in the stores everyday, last for about 32 hours, and then died. These batteries are now going on 54 hours, and still lit, albeit dim, but nonetheless, still lit up. These will be my go to batteries, from now on.

name: Cameron S
title: AmazonBasics batteries do it again!
review: I've lost count of the packs of these batteries I've purchased at this point. I buy them because they are reliable and affordable! They work great in remotes, toys, my guitar pedals and instruments with active electronics etc. I'm sure I'll be purchasing many more packs of these batteries!

name: K. McCown
title: Size does matter!
review: These candles are SO SMALL. Shame on me for not measuring out the size of the candle on my windows.I wanted them for the windows of my 2 story house for Christmas. I listened to the other reviews that had used them this way with success. Big mistake. They are small & look small in the windows & the light they give off is not substantial enough to make an impact from the street. I do not recommend them for this use.The profit was nicely packaged & worked fine. I think using them inside for decor would be ok.

name: marsumm
title: Last Long
review: These batteries last long and they are a great value for the cost.

name: Sci-Fi Guy
title: I got duds
review: At least some of the batteries were DOA. I didn't start using them till about 1 month after receiving them only to find in testing (on a good flashlight in which Duracell and some rechargeable batteries worked perfectly) at least some were dead. And yeah, I was careful to install them the right way.

name: Kim
title: Not a good idea to buy
review: I just opened a set of 4 and they didn't work. Before today, they didn't last beyond a month. Do not buy Amazon batteries, buy Duracell so you can have batteries that work.

name: PRPITT
title: They don't last long
review: I use these batteries in LED lights for closets. It hasn't even been 30 days since we bought them and they hold a charge about 3 hours of occasional coming on and off. The lights themselves were tested to make sure it was the batteries, and it was in fact the batteries. Great price because they just don't work well. I put a full charge on them and after coming on and off about every 30 mins they are dying out after 3 hours. Regular batteries and other rechargeable s last at least 6 weeks in these same LED lights. These never did last very long even when brand new.

name: Elizabeth Scott
title: SHORT LIFE SPAN, DO NOT BUY!
review: These batteries literally have the worlds shortest lifespan. DO NOT BUY THEM if you want them to work for longer than one minute. I can‚Äôt even return these horrible batteries because I didn‚Äôt try to use them until recently, and it‚Äôs unfortunately past the return date. So while I was trying to save money by not buying Duracell, I ended up buying Duracell anyway and donating $20 to Amazon. Buyer beware!

name: Ashley
title: Batteries Leaking Acid
review: awful batteries! I bought these hoping that they would be a great buy and instead regret the purchase immensely. I have a star projector for my infant son and used the batteries in it. After only ONE day the projector wouldn‚Äôt turn on anymore. When I opened the hatch it turned out that two batteries had leaked battery acid inside. I wasn‚Äôt impressed by the life span of the batteries but what do expect for that price, however the battery acid leaking is unacceptable. I will not use the batteries in anything else with the fear it will ruin another device or worse get on my son...

name: Melissa
title: Don't try to use these in kids toys!
review: We got these to run all those little toys that our little boys have (Thomas the trains and magic track cars etc) and the batteries barely last a day! I have gotten longer-lasting batteries from Dollar Tree! I am really disappointed in these! The AA's are not much better.If you just need to power tv remotes they will work for a month or so, but I suggest spending a little more and getting better batteries!

name: Jessica T
title: Do not last, not worth it
review: We have burned through these batteries because they do not last at all. The batteries we previously had in our remote lasted for over a year. We have changed these batteries 2x in 3 months. And in baby toys, they have lasted a week maybe. Do not recommend at all.

name: Krista&Bill
title: NEVER again
review: I am so disappoined with these batteries. I thought it was going to be a great value for the money and to try a new brand. I wont do that again. They do not hold a charge long and a few did not work at all. Very disappointed

name: D. OGLEE
title: Great Batteries
review: I use these for remotes and keyboards and such. They are great. I can't speak to how long they would last if under the stress of high energy toys but I would start with them before paying a ton more for these sizes.

name: Mr. Helpful
title: Affordable and Somehow does the Job
review: This is the most affordable in amazon market so far. I use this in tv remote controls, numerous toys of my children, soap dispenser etc. so far, it does not drain fast and does what a battery should do.Do I recommend this? As of this moment, yes!

name: J. Price
title: Big box of batteries
review: Update: these batteries don't last. They burn out quickly.I like this product. Everything runs on AAA these days so you can never have too many. Within the box, they come in smaller wrapped packages of 5 each so it makes it easy to put them in different places in the house to have when needed.

name: avarek
title: Bought 36 batteries, only got 35.
review: Decided to try these and see how they compare. I could clearly see when I opened the box that one of the 3 ‚Äú12-packs‚Äù is one battery short. Not worth returning because I‚Äôm lazy but worth mentioning for other buyers.

name: Mrc
title: Great deal on some durable batteries.
review: Huge pack of batteries for an affordable price. Its a good idea to have extra batteries around the house for when needed. I have a pair in a remote and i havent had the need to replace so the durability is ok enough for regular use

name: John
title: Maybe I got a bad batch
review: I usually really like Amazon branded products but must have gotten a bad batch of batteries. All of mine arrived dead. They would hardly power a TV remote if anything at all. I tested several batteries straight from the plastic on two different battery testers and most (90% or more) tested bad.

name: Rick
title: Good price
review: I havent used them for very long so far and its hard to rate on longevity. But the half dozen or so that I have installed are working it seems as well as more expensive name brands so I wouldnt be afraid to buy again.

name: Kcuret
title: Decent longevity for lower power needs
review: These are decent batteries and last an average amount of time for lower powered items. Good for remotes and fairy lights and a good price. Would buy again for those types of items but not for items requiring more power.

name: Marina Lee
title: Top buy
review: Third time purchasing and will continue to purchase for long time. I feel I sort of run thru them quickly, but have a toddler with a lot of high drain toys that are left on sometimes. Nice to have a few back ups on hand. Always comes fast and professional packaging. Thank you

name: Orphynanni
title: They work.
review: I don't know what else to say. They power an arsenal of electronic toys and remote controls very nicely. The seem to be comparable to the name brands though I've never tested them side by side. I just know that I haven't had to replace batteries any more often since switching to these. Best of all, the price can't be beat, and they get delivered to my door. Solid product.

name: MariamG
title: We Buy All Of Our Batteries From Amazon.......
review: I bought these AmazonBasics AAA Batteries (Pack of 20) via Subscribe and Save for the added savings. We normally buy rechargeables but sometimes you just need some inexpensive batteries for gifts or what have you...This product is made in Indonesia. Delivered as pictured and described. Size-wise, these fit into devices as they should. So far they seem comparable to others we've used but for the price, my expectations were not set too high.Good value for the 20 pack at under seven dollars before tax. Will purchase again and would recommend to others. Smile. Hope this helps.

name: Alex Sanchez
title: One you go to Amazon Basics you never go back
review: This batteries last a long time in my remote controls, the are priced better than the name branded one and they perform just as good or maybe even better. They have a nice weight to them, you can tell its a good battery.

name: Long term customer
title: Batteries run out extremely quickly. Very Poor Product
review: Batteries run out extremely quickly. Very Poor Product

name: William S. Holland
title: Very Short Useful Life
review: These batteries did not last long in all applications. For example, the batteries only lasted about 3-4 weeks in a television remote. I used the batteries up but won't buy them again.I was hopeful for value but very disappointed in the end.

name: Hannah
title: No longevity whatsoever
review: I hardly ever leave reviews but after using these batteries on several items in my house, these are by far the worst batteries I've had the displeasure of using. They end up dead in what seems like 24 hours or less. I had a lamp with these batteries and left it on for 4 hours for three days each. By the end of the third day the lamp was dead. And this has been repeating with the other items I'm using the batteries in. Will not be repurchasing, please beware!

name: THE Customer
title: Brand name batteries are stupid expensive
review: Batteries are goofy expensive for the name brands. The Amazon Basics are a better price but the trade off is shorter lifespan. Overall, still a decent deal.

name: Ryan O.
title: They are pretty good for what they cost?
review: The reviews had is very hesitant about buying these low priced budget batteries. We use a lot of AAA's in the household mainly in high powered led flash lights. Have been using Energizer and the occasional jobsmart brand from tsc. I will not say these amazon batteries are the greatest battery out there. They did however last surprisingly longer than expected. They lasted about 3/4 the time that the Energizers do in lights and they are still going strong in my kids toys. They are worth what you pay for them but if you want to go longer without having to swap out batteries you should go with Energizers or Duracell. I will be trying the aa batteries next.

name: J. C. Evans
title: About 1/3 of these are bad.
review: About 1/3 of these don't work at all - I've never had batteries do that. Also, does not seem to last anywhere near as long as name brands. Maybe just got unlucky, but not buying these again.Also not easy to open! They come in plastic-wrapped 4 packs that takes a sharp object to open.

name: Brusky 1995
title: POOR POWER LASTING. Not up to snuff with major brand batteries.
review: Poor lasting power.I use exclusively with my cordless headphones which draw minimal power.If I get 3 days out of these I consider myself lucky.

name: mprii
title: Battery values add up
review: These AAA batteries work and last as long as the duracells that I normally purchase. However there is great value in buying these Amazon basic batteries. For the price I paid for this pack of basic batteries and my local drugstore I would have gotten only four batteries.

name: The Editor
title: No loose batteries
review: These are good batteries at a good price. They stand out because they come plastic-wrapped in packages of four. This is brilliant. Instead of dozens of batteries rolling around in a plastic blister pack or loose in a drawer, they're in packs that can be stacked anywhere

name: Maryalice
title: Amazon surprisingly disappoints
review: Long time Amazon customer but their batteries don't last. Won't be buying them again. It's not the first time. Size AAA and AA had similar, poor results. Buyer beware.

name: Kenneth Depree
title: Good, Reliable Battery For The Price
review: I have used AmazonBasics batteries before and know they are a good value. When at home I normally use rechargeables, but because I was leaving on a trip to visit various family members and would need batteries, rather than taking batteries with me I ordered these for delivery to my first stop. They are doing the job I expected and any not needed immediately will go home with me and put to good use.

name: FlamingoLady
title: They don‚Äôt last.
review: I like most of Amazon‚Äôs brands but these batteries are a complete bust. I purchased for led candles on 4 hour timers. The batteries lasted less that a week before the lights went dim. The AA seemed to do much better, as those were for a wreath lit 24/7 for several weeks. Better to stick with other brands.

name: ScottieW
title: Good thing they come in large batches, because they don't last
review: The batteries are handy to have, especially because they come in large packs; however, they are pretty pitiful with respect to longevity. Should have expected this based on the price, but one can hope.

name: Corie and Cristopher
title: none of them work.
review: They were duds. I bought them before christmas so I could stick them in the toys and not one worked. I tried them on other items to make sure it wasn't the toys and not the batteries . Nope , it was all of the batteries. I only give one star for the reason I got them on time ....now I have a box of triple a batteries that don't work . so glad I caught that before christmas or I would have had disappointed children on christmas.

name: Roryson
title: All batteries died after sitting 15 months, they do not last 10 years on shelf
review: I bought 36 of these for undercabinet lights. I have never turned them on I just wanted the availability to do so. Every single one of the lights does not work after 15 months of install NEVER using them. As others have states if you use them right away they are fine, still half the battery length. But do NOT try to store these.

name: D. Levine
title: Junky Batteries don‚Äôt work
review: Bought these in July, 2020. Went to use a couple in February, 2021 and they were no good. Went to the store and bought some others which worked fine. Hugely disappointed. Don‚Äôt waste your money.

name: Gina
title: AAA Batteries
review: I purchased these batteries after my television remotes died, and i was running around trying to find batteries. I usually keep extras in my home, but i could not, so ordering in this little bulk iis best for me.

name: Smedley Butler
title: Good value, excellent presentation
review: Good value. Very fast delivery!In my experience the AAA's that I use last a long time in my devices that take them. This group should last a long time.They arrived packed into a tidy cardboard sleeve, all in a row so that you can dispense one battery at a time.

name: Zilla
title: Highly recommend!
review: I‚Äôm really impressed, these batteries work just as well, and maybe better than anything you can purchase. These are much less expensive with the same great quality of the best out there, highly recommend.

name: Arijit Roy
title: Amazon basic is always value for money
review: I wouldn‚Äôt compare these with Duracell longevity, thats practically isn't fair. For the price I would say these are great and last long enough compared to any other batteries and are almost 1/2 of the cost of similar competitor brands.

name: Product buyer
title: It‚Äôs a bargain and great product
review: It‚Äôs a bargain and great product like most of Amazon basics items. People always cry for small business. I hate them as the steal from customers, their employees and hardly pay any taxes. My local store asked me $4 for 4 batteries.

name: Eric Magoo
title: Batteries for Dayzz
review: Cheaper than other options. Will they last longer than more name-brand batteries, not sure, but I have so many I can just replace them. I have also started using rechargeable batteries, so these will become for emergencies.

name: Chelsea BRR
title: Skip
review: Thought these would be a good value for money but man was I wrong. These last less than half the amount of time of a Duracell or Energizer or any other type of battery that I normally get at Target. Not worth the hassle. Just skip these. Do not recommend.

name: dewdad
title: Inexpensive
review: I don't see a big difference between these inexpensive batteries and the "name brand" ones I use since I mostly use them for electronics like remote controls and other applications where high power demands are not needed.

name: Ken W.
title: Why pay double?
review: These batteries are great and less than half the price of Duracell. BTW I have had many Duracells leak when left in a device for a long time. These are no more inclined to leak than any others.

name: Mr.J
title: Good batteries
review: I decided to buy this because it is cheap. However, before buying I read the reviews and most of them have reported there are leaks. But I did not get into any sort of trouble with these batteries. So far it works great, no issues.

name: Irongohon
title: Thanks again amazon!
review: I alway love Amazon brand, of course they are not like name brands battery, but there alot cheaper then them. I used this battery for my car remote, it last me close to 2 months+, I'm happy with it..

name: Chas
title: Quality
review: So far so good with these. Unlike the junk ray o vac and some duracell that have self destructed in my items like remotes and flashlights ruining them, these have been great. I will buy more .

name: Angel44fire
title: Always buy your batterys from Amazon!
review: The value for the money is so much better than any store you can buy from! Even Costco batteries are more expensive.These batteries last as long as any other battery I use and they are a great value!

name: Gwen
title: All dead batteries - thanks :(
review: Ridiculous waste of money and very sad bc I really needed batteries for my reptiles terrarium lighting. None of them worked. I tried them in all different capacities to make sure it was the batteries that was not working. What‚Äôs the point of buying a whole bunch of brand new dead batteries!!!? :( very upset.

name: Charlette A. P. Kealoha
title: It works very well!
review: It fits the budget and funny how Amazon has the rabbit brand affordable?! Of course you get more with the Amazon brand for we did notice how much the triple a's is needed though out the house. Like under the counter's press lights for which we have a lot of.

name: C. Eckard
title: Amazon Basics 36 Pack AAA High-Performance Alkaline Batteries, 10-Year Shelf Life
review: Amazon batteries are the only ones that I buy and have bought for many years they last just as long as the more expensive ones and you get more for your moneyI highly recommend Amazon batteries

name: HungryCraftyKelsey
title: Nice value!
review: My daughter has tons of toys that require batteries, as well as controllers for the switch. The longevity isn't great, but it isnt horrible. The value of the money for the batteries is great.

name: K. Fernau
title: Good value
review: So far I am very pleased with my purchase. I gave longevity 5 stars despite not having them long yet since I left a flashlight on for most of the night to test one and it continued to work without any reduction in power. I would recommend them. Shelf life remains to be discovered.

name: Ebay
title: Great deal
review: compare to price vs quality, i couldn't see any better deal than this. i used to use brand name batteries but this one do the same. I will now continue to get these for all sizes. Save your money, and get these.

name: Multi-grain bagels
title: So far very good for the price
review: Got these in time for Christmas presents I knew would need batteries. The 36 count has helped me keep up with toys that have long been holding on to dead batteries. And has brought back to life. It was fun switching them out and somewhat satisfying. They come in a flat square package with batteries stored in packs of 4 so 9 packs in total.That being said I'll see how long these hold up and try to update.

name: Stephanie M.
title: Awesome Value
review: Great value on batteries! I don't know about longevity or remote control because my focus is on other priorities, but there isn't anything I distinctly didn't like about these batteries so I assume that means they do well in those two criteria. I bought these for their price and I've been happy with them.

name: Meraj
title: Battery life comparable to name brands
review: With Tons of kids toys We blow through batteries like a Tesla on a road trip! These AB aaa batteries have as much life as their bunny and copper top counterparts. Can‚Äôt comment on shelf life for obvious reasons.

name: Ula Parra
title: Short life span
review: The batteries have the shortest life of any battery I have ever purchased even the dollar store batteries last longer I brought them because they seemed like a great deal however when I stared to replace them daily in my sons dinosaur toy I realized they aren‚Äôt any good

name: Beantown Jim
title: Basically OK
review: I found that you can't skimp on batteries. Get the best battery for that particular size unless changing them is a breeze and you can afford down time. The batteries in question here are ok, but the absolute top brands' alkaline products seem to be better.

name: Pete
title: Needs the larger washers that come with the 3 pack.
review: This was our second order for these lights. We first ordered the 3 pack about a month ago, and have been happy with the installation and performance in both indoor and outdoor locations. We liked them enough to order more. We just took delivery of a 6 pack of the lights, and find that they came with smaller diameter washers, resulting in less adhesive area, and consequently they will not stay put. They keep falling off the wall or bottom side of the shelf. I'll keep them, assuming the lights themselves are trouble free, and will either try to find a larger diameter washer, and use some double sided tape, or put a higher strength adhesive on the smaller washers provided.

name: Ahmad
title: Should have read the reviews first!
review: BATTERIES LEAK!!! I usually don‚Äôt get consumed with reviews, but this time it directly affected me! I used to always order Amazon since they are the cheapest brand of batteries and have a good life! I‚Äôm not sure if they have changed the production, but it‚Äôs horrible now! Batteries totally ruined my lamp by leaking! I‚Äôve never experienced anything like this in my life. Stir clear!!! So disappointed in Amazon!

name: JH in FL
title: Batteries leaked & lost charge quickly
review: I used 4 of these in an Electronic Pulse Massager in replacement of Duracell batteries previously used. These didn't hold the charge long at all and one of the batteries leaked a little bit. I would recommend to stick with Duracell even though it costs a bit more. I wish I would have read more reviews before purchasing these.

name: Whodey1029
title: Save your money.. DO NOT RECOMMEND
review: Total waste of money.. Spend the extra $$ and get a better battery. Put these in my Swiffer and they lasted a whole 10 minutes. Tried them in a remote control car and lasted about 15 min.. DO NOT RECOMMEND..

name: MrReview
title: Quality lower than before
review: We buy these batteries several times and the last two batches have been horrible. They barely last a full day like they did in the past. They are used in the same item every day and now they quit working about 45-60min sooner than in the past. Will stop buying the amazon brand batteries.

name: Clay Walker
title: These batteries do not last long
review: These at first seem like a good value based on price, but the longevity for the 20 pack I purchased is terrible. I bought these to replace batteries in a digital scale that used to last months with a big name brand battery. With these batteries, I‚Äôm replacing every few weeks with little usage. I won‚Äôt purchase these again.

name: depscribe
title: Short life -- no bargain
review: You get what you pay for.These batteries have very little life, even in low-load applications (in my case, Roku remotes not using voice commands). A four-pack of Duracells or Energizers would have lasted longer than a 20-pack of these. Alas.

name: Memphis Music Man
title: THEY WORK GREAT
review: Got these for l a laser tag kit of four vests and four guns. They advertise a battery life of two hours on the laser tag vests and guns but there was plenty of power left after the grand kids used them. The batters come wrapped in groups of four and you probably save a lot of money buying a box of these if you use a lot of AAA or AA batteries around the house.

name: Rick Acosta
title: Great Value for the Price!
review: I did the auto renew on this and they come in handy! When you have 8 people living in a house, you don‚Äôt realize how many batteries you go through! Great value and last just as long as the expensive brands.

name: M. Frazier
title: Best batteries
review: Our favorite batteries! With a toddler and teenager, we have to keep batteries at all times. Amazon basics are the best for their value and longevity. These are the only brand we buy now .

name: Gonzalez
title: So much better
review: I‚Äôm gonna have to eat some crow on this. I was a firm believer in name brand batteries. I was under the assumption that Amazon batteries were low quality but how wrong I was. Will not buy any other batteries.

name: Ronnie Lee Rainwater
title: Wonderful product! I will always buy Amazon batteries from here on out!!!
review: I love the quality of these batteries and especially the value for the money. I will always buy Amazon batteries from now on. I wish I would have known about them sooner as a mother of 4!

name: Liz
title: Not value for money
review: Sorry folks, these are terrible batteries. I have bought amazon batteries several times and have not had complaints previously.These ones lasted for less than a month in a toy train for my son. Initially I thought maybe it was the toy (even though it had not been used often).It was when the batteries I had put in the Firestick remote control lasted less than 3 months that I realised these batteries are junk. Remote controls need a very small amount of power to function, so 3 months is terrible.

name: L.G.Kindle Customer
title: Worth the money
review: I have used only two batteries at this time, but they function well. They are well worth the cost to keep batteries on hand. I would not hesitate to order them again. I feel the purchase was well worth the cost.

name: Draexo
title: Great batteries. Perform as well as the name brands
review: Great batteries. Perform as well as the name brands.

name: Lightseeker
title: They don‚Äôt last
review: Worst batteries I have ever bought. They burn out in short order. I used in a bathroom scale and they lasted less than a month, when compared with name brands that last for over a year.

name: Amazon Customer
title: Batteries ok, plastic wrap sucks.
review: Batteries seem OK, but they are shrink wrapped in hard plastic film which is very difficult to remove. Takes a knife or some other kind of blade, and then one risks cutting oneself. Couldn't a different kind of plastic film could be used just as cheaply?

name: Patrick Haley
title: UNSAFE! Exploded battery
review: We got a pack of 36 of these and the first couple I used went in a train remote for my 7-year old son. Lasted a few days and this morning, we heard an audible POP and found one of the batteries completely blown up--thus ruining the remote for his train. Unsafe. 0 stars.

name: Sarah F.
title: Good for price range!
review: Great value for the money, I use the AA and AAA for my remotes and they usually last a few months easily without being changed. Some of my children's toys don't last as long but these batteries are perfect for remotes, flashlights etc.

name: Edward P. Jankiewicz
title: Longevity
review: I put these batteries in several small candles in a candelabra (see picture) that I DO NOT light/use. I only lit the candelabra to test and to keep the batteries from leaking (TOTAL of NO MORE than 10 minutes over a period of three months). To my surprise the batteries died with virtually no use! I hope the rest of the 36 batteries last longer????

name: Misty
title: Short lifespan
review: I had high hopes for these but the life span of these are just sad. You might get 1-2 months worth of life in tv remote. Any type of light source, not that long. Can't recommend these.

name: Larry Schaller
title: I use them a lot!
review: I stopped buying those name brands. I am not sure if these last as long but for the price I will take them. They do last long enough that I can tell they are a much better buy. Thank you

name: WA8UOC
title: Amazon basic batteries are of good quality.
review: I have used these batteries in AA and AAA size for two years and have never had a problem with any of them. They have good life and I have never had one leak. I will keep using these.

name: Don Anastas
title: Easy to store in the boxes they arrive in
review: So many gadgets, so little time.....and batteries. Don't run out of batteries at the wrong time and always have a variety of sizes on hand because gadgets that use batteries are not equal. AA, AAA, D - you get it. For the value per battery and the lasting power of AmazonBasics Performance Alkaline why not get a bunch in all the sizes you need. Easy to store in the boxes they arrive in, pre-marked on the outside so make life a bit easier and keep your stuff working!

name: Robert STL
title: Economical and Lasting
review: One thing I've learned is that we over pay for brand name batteries. And when you buy the cheap ones, they don't last. These are not only economical...they last. I'll never buy any other brand again.

name: Dr. Stuart Gitlow
title: Fresh batteries with labeled shelf life ten years in the future. Alkaline. Made in Indonesia.
review: Batteries are packaged in sets of four so as not to short against one another and are easily removed from plastic without the need for any tools. My batteries arrived with a date stamp ten years in the future, perhaps a somewhat optimistic shelf life but clearly a fresh set of batteries. Have had no difficulty with any of them. No signs of leakage or other manufacturing defects. Made in Indonesia. Labeled as alkaline.

name: Tom Stiles (hamrad88)
title: Less Expensive Alternate
review: Battery prices are insane and I have a ton of electronics that eat batteries so I thought I would try these as the price was much lower. They seem to work fine and appear to have close to the same battery life as the high priced ones. We will see if any leak and report back in a few months.

name: M P. Garner
title: No Hassle
review: I love the fact that I can make orders online and get the necessary things that I want and need so easily , being a senior person. I can eliminate the hassle of winter driving. And that pleases me so much!

name: James Henderson
title: Batteries failed from the start!
review: I bought these batteries for small motion sensor lights that I planned to put in closets. An awesome feature of the lights is that they are both motion and light sensitive meaning the batteries wouldn't be drained during the day or when other lights are on, so they should last for a very long time. Not!!! I really love my lights but the batteries failed from the first day. To top off the failure is the fact that I gave lights and batteries as birthday presents to my mother and daughter. I trusted the ratings which were great. Amazon product, rated great on Amazon...?

name: Mark
title: Short battery life
review: Poor AAA battery life. These dropped to .99 volt while a Harbor Freight AAA alkaline battery dropped to 1.25 volt in a side by side test using a remote transmitting thermometer. Granted neither battery is a premium battery, but I was surprised at the short life of the Amazon Basics AAA alkaline.

name: C. COX
title: A waste of money
review: I placed these in GE LED candles on a timer. The first night they looked great. Its been a week of burning 4 hours a night and you can barely see the flame any longer. What a waste of money.

name: Jason
title: Cheaper than Costco!
review: I having been using the AmazonBasics batteries for a while and they perform very well. Lets be honest...batteries can be expensive. I used to order these from Costco but these batteries offer the same life span for a cheaper price. I also love the fact that I do not have to drive to a store just to get them. If you have children, you know how many batteries you can go through with toys and Xbox controllers. You can also get these on autoship every so often so you never run out.

name: JeanGee
title: Just average AA Batteries
review: I don't know if it's the batteries, nature of the device(s) used, spending too much using the devices, or a combination of both, or all, but I go through quite a lot of AA batteries. They end up costing a substantial sum over, even a short time, because of this, and since I need them for my devices; such as a mouse, lighted magnifying glass (I'm getting old, so need one of these to see such things as the logins info for the many accounts needed these days), plus my two cable remotes.

name: Jody
title: Great value
review: I bought these batteries for my tv remote. They are a great value for the cost. They aren‚Äôt dead yet, but I‚Äôve only had them a little while, so I don‚Äôt really know for sure about longevity.

name: Cody Stonehill
title: As good as the big brands!
review: After being loyal to Duracell and only buying Duracell, I thought it would be a good time to try out Amazon's take on batteries. I am not disappointed! The price is GREAT for the capacity of these! These last just as long as any Duracell I have bought. I will continue to buy these, for the value they offer!

name: Mike Ochsenbein
title: good price
review: buy these batteries all the-time for the price i think they work as goid as any, cheaper than duracell so i figure it is worth it and they work in grand kids toys which seems to go through batteries as fast as i can buy them, duracell dont hold up that much better

name: mayur.panagar
title: Not good
review: Amazon brand batteries AAA‚Äôs does not work in Amazon fire stick remote I put brand new batteries Amazon brand And Remote won‚Äôt work , And then I bought a different brand batteries Duracell it was working completely fine

name: Spiderman
title: AAA batteries wrapped in clear wrap
review: 5 AAA batteries in cardboard box wrapped in clear cellophane shrink wrap.Great buy 10 year life. Tested Costco batteries and these. Both output same. Amazonbasic better buy

name: Jennifer E.
title: Is cheaper really better?
review: Gave this brand a shot as I normally would buy Duracell brand for my battery needs. Amazon brand lasted about 3-4 weeks in my T.V and bed remotes. Compared to Duracell which would last months when used before. I guess the saying goes you get what you pay for....while Amazon brand is less expensive they don‚Äôt have the ability to power longer than a few weeks so you find yourself changing out more often.

name: Krabinz
title: Brand new battery leaked and destroyed a device.
review: These were only sitting in an emergency LED flare for 6 months...and one of the batteries leaked and destroyed the device. This was an emergency LED flare for my vehicle. I will not buy these anymore and buy more brand names.

name: Amazon Customer
title: functional batteries.
review: These things work just like batteries, but they are cheaper and come in a big box so I don't have to buy more for a while. Other than that they are batteries. Buy them if you need to power things.

name: D
title: Batteries do not last - buy a real brand
review: These (and all Amazon basics batteries I have bought) have very short lifespan and last dramatically less than name brand batteries. See my review of their 9V batteries which I unfortunately bought around the same time as these before I realized what poor quality these batteries were.I had thought batteries are a simple commodity and Amazon, or whomever it has contracted to make these, could make batteries of roughly the same quality as a name brand. I was definitely wrong. Buy a real brand.

name: firemedic2008
title: Great batteries!
review: I love Amazon batteries! They are seriously perfect for any application and are far cheaper than the competition. I have not seen any reduction in life since switching to these and they seem to handle better actually than most!

name: Dude From Elko
title: Good deal
review: I buy these batteries with my bonus points. It is like getting free batteries. They do the job. Maybe not as good as some name brands, but much better than other bargain batteries.

name: April M McCafferty
title: Good deal
review: These batteries are fine. They come together in shrink wrapped packaging that was a little difficult to open. The price is reasonable for the number you get. Time will tell how long they last and if they are good quality.

name: Tim Perkins
title: Garbage, dont buy these AAA batteries!
review: Absolute scam, half the pack dies within 2 days in a tv remote and the others last maybe a couple weeks and yes Ive had for months and went through pack before reviewing. Id have actually saved money getting something reputable instead of taking a chance on Amazon garbage.

name: Emille
title: Received a bad batch.
review: I've ordered these before and they worked great. But for some reason, this batch I received drained incredibly fast. I have a bug zapper I use these batteries for. Previously they'd last 6 months. The battery from this pack only lasted 2 days each time I replaced them.

name: Laken H.
title: Great value!
review: Great value for the money! I can't speak on longevity, but the remote batteries are still going strong after about a month, so...seems like they're working great! Will buy again!

name: jefo13
title: Do not buy
review: Do not buy, batteries came exploded

name: Cyndi & David Blake
title: Good deal, good quality batteries
review: These are a great value for the amount that you get in this package. They last long and are just as good as many major brands. We will continue to buy these because you get more bang for your buck.

name: Dantes
title: but I‚Äôve rarely received a package in such poor shape from AmazonBasics
review: Came with another order. Both the box for the batteries and several individual 4 pack of batteries were busted open. Not sure how that even happened, but I‚Äôve rarely received a package in such poor shape from AmazonBasics. Not pleased

name: Jade
title: Low battery life
review: I bought these because I needed batteries during the pandemic. I am constantly replacing them in everything I use them in. With Duracell, the batteries last about 6 months. These are barely lasting a month, if a month. Same with other devices I have used these batteries in. I am better off buying the Duracell. A bit more money, but worth it.

name: Michelle Bertram
title: Great value and longevity
review: These are really great batteries for the price and work very well. Lasts for quite a long time and you can‚Äôt beat the price and if you have a Prime membership, get them the next day. Overall great batteries.

name: Clint Bradford
title: I Was a Duracell Purchaser for Decades ...
review: I haven't been pleased with Duracells the past few years. Thought I would give Amazon's AA, AAA, and 9VDC batteries a try. And I am pleased: use in two-way radios, atomic clocks, flashlights - they equal or exceed expectations.

name: ksuze
title: All Batteries Dead in a week for LED candles on a timer
review: I had bought these batteries because I had a dozen LED candles for decor up in my house. Trusting name brands and Amazon brand similar enough ordered these. Proven very wrong. Batteries were dead within a week. Switched to Duracell batteries still going. Will not make this mistake on batteries again.

name: Gaurav
title: Great value for money
review: Its definitely a great value for money and extremely durable compared to the other batteries we get at the grocery storeI have been using it for more than a month and I am extremely satisfied with my purchase

name: CJ
title: Buzz buzz
review: Great price for the abundance of batteries you get. Keeps my wife‚Äôs vibrator buzzin..

name: Tom Clark
title: A bargain!
review: Been using these a few months and I really see no difference between the amazon batteries and the duracell or energizers. And these are waaaay cheaper so I'll be buying more!

name: Ryan Houlihan
title: Ehhhh
review: I'll only use these in tv and general device remotes. They don't last very long. A little better than the dollar store kind and you get more than the dollar store. Only will buy again due to convenience

name: Lindsey
title: great
review: I bought these off amazon because i was sick of going to the store and buying batteries for my xbox controller. These are great! They have a decent battery life, and the pack comes with so many!

name: Eldey
title: Great value
review: Exactly as described but half the cost of name brand. I only buy Amazon brand batteries because they last forever but they‚Äôre so affordable. I‚Äôve been buying their brand batteries for 3 years now and haven‚Äôt been disappointed yet.

name: Amazon Customer
title: dependable alks,
review: dependable, have yet to get a depleted batch, unlike durcells and energizers, these have never disappointed, or been unworth package price for quantity, got these for wireless mouse, used by pairs, still have couple sets from previous order, these almost last as long as mouse says they will, i'll be interested if amazon ever decides to sell lithium batteries....

name: Donald T.
title: Very difficult to use
review: This was a replacement for a Panasonic blood pressure monitor, I have used it for roughly 2 weeks, and have experienced more error messages than actual measurements. The item does not stay secure on my smaller wrist, and can take up to 6 or more times to get an actual measurement. Even then I am not sure it is accurate as it varies widely from my Panasonic, and I am fairly confident that my heart is not beating as fast as it states.

name: A Branch
title: Work as expected
review: Great batteries and a great price. I've never had a problem with these and feel like they consistently run well and a nice length of time - I don't ever get the impression of "Didn't I just replace these?" with these batteries. Overall, I would recommend. Blessings!

name: Amazon Customer
title: works as expected- great value
review: works as expected- great value

name: Ed
title: lasts long time
review: led candles still light up after 3 months

name: niki mckernan
title: DO NOT BUY!!!  Absolute JUNK!!!!
review: I wish I had read all of the other reviews from years past saying to stay away! They do not last!!!We did not have them long enough to damage our products - thank goodness!!! My husband put them in a safe 6 months ago (which we hardly ever open) and they are dead. Steer Clear and get a name brand you can trust!I am only writing this because I have not seen any recent poor reviews and Amazon clearly has not fixed the problem. I hope my review will help at least one person!

name: JustMe
title: Work Great For Me
review: Seem to be comparable to the big name brand batteries from what I can tell. I'm not getting leakage or DOA's from any of them so far, and I buy a lot, including different sizes.

name: P M
title: Didn‚Äôt work
review: These are lousy batteries that will not work even though I‚Äôve tried them in different items. I appreciate that Amazon refunded my money, but do yourself a favor and purchase the brand name ones for a few bucks more.

name: Nancy L Saylor
title: Not so "hot"
review: The batteries arrived on time at Christmas. They are packaged 4 to a pack and after using 3 or 4 packs at Christmas they were stored away in a cool, dry place. Today I needed new batteries for a toothbrush. I tried 4 separate, new from package, batteries. NOT ONE WORKED. I am very dissatisfied because the window to return is no longer available.

name: lexi mauve
title: Don't bother, especially if they are for amazon fire stick remote.
review: Don't bother. I bought these to go along with my Amazon fire stick and they refused to work for my Amazon remote but they work for my other remotes that aren't amazon brand. This is stupid and ridiculous! Very u happy with my purchase.

name: lizE
title: Needed A Source For Buying These In Bulk
review: I love my outdoor decorative lights, but they require frequent battery changes. I was buying from a dollar store, but the batteries just didn't have any life. These are affordable and they last.

name: Techie
title: Short operating life
review: Used for remote control mouse and keyboard. Batteries run down in3-4 days compared to others lasting up to a month under same use and conditions. Will use up stock but not reorder.

name: Cathryn Choate
title: Do not last.
review: Not happy. Put 2 AAA in TV remote (that doesn‚Äôt get used frequently) on November 15 and today January 24 are already bad. Not economical if I have to replace every two months.

name: Isaac Wasson
title: No 'no-leak guarentee'
review: Get energizer or something with a no-leak guarentee. I've had several flashlights ruined by leaking batteries from Amazon and only just learned that energizer and I think duracell will replace your device if it's ruined by a leaking battery.

name: Michael Farrell
title: Junk
review: I've had these batteries for three months. They state that they have a three year shelf life. They are supposed to be 1.5 volts. Of the ones that I have left, two are 1.2 volts, seven are 1.0 volts and one is .5 volts. I wouldn't buy these again. Total junk.

name: gloria m.
title: Triple A batteries are different sizes.
review: These batteries do not fit in anything I have. I just tried 3 different items. Can I return the batteries if I opened up the package

name: Joshua & Logan
title: In the land of battery operated everything....
review: We keep a constant supply of all sizes of batteries from Amazon, if you haven't tried them....You are missing out on great value. 3 kids = lots of battery operated items. Amazon batteries = value and performance.

name: Oliver Klozoff
title: Not bad
review: These are great batteries for items that do not pull a lot of energy from the batteries. In my regular remotes, these last a very long time. However if you are using the firestick, I recommend you buy energizers or duracell's. When I use these batteries in my firestick remote oh, I have to change them once a week.

name: Justin W
title: They‚Äôre batteries... that work for a short time
review: Update: they don‚Äôt last that long at all. 100 have gone faster than any small, name brand battery pack ever would. Save your money and get a different brand. Would be interested in seeing how they compare time verse cost.Seem to last consistently and in line with any other decent batteries.

name: k'la
title: Yup, they‚Äôre batteries
review: When I got my fire stick, it came with the amazon batteries. They lasted forever, so I grabbed this pack of 36. Can never have enough batteries with all the electronics around these days

name: Sydney F
title: Great Deal
review: I always order Amazon batteries! They are long lasting and a great deal. I just stick a pack in my kitchen junk drawer and it lasts forever!

name: Johnny Nuclear
title: Leaked in a critical piece of medical equipment, rendering it temporarily unusable.
review: They Leak.I had 2 of these in a small digital medical device, which is a top of the line brand Oximeter (measures O2 in the bloodstream as well as BPM, heart rhythm etc...) my 92 yr old mother has A-fib so when she gets out of breath i need to check the O2 level in her blood to decide if she needs supplemental oxygen. They worked well for about 8 months, but last week she was out of breath & when i went to check her O2 levels the Oximeter wouldn't turn on. I figured maybe the batteries just ran out of power so put some fresh "Procell Duracell" alkalines in (supplied by the hospital, its the only battery they use/ trust... but it still wouldnt power on. I measured both the Amazon Basics with a tester & they still read almost full, measured the Duracell's & they were 100% thus i thought the device went bad (less than a year old) but upon closer inspection i noticed one of the units 4 spring contacts had rust all over it, yet the other 3 contacts were clean. i looked at the amazon batteries & noticed one had been leaking from the negative end. I took a tiny file & carefully filed all the rust off the Oximeter spring, then finished cleaning it using a small parts brush/ contact cleaner. I put the Duracell's back in & thankfully the Oximeter worked perfect once again. However, If i hadn't had good access to that spring, i would have had to throw the oximeter out. Note- The Oximeter was always kept in a sealed medical bag, never exposed to humidity or radical temp. changes. I then removed any other Amazon batteries from the rest of my devices & noticed another one had started leaking inside my Klein Voltage tester- but luckily it hadnt fully rusted the contact yet because those contact springs cant be accessed & it would have ruined that devise.I hope my 2 cents saves a few people from ruining an important or expensive electronic item or render it unusable at a critical time, like it did in my case.

name: Edwina L. Smith
title: They died rapidly.
review: I've used this product in the past with no problems, but this batch must have been old. The items for which I purchased them required 4 AAA batteries. I find these are lasting no more than a week. The first four kept my commode light going for quite some time...close to three and a half weeks. So far, I'm getting far less service than I expected...and this is a large pack of batteries. I can't recommend them.

name: Walter R. Weber
title: Need for classroom calculators
review: My district is broke and I have to buy my own batteries. This kept me going without waiting for a sale at my local supermarket. Much better quality than ones I bought at a discount hardware store that leaked.

name: ProfesserP
title: Awesome Batteries at a fraction of the price.
review: Definetly the best value for the money over all . Awesome quality at a fraction of the price of any top name brand batteries. Amazon Prime deals are unsurpassed. Thank you again Amazon and Amazon Prime. You never let me down!

name: Wildthing33
title: Battery life
review: These batteries seem to last almost as long as the main more expensive leading brand. I use in an electronic floor safe and it greatly diminishes total life of the batteries. So for the price difference, these seem to be a better deal..

name: Erica Leigh Durian
title: This gives us a nice stash at a great price
review: When you have young children, it is important to have extra batteries on hand for all of their toys. This gives us a nice stash at a great price. It also comes in handy when we buy gifts for the kids's friends that require batteries--we just put the needed amount in a small plastic bag and tape it to the box in case the parents don't have batteries already.

name: David M Vandenbush
title: So far so good
review: So far so good. Need to see how long these last and whether they leak when left in devices with minimal use. They are nicely packaged so I don't expect leaks in storage.

name: Choo-Choo-Kitty
title: Batteries. Yay.
review: These are batteries. What‚Äôs there to say? They work well. I used them mostly for my headlamps and remote controls. They didn‚Äôt explode on me so that‚Äôs a win in my book.

name: Cory
title: Last just as long as name brabd
review: These seem to work just as well as the expensive name brand batteries. I've had them in a couple items for over a month and havent had to change them so I would say they are doing good and I would buy again as needed.

name: Brezy
title: Great value! Life saver!
review: Great value and helps you avoid looking for batteries! Nicely packaged and came so quickly! I love that! Save yourself time and frustration and get 100 in double A's and triple A's.

name: Sivant
title: These batteries contain the specified amount of potential electrical energy ...
review: These batteries contain the specified amount of potential electrical energy, have not suddenly started leaking caustic fluids, and were inexpensive compared to the competition. I do fear their production and pending disposal are a small contribution to our pending doom, but my flashlight now works.

name: Luc1f3r
title: Value deal
review: Great value buy but in term of lifespan probably little short side compared to other name brands. All in all I think is great buy if you use AAA batteries often but not a good buy if you use just few and store this(go with rechargeable).

name: David
title: Don't last
review: Not a good value when you discover that these batteries do not last. I placed them in a battery operated light that I only used occasionally. Within a week, they were already showing signs of wearing down. I tried them in other devises and discovered the same issue. The price is OK for batteries needed in a pinch. Just not for longer term use.

name: David
title: AmazonBasics = Amazing Brand
review: AmazonBasics has become a great brand that rivals the Energizers of the world. These batteries are an affordable price and a really high quality, especially when compared to the competition. With having a three year old, we are constantly running through batteries and it is great having these AmazonBasics type products out there to help middle income families like ours afford all the "necessities" that comes with having kids and just life in general (think remote control batteries).

name: HappyHiker
title: Very poor batteries
review: Batteries don't last. Supposed to be good until 2029, but half are already dead. Purchased in Feb 2020. The ones I did get to use ran down quickly. I will purchase other batteries until Amazon gets their quality control figured out.

name: Luther-sMom
title: cheap and easy
review: Not much to say, it's a battery, it's cheap, easier to buy on line than to go to a store so if you need batteries for your remotes, go for it, they work just fine and you can save yourself a little money.

name: E Adgate
title: Best Value of the AAs
review: I've watched some performance tests on various batteries and these Amazon basics were the best value and I would agree. You can get slightly better performance for a lot more money or lot less performance for a little less money.ProjectFarm on YouTube has a great performance test video.

name: Gixxer5
title: Most were already dying out
review: After I received these batteries I loaded everything I needed to, within a days time the batteries were already dying out in 4 of the 5 items I put them in. I went through with an Ohm meter and checked the remaining batteries and they were at 1.0 volts instead of the 1.5 they should be and that's the ones I hadn't used yet.

name: CJ
title: These batteries work well - good price
review: Batteries work well. I particularly like the packaging - shrink wrapped tightly so it's easy to get the number I need without the rest of the batteries falling out everywhere. Good price.

name: Meghan L
title: Works just as good as the big brands
review: My husband is so particular about name brands, but we did a side by side test with these in one of those automatic air freshener things and these outlasted the competition. I‚Äôm not sure why they did but to me that says they are at least as good as the name brand ones. With all the kids toys we have around the house, I stocked up on these in multiple sizes

name: tonermd
title: Flammable?
review: After reading an article on the CNN website I went through my stock of Amazon Basics AA and AAA batteries and discarded all of them. Seems they have a problem with flammability.

name: Kelsi Potts
title: Packed well and a value
review: The batteries arrived packed very well and I‚Äôm now set on AAA batteries for the next 10 years thanks to Amazon. Cheaper than buying the same amount of comparable battery brands for sure

name: Connie
title: 1v is not Good..
review: Bought on Aug 2nd 2017, Oct 4th head lamp that I had loaded with these batteries when I received and had barely used, would not come on.Opened a new still wrapped 4 pack, loaded - light would not come on. checked batteries and found one of them had already leaked, while sonme unused batteries down to 1.1 volt or less. p.s. 1.1v is not Good...Put some Duracell AAA's in and I have light. Only 3 months. Not Cool..!!..

name: sarah and Craig carda
title: IT Is a lot of batteries for the money!
review: Whoa! There is a lot of batteries for the price! I needed them for several remotes so I cannot comment on how long they would work in toys or other things. But Its the same ones that I have in my previous remote and it lasted almost a year!Great value for the money.

name: Amazon Customer
title: FROM AN AMAZON ADDICT... DO NOT PURCHASE!!!
review: DO NOT ORDER!!! I order EVERYTHING on Amazon but only 4 of these 36 batteries actually worked.. It didn't seem likely that all these batteries could be defective and I suspected my remote was faulty.. I tried a new universal remote, same results.. Then I tested each individual battery in a battery tester and sure as sh*t.... I just bought four batteries for the price of 36.... And a remote.... Do yourself a favor and stick to your local department store for batteries.. To those fixing to order, don't.. To those that already did... I hope you have a better experience than mine..

name: Justin M
title: Amazoningly Amazing!
review: Not sure what to say except these are such a great deal. So far the battery life is just as good as the name brands out there. Definitely consider these for your next battery shopping spree.

name: Sara J. Kelly
title: Great multipack of batteries
review: Oh these batteries! So neatly packaged in their tidy little box! My pepper grinder sat open, for only 2 days, awaiting the magical moment when these energy sources would arrive! Our remote control car goes faster and farther, thanks to these miraculous little buddies! My 5 year old can read late into the night, courtesy of a fresh pack of fuel cells in his flashlight. Thank you Amazon for providing the power for so many devices at a fantastic low price. We are forever grateful!

name: swassociates
title: Great value
review: I go through tons of AA and AAA batteries and these are now my go to brand. These over Costco for sure.

name: HP
title: These batteries do not last as long as the Duracell ones.
review: These batteries do not last as long as the Duracell ones. Will not be buying these in the future. Costco has great offers frm time to time on duracell batteries.

name: Uschir21
title: Not for long term use.
review: You get a great amount of batteries for the price. These do not last but 2 days in an LED fish tank light, and no more than a week in other devices. While they are a great price, they do not seem to last very long.

name: nigel
title: Great battery for the price!
review: It's a great price for batteries. These have a great battery life, comparable to any other name brand battery. I've sets of these batteries and a few devices for long periods of time and they have yet to corrode unless something got spilled on them.

name: Tony
title: Works but and capacity is the same as any AAA battery brand
review: If I'm going to get bulk batteries, there's definitely a particular bulk warehouse private brand that is cheaper and works just as well and has the same capacity.

name: Nakisha Greaves
title: Stick to Duracell
review: Bought these because I thought they would last longer than the ordinary ones in my Alexa remote seeing that they are Amazon but they don't last at all. They last only days. One week tops. Waste of $$$$

name: Crickle
title: Great buy for the $
review: Repeat buyer of the Amazon Basic batteries- best value I‚Äôve found. Have never had an issue with these & they seem to last longer than the Energizer ones I was buying previously.

name: themoreyouread
title: packaged well
review: We go through a lot of these, that's why I ordered this big amount.They seem to work fine but I haven't used them very long yet.Nice box for storing them in, too.

name: JDConsumer
title: Misleading Amazon Advertising
review: I searched for AA batteries and selected the option that appeared best, only to find upon delivery that they were AAA batteries. I did not search for AAA batteries. For Amazon to populate the choices with some AA battery options as well as some that look identical but are NOT AA is highly misleading.

name: Library Panda
title: Great batteries
review: These are very nice batteries in my OP they seem to be just as good as most name brand batteries not saying there too of the line or anything but they do a great job for the price much better than any other knock off batteries I've had

name: D8210
title: Pleasantly surprised
review: I was surprised when I saw this product. Amazon makes batteries? After reading some of the great reviews I decided to buy these. The price was great and after reading the reviews it was too difficult to not take a chance and try these out. I was definitely not disappointed. They perform well and get the job done. All of this at an excellent price. I won't hesitate to buy amazonbasics batteries again

name: Gigi0822
title: Great batteries, great price
review: Great batteries at a very reasonable price. I have switched to Amazon Basic batteries for quite some time ago and they last as long as the name brand batteries.

name: KA
title: WTF, Amazon? These batteries are crap
review: They're defective. I bought them to use for a headlamp when hiking or walking after dark, and they repeatedly ran out of juice after just a few minutes, leaving me literally in the dark. I tried them in a different headlamp to make sure it was the batteries and not the lamp, and the same thing happened. Amazon, WTF?

name: Victor
title: Cheap and alot of batteries
review: Its just batteries so I don't really have much to say on this. I give it one good thing they did. They divided the batteries by 4 so its nice if you want to share or give batteries to a friend who needs some. The price was pretty cheap for the amount of batteries you get.

name: JMR
title: These don't work. Get a name brand from a company that tests their products.
review: A pair of these lasted only a few months in a Polder kitchen timer that normally runs for years on a set. Then I checked the rest with a known good Snap-On voltmeter; these "new" batteries read 1.33 volts. New ones normally read 1.5 volts or a bit higher. These were dead on arrival. They do NOT have a shelf life of 10 years. Unable to return them because it took me too long to figure this out.Note: I gave 1 star per category because 0 stars is not an option.

name: BARRY DIXON - PATRICIA
title: DO NOT BUY
review: BATTERIES DONT LAST

name: Ben
title: Don‚Äôt listen to the negative reviews.
review: The batteries are legit and do work just as well as the ‚Äúname brand‚Äù batteries. Comes professionally packaged with shrink wrap around the batteries. Honestly sometimes when I read some of these reviews I actually wonder how these people function in life. Stories or corroded or dead batteries I guess is possible. Not likely though. Save yourself some money and buy these. I have bought three different occasions with no issues.

name: C L Jones
title: Very very short life
review: I bought these 6 months ago have had to replace them in the tv remote 3 times. I put cheep walmart batteries in the remote and the remote is still working 3 months later. I put them in a flash light and that dies in 1 monthIt's not worth getting these cheep batteries. They won't last.

name: Keith A.
title: Battery Life shorter than expected
review: The battery life is less than other brands. I switched back to a major name brand.HOWEVER, I have purchased so many Amazo Brand products and I Love them!

name: Special Edition
title: They're not worth it.
review: Very disappointed in theses batteries. Put them in 5 different devices and they didn't even last 3 weeks and all 5 devices went out at the same time, and I only used them for less than an hr only at night. Don't waste your money on these batteries, not worth it.

name: Electrosoft
title: Lots of power!
review: I've been using the 100-count for quite some time and they are still working as fresh as day one when I bought the pack. I use them for flashlights, robotics, scales and decorative candles mainly.

name: CaliGal
title: Perfect package of AAA
review: It's that time of year to replace the batteries in a couple of flashlights especially with the power shutoffs here in California. These were perfect for my two flashlights and had a couple left over. The brand is reliable and the price is reasonable.

name: Jasmin
title: Great value
review: Great value for what you‚Äôre getting. These are essential when you have a baby for all the toys. They also last a while. I would recommend this. I‚Äôve purchased both AA and AAA.

name: Daniel Collazo
title: They work
review: Great price! Got to me quick. They work and thats all I can really ask for. The duracell batterys that came with my remote lasted about 2 months. So if I get 2 months worth hopefully more I cant complain.

name: Albert
title: Good price and convenience but packaging can be improved.
review: I love the convenience of getting these affordable batteries via subscribe and save; rather than making a trip to Costco for Kirkland batteries. I would give 5 stars if the batteries were not wrapped in shrink wrap plastic - hard to open without scissors and creates more trash. Costco has better battery packaging.

name: C. Meyer
title: Low quality, low price
review: These batteries are cheap, both in price and quality. Don‚Äôt recommend putting them in anything important as they will leak battery acid. In fact they‚Äôre so shockingly low quality that I can, and did accidentally, crush the battery with one bare hand trying to get it out of the packaging. Wow.But if you have a bunch of cheap throwaway products you need to fill with batteries you won‚Äôt find a lower price... or quality.

name: wendy
title: Basics at a Great Price
review: We are going thru batteries quicker now that we are home working remotely - perfect items - perfect pricing - will be buying more in this size and other sizes

name: Jennifer Hansen
title: Weak!
review: I have had to replace all of the batteries I‚Äôve used from this brand already, within 3 months. I didn‚Äôt even use them in high demand items (wall clock, TV remote, computer mouse).

name: kb
title: Value
review: Last as long as the high price bunny brand

name: Jolanda B
title: Not the best batteries
review: Put them in my electric candles and some of them turned off after just a few hours. Weird, the batteries have been ok in a previous purchase.Update after several purchases. These batteries don‚Äôt last long at all!! Even a simple electric candle doesn‚Äôt last long.

name: L. Hyer
title: These batteries are not worth the money
review: After 3 months I had to replace the 4 batteries in my remote for the TV. The Duracell batteries lasted a year. Same thing with the track pad...just put these Amazon batteries in and barely 2 months later they need to be replaced. Yes, they are definitely cheaper than Duracell batteries, but I prefer quality and dependability.

name: Bill
title: Batteries leaked and Amazon WON'T warranty
review: Don't buy....you get what you pay for. The batteries leaked and I asked for them to be replaced but they refused because it was past the 1-year limited warranty. The description says there is a "10-year leak-free shelf life" and when I brought it to their attention they said it is backed up by their 1-year warranty, which was over. What?! That's totally backwards. There is a whole section of the listing that talks about how reliable they are but they can't replace them or refund my money when they do exactly the opposite? I expect better from Amazon.

name: El Conquistador
title: Batteries for everything it seems
review: We go through batteries like a fat lady at a buffet. Whether it is the tv remote, the vibrators, the flashlights or whatever...we change them a LOT. Amazon is dominating the marketplace with their own branded products and for the price, you can't go wrong here.

name: M. Paddock
title: Works great
review: Great for the money. No way I was gonna spend $50 on a battery-back up system. Was much more logical to get about 400 of these suckers and run them through a DC/AC transformer. Now i can have all the power I need without having to be ripped off by those over priced explosive Lithium Ion batteries.

name: Rico
title: Average
review: Average performance at an average price. Reliable expiration date. I think that there is confidence by using the Amazon name.

name: Nacho Libra
title: Great batteries
review: I always buy these, they last much longer than dollar store batteries, but not quite as long as the name-brands at the store that cost much more. No problems with leakage or exploding either.

name: Sandra C
title: Great Product!
review: Great Product!

name: Trudi Devine
title: Short life.
review: At about half the price of Duracells I thought these were a great deal and worth a try. When they arrived I replaced the batteries in my remote. They lasted 4 months and when I opened the remote the batteries had the white powder on them. They were leaking. Duracells last a year. So these are half the price, but last a third of the time.‚ÄòYou get what you pay for.‚Äô

name: Robert C. Nasir
title: Good batteries, in quantity, at a good price.
review: Lots of good quality batteries on the shelf, there when you need 'em, at a decent price. Seem to last as long as any mid-grade alkaline. What's not to like? Recommended.

name: Blaze & Melissa
title: Great battery
review: We love our amazon batteries great price great quality we have bought words of them. Our daughter has a lot of toys and they all seem to need batteries so Our go to is always amazon brand

name: Larry Davis
title: Value price super power long lasting
review: Very pleased with this amazing selection, not only did it same me time but a few dollars too. Didn‚Äôt thing it would but it did. And yes, would buy it again.

name: TFields
title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: These batteries were a waste of money!!!!! I bought these a month and a half ago and my tv remote batteries have died already!!!!!The last set of batteries I had in this remote lasted for over two years!!

name: Harvey Clyde
title: Good value.
review: Let's see how they last.

name: Mrsaj213
title: Unreturnable dead batteries
review: All the batteries were dead and didn‚Äôt even have enough juice to operate a wireless computer mouse. And on top of it Amazon is now allowing me to return it because it‚Äôs outside of the 30 day window. That‚Äôs what I get for trying to stock up on batteries and use them 35 days later. Shame on your Amazon. Your Your return policy on your own stuff is awful.

name: luvamazon
title: Terrible product! I would give a -1 if it were an option.
review: Very disappointed in this product. Will not purchase again. Does not hold a charge even for a small clock for more than a week. I have used other brands have lasted for years. My daughter-in-law had the same experience.

name: Lorraine M.
title: GOOD BATTERIES FOR REASONABLE PRICE
review: The price for the quantity is unbeatable. No remote comes with them so could not rate "Remote Control" and really can't rate the "Longevity" yet because I haven't had a chance to use them much to see how long they will last.

name: K.M.
title: Cheap, but don't last long
review: Thought this would be a good deal as the price is pretty reasonable. But I soon realized that I'm replacing batteries a lot more often then I ever have. I've had remotes that came with batteries included that look off brand and cheap, but then realized they lasted for years. Replaced some of those and now I'm changing the batteries every few months. So, yes they are cheap, but I guess there is a reason why they are. Will pay more next time for better batteries.

name: Rhonda
title: It is quite a bit cheaper to buy these batteries this way.
review: I like the bulk batteries. I use a lot of batteries for my candles and outside twinkle lights that are remote controlled. These batteries last just as long as if you bought them somewhere else.

name: Maggie Heffelfinger
title: Cheap
review: These batteries did not last long. They are just slightly better than the Harbor Freight batteries. No competition to name brand batteries. I bought AA and AAA. Both types performed much worse than expected.

name: Sunny Doodle
title: MY FAVORITE BATTERIES
review: I am very picky about the batteries I use. I always used duracell. Ever since I tried Amazon brand, It is the only one I use. They last just as long, maybe longer.

name: Dave_H
title: Works great for the price!!
review: Simply awesome. Came on time and works well. Also price is very competitive to some other known brands out there.Only area where they can improve a bit is packaging. If you open one all are exposed so if they can give better casing it would be great.

name: A. Richardson
title: NEEDS A URGENT RECALL - FIRE HAZARD - BEWARE Some of the batteries get VERY VERY hot.
review: Fire hazard. Some of the batteries get very very hot. Luckily I noticed the excessive heat before I went to bed, because I don't think I would have ever waken up. I inserted a pair into my remote control, and within 30-minutes they got very hot. Once I removed the batteries, I noted that this was the only component that heated. I tried it again just to ensure it wasn't the remote, but yup its the batteries.

name: Michele C
title: Long lasting
review: These batteries are a great value and long lasting. I would definitely recommend to my family and friends

name: john derenze
title: GREAT BATTERIES  GREAT PRICE
review: GREAT BATTERIES

name: HAROLD HUNTER
title: Value for the money.
review: These batteries go for a really long time in all our remotes through out the house. 100 triple A's for $20.00 now that's a good deal. I was sold on these batteries when they came with my first fire stick. Great product!

name: Trudi Clay
title: Do not buy
review: I bought these batteries for my remotes and I have to replace them within weeks. I went back to buying batteries at Costco. Do not waste your money on this product.

name: Thomas
title: There are cheaper options
review: It‚Äôs good stuff. Working pretty well. But I found out that the batteries in Costco or Walmart are all actually cheaper than this. Not sure if there are any difference tho.

name: randy jordan
title: Not so great....
review: A great price, to be sure...but EVERY flameless candle I have put these into has been very dim. When I replaced with Duracell (and local grocery store brand as well) the candles are noticeably brighter. Don't think I'll be buying AmazonBasics batteries again soon -- which is a bummer. I have always been impressed with Amazon-brand products but these batteries are all that.

name: Casey
title: PRICE & PACKAGING ü§û
review: Maybe I should wait on this. Remote control going strong but I cannot seculate on how long. I do give you permission to include a score if you have the calculation. Just do it.

name: Kris Kidd
title: Great price and close to the longevity of me brands.
review: I've purchased these before. They are good batteries. Not much to say.They don't seem to last as long as the top brands, but they still last quite a while. Pretty close.At such a low price, I wouldn't even consider buying the more expensive brands that might cost double.And I like that it comes in such a large quantity. This many batteries will last me a long time.

name: Ron M
title: The life of batteries
review: Have no idea what ‚Äúremote control‚Äù means. But the over all rating would be good. Good product, good price, of course only used a couple batteries but good strength. I‚Äôm satisfied.

name: dena l.
title: Great value
review: Let's be honest you can't get batteries for a better price than Amazon. These batteries last forever are delivered quickly and are a great value for the money. These are a must buy

name: chauncey2
title: AWESOME batt's at an AWESOME price
review: I have now used these in every size & I can truly state these last just as long as the ProCells for a lot les $$$.I use them a lot in my BOSE head sets which will use up a lot of batts when cranked.These actually last longer than other batts from the big boys except the ProCells, which may be what these are

name: khalia Spencer
title: I keep buying these, they are that good
review: I will continue to buy these batteries they are that good. The price and how many you receive is awesome for such good batteries. They are long lasting.

name: Summer
title: Great deal for the price.
review: We got a box last year for Christmas(2018) because most of the toys needed AAA. None of the toys have needed replacement batteries except one that gets played with daily. Our tv remote has been replaced a few times but no more then usual.

name: brad
title: DO NOT BUY!!
review: Worst batteries ever. And I say that cause I don‚Äôt want to curse on here. They don‚Äôt work long at all. Learned the hard way, put them in a trail camera. Came back excited to see what‚Äôs on camera. All the cameras were dead after one day. So I opened new pack at home and they barely read 1.2 volts. Waste of money and lost of two months.

name: Drew
title: High quality batteries for a real discount
review: I have bought several products from the Amazon basics line of products and continue to be impressed with everything they have made. The batteries are as you would expect AA size batteries to be. They have a good weight to the batteries, not like cheap dollar store batteries.They seem to power all my devices, including high current devices well. So far they have not leaked or cause any problems. I feel for the price you cannot beat the quality of these batteries.I would recommend the purchase of these batteries.

name: samantha hicks
title: I purchase 2 every month on subscription
review: These are just as good as your name brand high dollar batteries most of the time. Occasionally I‚Äôll get a batch that seem to have less juice, but they are batteries that‚Äôs to be expected I think. I‚Äôll continue on until I don‚Äôt need the batteries anymore.

name: Barbara Shipka
title: all 10 of them are working fine now and the new batteries have been in them ...
review: Do not buy! The 'best' ones lasted less than an hour in a light that requires three! Some dimmed immediately and lasted only a few minutes. Since all of the lights failed, I first assumed it was the lights. Then I thought, well, perhaps it's worth it to change the batteries and see what happens. Sure enough.
